Firangiz has been in the business of selling groceries for six years.  At this time she needs 2000 AZN to expand the store so she can sell more groceries.

loans.use: To expand the store

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux, dans le quartier Dougounina de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de mariage et de commerce. 
Après avoir correctement remboursés, les quatre prêts précédents, ce groupe est à son cinquième et MAYON D. compte utiliser le sien pour acheter, des bassines de savons traditionnels appelé ‘’Gabacourouni’’ auprès des forains venant des grandes villes telles Sikasso et Bamako. Elle effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans les foires de différents villages environnants Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt MAYON D. compte obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 105.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans les activités et l’autre partie dans les dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
The members of Benkadi Group ("Harmony") are married women. On average, they are 37 years old and have four children. They live in large traditional families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husbands. They live in the neighborhood of Dougounina of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have known each other through ties of kinship and business.

After having properly repaid its four previous loans, the group applies now for its fifth loan. Mayon Diakité wants to use her share of the loan to buy bowlfuls of traditional soap called "Gabacourouni" from traveling merchants coming from large cities such as Sikasso and Bamako. She retails the soap for cash or credit at the markets in the villages of the Bougouni area, as well as from her home. Her clientele is made up of men and women.

Thanks to this loan, Mayon Diakité expects to make a monthly profit of 105,000 CFA francs. She will invest it partly in her business and spend it partly on household needs.

loans.use: To buy traditional soap

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira I. is from the town of Talibon Bohol. She is 40 years old and has been a food vendor since 2000. She has five children. She works so hard from morning to evening to be able to save enough money for her family.

Funding from CEVI will help her expand her business. She would like to apply for a loan of 6,000 PHP. This would make her business competitive and more profI..

The income she will be able to generate will help her family buy adequate supplies of food and other basic needs.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Né vers 1959 à SAN, préfecture du même nom, région de Ségou, Amadou K. n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, alors il embrassa tôt les activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce de céréales avec son père. Il est marié à une épouse et  père de 8 enfants. Il vit chez lui même dans le quartier DALLAN de la préfecture de San.  
Il est dans le domaine du commerce de céréales depuis maintenant 30 ans, et l’exerce actuellement pour lui même au grand marché  de San depuis 20 ans. Il est très sollicité lors  des foires hebdomadaires de San  ville et environnants.  
Pour augmenter la taille de son activité, il décida de faire recours à l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans.  Il est à son 3ème  prêt individuel. Monsieur Amadou K. compte acheter, 4 tonnes de riz décortiqués, 2 tonnes de petits mils, 3,5 tonnes de mils et 2 tonnes de haricot. Il s’approvisionnait  auprès des commerçants grossistes de San, mais avec l’augmentation du fonds de commerce, il compte aller jusque chez les producteurs pour  s’approvisionner. Il vend tous les jours au grand marché de San et dans les foires hebdomadaires à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes, à crédit et au comptant. 
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 130 000FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour rembourser le prêt, payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, acheter la nourriture et investir le reste dans d’autres activités de revenus .
Il ambitionne solliciter un financement plus important qui pourra lui permettre d’agrandir son activité et par conséquent augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour qu’il puisse améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Born around 1959, in the town and prefecture of San, Ségou region, Amadou K. did not have the opportunity to go to school, so early on, he became involved in revenue-producing activities, in particular, selling cereal with his father. 

He is married and the father of eight children. He lives in his own house in the Dallan neighborhood, San prefecture. He has been in the buisness of selling cereal for 30 years now, and he has been working for himself at the grand market of San for 20 years. Amadou is very much in demand during the weekly fairs in San and the surrounding area. 

To increase his business, he decided to turn to micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. He is on his third personal loan. Mr. Amadou K. plans to buy 4 tons of husked rice, 2 tons of pearl millet, 3.5 tons of millet and 2 tons of beans. He obtains his supplies from the wholesalers in San, but with this increase in his capital, he plans to buy directly from the producers. 

He sells everyday at the  grand market in San and at the weekly fairs to customers who are both men and women, on credit  or in cash. He hopes to make a monthly profit of 130,000 CFA francs which he plans to use to repay the loan, pay for his children's schooling, buy food and and invest the rest in other income-producing activities. His goal is to ask for a bigger loan which will allow him to expand his business, increase his turnover and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cereal

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. is currently in the business of operating a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more food stuffs in her restaurant like rice, sugar, meat, onions, fish, etc. Mary is 28 years old, divorced, and has 2 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more food stuffs in her restaurant like rice, sugar, meat, onions, fish, etc.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mr. Hong M. is a 28 year old married man, and is a villager who lives in Krabau village in Kandal province.  He is a farmer who owns a plot of land that he uses to cultivate rice for a living. With this farming, he faces a problem because he does not have enough money to cultivate rice. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticide, and rice seed and hire laborers to plow his farm. His wife, Mrs. Par Eun, 30 years old, works as seamstress in a garment factory. This couple has two children: One is attending in a local school and the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticide, and rice seed and hire laborers to plow his farm.

loans.name: Noemie

texts.en: Noemie is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and trisikad (a pedicab or a bicycle with a rider seat attached on the side) operating. She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending and trisikad businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Noemie is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Noemie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Gina Lisbeth

texts.es:
Gina tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo cuenta con una experiencia de más de 1 año en el negocio sus ventas son de forma diaria algunas veces ella  sale a ofrecer sus productos y  deja a pedido y le van pagando de forma diaria o semanal según sea el caso. Clienta realiza dos campañas mensuales. Además cuenta con un stock variado de  productos de belleza que exhibe en su casa. El negocio le hace sentir activa y con las ganancias que obtiene se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia, solventando sus gastos económicos personales.

Gina desea ampliar sus negocio con la compra de más productos de belleza, ya que durante esta temporada la demanda aumenta. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gina is 20 years old, single, and resides with her family in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone located in the region and province of Piura, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Gina sells beauty products by catalog. She can count on more than a year of experience in the business. She sells every day, by going out or taking orders. Her customers pay either daily or weekly, as the case may be. Clients participate in 2 campaigns each month. Also she can count on a varied stock of beauty products on display in her home.

The business makes Gina feel active, and with the earnings she obtains, she helps advance her family, covering all her personal expenses. She wants to expand her business by buying more beauty products, since during this season demand has expanded. For that reason, she has requested a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 700 new sols.

loans.use: BUYING BEAUTY PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Rico, who is 44 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 8 to 20 years old. One of the children has his own family and the other two are currently going to school. Annabelle joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Annabelle has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000 to pirchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's education and future family needs. Annabelle is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Edwin Jose

texts.es:
Edwin Jose A. P.  tiene 18 años, es  soltero, vive con los padres en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.
	
Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, arroz, maracayá en pocas cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Edwin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cría de chanchos. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz además para insumos para los cultivos y comprar de comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un taller mecánico.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Edwin Jose A. P. is 18, and single, with no children. He lives with his parents in Chillanes Canton in Bolívar Province. He enjoys sports.
	
The JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS [Together We Make Progress] Communal Bank is located in Recinto Matilde Esther in Chillanes Canton. The communal bank's 12 members do short-cycle agricultural work, planting corn, rice, and passionfruit in small quantities and raising animals such as pigs and hens.

Edwin works farming corn and raising pigs. He buys his products in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells them in the market in Chillanes on Sundays.

He requests the loan so he can plant corn and also rice, to purchase supplies for the crops, and to buy food for the animals. The support of this loan will help him financially meet his needs, and face challenges such as insect infestations, illnesses, and the vagaries of the weather. His dream is to have a mechanic's shop.

loans.use: to plant corn and rice and to purchase supplies

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 36-year-old single man who works in construction, specializing in pasting tiles. Ali is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools that help in doing his business faster and in a very professionA. way, some of these tools are used to cut and curve the tiles to fit exactly the requested area in addition to pay for continuing building his house. 

Ali is a talented person. He is an honest builder as his clients describe him. He hopes to expand his business and make a small happy family which he can provide a happy and healthy living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 64 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas, vive con su esposo únicamente pues sus hijos ya formaron sus propios hogares, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, trabaja en su casa, no tiene un horario, y actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y gallinas, pequeños, ya que iniciara el cuido para el proceso de engorde.
Esto le permitirá en el futuro contar con suficientes animales en su granja para vender cuando estén en su peso correcto, permitiéndole recuperar su gasto y teniendo un margen de ganancia.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, ampliarlo, para dar a su familia un futuro más cómodo y estable.
texts.en:
Maria is 64 years old and lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel. She raises pigs and chickens. She lives only with her husband, since her children have already made their own homes. This business came from her own initiative. She works at home and does not have a fixed schedule. She currently needs a loan to buy little pigs and chickens so she can start the process of fattening them up. This will permit her in the future to have sufficient animals in her farm to sell when they weigh enough, allowing her to cover her expenses and to make a profit. 
Her aspiration is to grow in her business and expand it, in order to give her family a more comfortable and stable future.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis de 27 años. Es un joven emprendedor que empezó su actividad alquilando taxi y un día tomo la decisión de comprarse su propio vehículo para así ser independiente.

El labora todos los días recorriendo por todos lados. Le dificultad mucho la delincuencia ya que las calles están peligrosas. Es separado tiene 2 hijos pequeños que mantener. Con el préstamo desea comprar otro vehículo para aumentar sus ingresos y darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is 27 years old, a young entrepreneur who began working by renting a taxi and, one day, decided to buy his own vehicle in order to be independent.

He works every day driving all the streets. The problem of delinquency presents difficulties, because all the streets are dangerous. He is separated and has 2 small children to maintain.

With the loan, he wants to buy another vehicle, in order to increase his income and provide as best he can for his children.

loans.use: to buy a car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Alicia, ella tiene 29 años la socia es conviviente, ella tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad, la socia tiene un restaurante con su tia, pero la socia también alterna esta actividad con sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia es nueva en el banco comunal su tia la invito a formar parte de este grupo y los otros miembros la aceptaron porque ella es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora. La socia desea el crédito para poder implementar su tienda con productos de primera necesidad al por mayor y también el restaurante como las dos trabajan en sociedad deben invertir a la mitad en el mismo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “PRO DESARROLLO” and is located in the town of Pisac belonging to Calca Province, Cusco Department.

Alicia, 29, is the member.  She has a spouse and two children who are 9 and 6 years of age.  She runs a restaurant with her aunt but she also alternates this activity with running a grocery store.  She is new to the communal bank; her aunt invited her to be part of this group and the other members accepted her because she’s a responsible, hard working woman.

She wants the loan to buy basic need items for her store at wholesale and also for the restaurant since they both work in partnership and have to invest half in it.  She wants the loan to invest in her businesses.

She is grateful and expresses that she will meet her repayment obligations in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store and invest in her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and three school-age children. She has owned a small shop for the past five years where she offers her clients all beauty services such as make-up. In addition, she sells different beauty products. Her products are fabricated with premium components and she even offers her clients testers before any purchases to make sure that the products are 100 % clean and don’t cause infections or allergies.  Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional products in order to increase her sales and her income. She is very positive about the future of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles, tiene 28 años, es casada con 2 hijos de 8 y 6 años.
Se dedica a la fabricación de Retablos Ayacuchanos, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de: yeso, clavos, goma, pintura, harina. Sandra y su esposo se dedica a la fabricación de Retablos Ayacuchanos, ambos provienen de padres artesanos se conocieron se casaron y desarrollan ese arte, atienden pedidos su esposo viaja a las ferias a exponer sus trabajos. Le gusta FINCA Perú porque les enseñan los valores, a ahorrar y en las capacitaciones le hablan del matrimonio, familia, negocios y es bueno porque aprenden más. Si tuvo algunas dificultades a veces cuando le hacen pedidos no le llegan a pagar en su totalidad. Su sueño es construir su casa y poder exportar sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the communal bank Los Claveles. She is a 28-year-old married mother of two. Her children are 8 and 6 years old. She earns her living making Ayacuchan retablos (wooden boxes decorated with images and customs of the area). She plans to use the loan to purchase: plaster, nails, glue, paint and flour. 

Sandra and her husband make Ayacuchan retablos. Their parents are all artisans too. They met, got married and developed their art and now they process orders together. Her husband travels to fairs to show their work. Sandra likes FINCA Peru because it teaches people values like saving money. Also, during trainings they talk about marriage, family and business, which is good because they learn more this way. Sometimes she has had trouble when people order retablos but then can't pay in full. Sandra's dream is to build her own house and export her work.

loans.use: to purchase: plaster, nails, glue, paint and flour.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married with two grown daughters, Anna and Irina. She is a market vendor from Melitopol. Larisa sells women's clothing in the local ‘Rizhskyi' market. 

Seventeen years of working in the business have taught her to be an efficient manager of her funds and resources. Currently, Larisa has 50,000 grivnyas invested in inventory. Her profit is about 7,500 grivnyas a month. 

Larisa is requesting a loan of 12,000 grivnyas to purchase assorted seasonal clothing for her female customers. Additional income will be re-invested in further growth of the trade as well as in the improvement of her living conditions. 

Larisa is hoping to open one more vending facility in the near future, thus expanding her trade as a result.

loans.use: to purchase summer merchandise

loans.name: Allégresse Plus Group

texts.en:
Léontine is the chairwoman of the community bank named “Allégresse Plus”. It is composed of 24 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Léontine is 57 years old, married and the mother of five children whose ages range from 19 to 41 years old. Only one of her children goes to school. Léontine's main activity is selling secondhand clothing and she has been active in her business for years. She began her business by operating a general store. Léontine also sells drinks. Her business is prospering and it generates a profit of $300 per month. Léontine intends to use this loan to increase her stock of goods by buying a bundle of secondhand clothing to resell at a profit in order to increase her capital. Her ambition is to become a secondhand clothing provider in her area. Léontine works hard in order to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods by buying a bundle of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urquillos en la Provincia de Calca y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irene; la socia tiene 70 años de edad, la socia es viuda; La socia tiene 5 hijos; la socia de dedica a la compra y venta de verduras  y a la agricultura como primera actividad económica, la socia requiere en esta oportunidad el crédito para invertir en la compra de semillas de maíz blanco para el nuevo cultivo, la socia no produce verduras por lo que ella tiene que comprar de otras personas que le dejan en partes, ella paga la primera parte y le van dando poco a poco las verduras para que estas no se le malogren luego la socia les paga al cabo de un mes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de maíz y el pago final a su proveedor de verduras como zanahoria, tomate, y verduras en general.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Irene, 70, is a member of the “Reyna de Los Angeles de Urquillos” communal bank located in Urquillos District in Calca Province and Cusco Department.

She is a widow and has five children.  She is a vegetable merchant and a farmer; these are her main economic activities.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy white corn seeds for the new crops.  She does not produce vegetables so she has to buy them from others who let her get them in parts.  She pays the first part and then they gradually resupply her with vegetables so that they don’t spoil.  A month later she pays them.  She is asking for the loan to buy corn seeds and to make the final payment to her vegetable supplier for carrots, tomatoes and vegetables in general.

She is grateful for the support she’ll get and at the same time commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Anavil

texts.en:
41-year-old Anavil earns a living through farming. She has a 10-year-old child. Anavil hires a few laborers from her town to help till her land. She grows rice crops to sell. Anavil works hard to send her child to school and to improve their living conditions.

Anavil has requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She will also pay the laborers she hired to help till her farm. Anavil hopes to reach her dreams in life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: 11.4 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. An has a manufacturing business making wine. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

An is 54 years old and she is married with one child. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 11.4 Đông Vệ solidarity group. An lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is An's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. An has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that An faces in her business is the lack of capital.

An hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her child to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make wine to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 30-year-old hardworking man living in his own house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been farming and riding a motorcycle for three years and this has facilitated him to build a permanent house and provide for his children. His hardship is road accidents and his vision is buying another motorcycle and finishing his house. Richard needs the loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 47 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Guadalaupe que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser agrícola, ganadería y turismo.

María tiene como actividad laboral la confección y venta de prendas de vestir, desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene en su domicilio, cuenta con su propia clientela y también realiza trabajos a pedidos, la competencia en el rubro no es mucha, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 800 para comprar material y dar mantenimiento a su máquina,  así pueda seguir brindando un buen servicio y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le han hecho, lo que le permitirá tener más ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida.  María con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar su negocio adelante y a superarse en la vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
María is a 47-year-old mother.  She lives with her family in her own house, with water and electricity, in the Guadalupe district in the department of La Libertad.  This area is known for agriculture, livestock, and tourism.

María's work is making and selling clothes.  For several years she has had her business in her home.  She has her own clientele and also takes orders.  There is not much competition in this line of work.  With her earnings she will be able to cover her daily household expenses. 

She has requested a loan of 800 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa's "Seed Capital" program to buy supplies and to do maintenance on her machine.  In this way she can continue offering a good service and fulfilling the orders she has received, which will allow her to have more profit to improve her quality of life.  With much effort and work, María has been able to nurture her business and improve herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies (fabric and thread) and to do maintenance on her sewing machines.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is a 42-year-old married woman with two sons. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in the construction field.
Thao has run a food stall in front of their house for the past six years. She sells many kind of soups and noodles. Thao would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing more furniture, cooking appliances, and good quality materials. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture, cooking appliances, and good quality materials.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is from the village of Gumbauan, Echague, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Lucena is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lucena owns and operates a business managing food production and sales. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish and bananas to the community. Aside from that, she also manages vegetable production to earn additional income. She has been engaged in her businesses for more than 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.
	
Lucena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan amounting to 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase dried fish, bananas, and candles to sell in her village. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to cover her household's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, bananas, and candles to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy works hard to support her family. Joy is married and has a business of buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

Joy requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of rice to sell.

Joy has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Joy would like to save enough to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice to sell

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La socia actualmente tiene 56 años D. edad; la socia no ha variado D. actividad en este tiempo ella continua con sus actividades normales y al igual que los últimos meses ella se a estado dedicando a laborar en la municipalidad, y paralelamente a esto cría animales menores como chanchos y aves D. corral, la socia venD. los animales a sus compañeros que viven en otras provincias y desean comprar chancho para algun agazajo u otro evento, la socia desea invertir el credito en la compra D. animales menores ella comprara chanchos tiernos para críar y engordar y vender.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 56 years old at present. This is a successive loan and she has not altered her economic activity -- she continues her normal activities. Just as in recent months, she continues to work for the municipality, and parallel to that, she raises farm animals such as pigs and chickens. 

Maria Isabel sells these animals to her customers who live in other provinces and wish to buy pigs for a major celebration or other event. 

Maria Isabel plans to invest this loan in purchasing animals. She will buy young pigs to raise, fatten, and sell.

loans.use: to invest in young pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is 27-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and two siblings, both of whom are working. In 2007, he opened a barbershop in his town after seeing a need for such service in the region.  He has 12 years of experience working in this field; he learned this occupation as a young man. Today, he is requesting to borrow $400 from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new shaving tools and other products for his barbershop. In the future, he plans to open a new branch of his shop.

loans.use: To purchase new shaving tools and other products for his barbershop

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with five schoolgoing children. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to providing the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Rehema has operated a tailoring and cloth-selling business for the past 15 years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of inadequate funds to run her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 20,000 KES, Rehema wants to purchase more fabrics and cloths for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and cloths for her business.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Zavala, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 7  filhos 5 dos quais frequentam a Escola e 2  já casados. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua sogra que vive com ele. 

Saiu de Zavala para Maputo em missão de serviço.É Bombeiro de Serviço Nacional de Salvação Publica ha mais de 29 anos e tem um salario de .00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos.Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa ( chapas, pedra, cimento, areia, ferro e outros).O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 15.000.00mt, para habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa e mais tarde construir um estabelecimento comercial, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Leonardo was born in the district of Zavala, in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. He is married and has seven children, two of whom are married and five of whom are still in school. He went to school through the sixth grade, but had to drop out because of his parents' financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports his sister-in-law, who lives with him.
He left Zavala for Maputo to complete his military service. He's been a firefighter with the Serviço Nacional de Salvação Publica for more than 29 years. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in his bank account (BIM). 
He's never had a loan from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his second loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (sheet metal, stone, cement, sand, iron, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. The first loan was for 15,000, which he also used for the house. He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish his house and build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sheet metal, stone, cement, sand, iron, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin has worked in farming for the last five years, and earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000. He is 29 years old, and married to Mary. They do not have children yet. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 30, 000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan to purchase animal feed.

He will save his profits and also provide for his family's basic needs. In the future he hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe is 22 years old and single. She owns and operates a business venture selling fried foods in the local community. She has many years of experience in this business. Lupe needs a loan of 1000 WST to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST or $167 USD per week) to financially support the immediate members of her family and to upgrade her business status.

Lupe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Lupe's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Symphrose

texts.en:
Symphrose is 22 years old and married with three children. She sells juice, water, biscuits, pampers, etc. Her business runs from 6 am until 8 pm every day and she has two years of experience. Symphrose currently employs one person to help her.

Symphrose has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her supermarket by buying more juice, water, biscuits, pampers, etc. to sell. With any profit, Symphrose will be able to reinvest in her business and save money for her future.

loans.use: to expand her supermarket by buying more juice, water, biscuits, pampers, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz Mery ha sido una persona que se ha visto marcada por la falta de oportunidades en su vida. Se ha capacitado como secretaria, sin embargo le ha sido muy difícil conseguir un empleo, por lo que decidió montar su negocio para poder aportar a los gastos del hogar y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Luz Mery tiene como su prioridad el mejorar la calidad de vida de sus 2 hijos, y poder brindarles la oportunidad de acceder a una buena educación. Luz Mery se dedica a atender su negocio de café Internet, y gracias a esto genera ingresos suficientes como para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Con el ánimo de hacer atractivo su negocio para los clientes, Luz Mery ha incluido en los productos y servicios que ofrece, el servicio de telefonía tanto nacional como internacional, servicio de impresiones, venta de dulces, entre otros más, y gracias a esto sus clientes se han identificado con el café Internet de Luz Mery. Actualmente, y como inicio de la temporada escolar, Luz Mery recibe muchos pedidos por parte de sus clientes de productos de papelería, sin embargo ella no tiene incorporado este producto entre los que vende. Es por esto que Luz Mery aspira a que un préstamo el permita acceder a la compra de productos de papelería como cuadernos, borradores, lapiceros, entre otros y poder así aumentar sus ventas y su nivel de ingresos.
Luz Mery sueña con que su negocio le pueda generar unos ingresos superiores a los que le genera actualmente, y así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su esposo y a sus 2 hijos. 
Además de esto, Luz Mery aspira a estudiar programación y reparación de computadores, y poder ofrecer este servicio a sus clientes para que así su negocio sea más atractivo y ella pueda satisfacer todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Luz Mery has had a life marked by a lack of opportunities. She is trained as a secretary but had a very hard time finding a job, so she decided to open up her own business to be able to cover her housing expenses and basic necessities for her husband and 2 children. Her top priority is to improve the quality of life for her kids and to be able to give them opportunities for a good education. 

Luz Mery has an internet cafe, and the income from this has been enough to cover their basic needs. With the goal of making her business more attractive for customers, she also offers services like national and international telephone calls, printing, and selling candies and other things. Because of this, her customers like her cafe. Luz Mery wants a loan to buy school products like notebooks, erasers, pencil cases and other things to increase her sales and income.

Luz Mery dreams of a business that makes more money so that she can have a better quality of life for her husband and 2 kids. She also wants to study computer repair and programming so that she can offer those services to her customers, making it more attractive, and to be able to satisfy all of her needs.

loans.use: to buy school supply products like notebooks, pencil cases, erasers and other things so that she can offer her customers more variety.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a widow and has 8 children. She sells limes and yams in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, which she has done for 22 years. Abena uses her income to pay for all household expenses and for her children's school fees. Abena will use the loan to purchase yams and limes in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to help her children succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase yams and limes in bulk.

loans.name: Elodia

texts.en: Elodia was born in Monterrey, Mexico. She is married and has four sons. To develop her family's economy she decided to invest all her savings in a Taco Kiosk. She started her micro business in 1996 with a little help from one of her sons and they called it “TACOS KOKIS” and actually sell Tacos of many different flavors every morning. Elodia's kiosk lets her educate all her sons and two of them graduated from a technical program, and actually all of them are married. She has two people as employees, one is her daughter in-law and the other one is her nephew. This is because she receives 60 tacos orders on average every morning. Cecilia works outside her house and she will use this loan to grow her business in front of her house because the clients suffer the weather inclemencies. For example, in the case of rain or very cold weather, her sales increase as well.

loans.use: She works outside her house and with this loan she wants to invest in her business because her clients suffers the weather inclemencies, for example, if it is raining or maybe is so cold outside, for this reason she wants to grow her business infront of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expansion of her farming business

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun S. is 51 years old and works at a small private company earning $2/day.  She lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 4 children.  Her husband and 2 of the kids work as mechanics and earn $12/day combined.  One of the other children works at a local hotel and also contributes to the household income.  Oun S. will use this loan to buy a motobike for her family to get to and from work.  This will save the family money in the long run, as well as time.  In the future, Oun S. wants to help her husband make his shop larger, and she'd also like to improve her home.

loans.use: To buy a motobike for transportation to work

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
My name is Rosa Idalia, I’m a merchant, I have a small local store called “El Campo” in my house. I’m a single mother of one child who is in school and this business generates an income to cover my family’s expenses. At present the sales volume is bigger therefore I need to buy more merchandise to be able to offer a larger variety of products to my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Rosa Idalia, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, llamada Pulperia "El Campo" la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera y tengo un hijo el que esta estudiando, actualmente el volumen de venta es mayor por lo que necesito surtir mi negocio y poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos.

loans.use: Buy chicken, soft drinks, soap, sugar, rice, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda Q. and Doris Calderon belong to a village bank called “Solidaridad,” which means “Solidarity”. As part of the village bank, they receive a loan together and the responsibility for repayment rests on both of them. They are asking for a total loan of US$ 850 which will be divided between them.

Hilda Q. D. C. owns a wonderful little “panadería” (bakery) close to the main plaza in Ayacucho. 300-400 loaves of fresh breads and sweets are baked every morning and every evening. Types of bread incluD. “francés”, “bizcochos”, “chapla”, “wawa,” and “pionono”. Chapla is the most popular bread all year round, being a traditional food of the Peruvian highlands. It resembles an English muffin, but it has a hollow insiD.. People eat it with jam, butter, cheese, vegetables, or meat. The large chapla is sold for 0.20 nuevos soles ($0.07), while the small chapla is sold for 0.10 nuevos soles ($.04). From August to October, Pan D. "Wawa" (baby in Quechua), an infant-shaped bread that is meant to be consolation for women who became pregnant during Carnaval in February, is very popular.

Hilda begins her day at 5 am and finishes at 7pm. She works in the bakery with her husband of five years and her mother and sisters. Her two children both attend school. Hilda and her friend, Doris, are asking for a loan of US$ 850 to share. Hilda plans to use her share of the money to purchase flour, butter, sugar, and other materials to create new varieties of breads and sweets for her customers to try.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter, sugar and other materials to create new varieties of breads and sweets for her customers to try

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is 37 and married with two children of her own and 3 orphan children. She has a cosmetics shop which she has operated for the last year. She stocks a good variety of cosmetics, though in small quantities and prices to meet the income of the rural areas. She plans to use her loan to purchase more cosmetics for her store and to start buying at wholesale so she can to sell to other stores. She is very motivated and hopes to grow her business. She is well known in the community and offers a wonderful product.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and to start buying wholesale

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar A.  is a 24-year-old married woman who breeds animals in the Bilasuvar region in the southern part of Azerbaijan, . She is an  internally displaced person from the occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. She has 3 years of experience in animal breeding. Gulnar purchased a small calf, raised it and than sold for a higher price for meat production to the local bazaar traders.
The meat is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people eat fresh meat every day in their homes and cafes.
Gulnar and her husband are unemployed and raising cattle is the only  source of income for their family. Gulnar has one son and one daughter. Covering family needs is getting harder and harder as the children grow up. She has applied for a 700 USD loan with a repayment term 15 month to purchase two calves and fodder. The estimated cost for one calf is 200-300 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Pharn V., 46, is a mother of three children and lives in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and one of her children are employed by a private company as cleaners earning collectively about $4 each day, while her husband can typically make around $4/day in revenue from working as a mechanic. Mrs. Pharn Ry hopes the loan will help her purchase a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her family’s transportation

loans.name: Miralam

texts.en: Miralam H. lives in the Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 59 years old, married and has two children. He is engaged in cattle-breeding like other people in his village. He has good experience in this business. He applied to the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $700 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: John

texts.en: John has been running his business for 21 years on a small scale.  With his last loan, he purchased one sewing machine and some sewing materials to expand the business.  He also employed one tailor to assist with the sewing of men’s clothing.  He would like to expand his business and is therefore requesting for a loan of $350. for that purpose.

loans.use: John has had great success with his business since his last loan with SMT, and he hopes Kiva will help him continue to increase his production of men's clothing.

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en: Group leader P. Z. is from Depalpur, a small town in Pakistan, and is married with seven children. Her eldest son works with her husband while all her other children attend school, except the youngest who is not of school age yet.  Her husband trades used items and has been in this business for more than ten years. P. would like to take out a loan with several other women, who are: Fazeelat B., who requires this loan to expand her family's salt store; Reshman B., whose husband works in construction and wants to buy few tools; Faiza P., whose husband runs a beetle- nut counter; and Khursheed B., who is a widow and is borrowing for her son, who manufactures traditional beds (charpai) out of wood.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan of $1,175.00.

loans.use: Expand used-items business.

loans.name: Abdulhay

texts.ru:
Abdulhay Y. lives in the Vakhsh area. He is 56 years old and has a university degree in economics. He lives with his wife and child. He has a small and close family. Abdulhay buys and re-sells calves. He keeps the calves for some time to fatten up and then re-sells them. The profits from this business support his family. Abdulhay would like to expand the business to sell more calves. Expanding his business will also result in more good quality meat being available at the local market. In order to expand he needs financial help and so has requested a loan. Abdulhay plans to repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: To buy more calves

loans.name: Anwar's Group

texts.en:
Anwar, the wife of Mr. A. H., is a mother of two beautiful daughters. Anwar B. is a fruitseller. She lives with her big dreams in a big country called Pakistan. Anwar’s dream is to see her daughters educated and qualified in every field. Her husband is a driver and he drives three wheel vehicles called Auto-rickshaws. She successfully completed a loan from Asasah, a microfinance Institute in Pakitstan. Anwar B. applied a loan to expand her fruit business.

Anwar has been joined in her group by a few more members who are: Maqboola B. who wants a loan for her fruit business; Zahida B. who wants a loan to start her electric supplies (tube lights) business; Nasreen B. is applying for a loan to start her fruit business; and Parveen B. wants to start her cloth business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to expand their businesses and fulfill their dreams.

loans.name: Kak

texts.en: Kak L., 44, is married and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh. She works selling fish in a busy market near her house, and makes on average $4/day. Her husband is a farmer and makes less than one dollar every day. This couple has two children, one of whom is employed as a garment worker and the other one helps doing the housework. Kak would like a loan from Kiva for her husband to purchase more land to grow rice.

loans.use: To purchase more land to grow rice.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia works raising animals, something she has done since she was a girl. She grew up surrounded by sown fields and young animals which her parents raised and she learned how to care for and sell. Now she is a mother of three children and does this activity in order to pay for various household expenses. She gets up very early in the morning to take her livestock to pasture, and is waiting for the vaccines and medicines for the livestock’s development, in order to then sell them at a good price at market. Eulalia wants to increase her livestock and improve their breed, and in this way increase their value at market. For this she is requesting 600 soles ($225), which she promises to repay punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Eulalia se dedica a la crianza de animales, actividad que realiza desde niña, ella creció rodeada de sembríos y de tiernos animales, que sus padres criaron y que ella aprendió a cuidar y comercializar. Ahora que es madre y tiene 3 hijos, trata con esta actividad, de solventar los diversos gastos que tiene en su hogar, para ello sale muy temprano a pastear a su ganado, estando pendiente de sus vacunas y medicinas necesA. para su desarrollo, para que luego pueda venderlos a un buen precio en el mercado. Eulalia quiere aumentar sus ganado y mejorar sus razas, y así incrementar su valor en el mercado. Para ello requiere de 600 soles, cantidad que pide en calidad de préstamo con la promesa de pagar puntualmente.

loans.use: Buy animals of better breed in order to increase value of her livestock

loans.name: Porn

texts.en: This is the second time Mrs. Porn S. has taken out a loan to improve her living conditions. She is a farmer in Ampil Village in Kandal Province. She is a 57-year-old widow with two children who are working in a garment factory. Although the family members have different businesses, they still live in an old house and their house now needs to be repaired. Unfortunately, Mrs. Porn S. does not have enough money to fix it, so she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Previously, Mrs. Porn S. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her fields.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: M.W. est une boutiquier installe dans le quartier de guediawaye depuis pluisieurs annees. Il vend en detail des produits divers et parvient a ecouler facilement ses marchandises. mais il fait face a une forte demande qu il compte satisfaire avec ce credit
texts.en:
Mr. W. has been a shopkeeper in the Guediawaye quarter (Dakar Region) for several years. He retails various items and has no problem selling his stock, but he experiences high customer demand that he intends to meet with this loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his stock

loans.name: Ayika

texts.fr: Ne le 31 décembre 1979 à Djrékpo-Hagou, Monsieur T. Ayika vit actuellement dans le même village où il exerce ses activités. Marié et père de famille, il est spécialiste de maintenance. A cela, il a ajouté la vente de portables, d’ordinateurs et accessoires. Grâce à cela, il arrive à subvenir aux besoins des huit personnes à sa charge. Il est à la recherche d’un financement pour renforcer son activité surtout avec la création d’autres points de vente.
texts.en:
Born December 31, 1979, in Djrékpo-Hagou, Ayika T. currently lives in the same town from which he operates his business. Married and a father, his specialty is doing repairs. In addition, he sells laptops, desktop computers and accessories. Thanks to this business, he manages to see to the needs of the eight people in his care. He is seeking financing to expand his business, primarily by opening up additional sales outlets.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of laptops and accessories

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Sabino  vive en la calle Inca Roca  de la zona Alto Tacagua  de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El es casado, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 24 y 16 años respectivamente.

Trabaja como chofer de automóvil en una de las líneas céntricas de la ciudad.


El crédito lo destinará en la compra de repuestos (pastillas de freno, fluidos, etc.) ya que por el constante uso del automóvil éste requiere un mantenimiento general.
 
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, el segundo via kiva, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Sabino lives on Inca Roca Street, in the Alto Tacagua area of the city of La Paz. He is married and lives with his wife and their two children aged 26 and 16. He works as a taxi driver on one of the main routes in the city. The loan will be used to buy spare parts (brake pads, brake fluid etc). As his vehicle is in constant use, it is always in need of general maintenance. This is his third loan with Impro, and the second with Kiva. The assessment shows that he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 39 años. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, años atrás, junto a su esposo, sembraba papa en grandes cantidades, tanto en la costa como en la sierra, hasta que juntaron dinero y lograron comprarse un carro para transportar sus productos. Pero luego vinieron temporadas malas donde su producción no maduró por motivo de los insectos o las lluvias afectaban sus sembríos y los perdían, y por último el incremento del precio de los fertilizantes, por ello que este año ha sembrado muy poco. Si está dedicando a criar vacunos, y ya tiene buen número, considera que le es mucho más rentable que la chacra, solo que tiene que sembrar avena en grades cantidades para el alimento de sus animales, y con lo que ya tiene, está implementada para largo tiempo, además, en el mercado de su zona, vende a diario la leche que producen sus vacas y los quesos que ella elabora. Es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y es una clienta que paga de forma puntual sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado va comprar vacunos de raza, para que pueda aprovechar en mayor cantidad la leche, y por ende producir en mayor cantidad quesos.
texts.en:
Isabel is 39-years-old. She has always worked in agriculture. Years ago, together with her husband, she grew potatoes in large quantities on the coast and in the mountains. When they had enough money saved up, they bought a car to transport their products. But then came some bad times when their production didn't mature because of insects, or the rains affected their plantings and they lost them. Most recently, they have had to deal with the increase in the price of fertilizers, so this year they have grown very little. She also is raising cattle, and she already has a good number of them. She considers them more profitable than growing crops. She only has to grow oats in large quantities to feed the animals, and with what she has, she has enough to last a long time. Also, in the market in her area, she sells the milk that her cattle produce daily and cheese that she makes. This is her seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is a client who pays back her loans in a punctual manner. With the money she is requesting, she is going to purchase cattle of a good breed, so she can capitalize on the larger quantity of milk they will produce, and therefore make a larger quantity of cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle of a good breed so they will produce more milk

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino 
Maria es separada tiene seis hijos de 33, 30, 28, 21,18, casados y él ultima de 17 años que vive con ella esta en la escuela, ella se dedica al negocio de venta de juguetes y sandalias  Maria nos cuenta que se dedica al negocio de ventas hace treinta años  tenia un puesto de ferretería, pero tuvo que dejarlo por que se separo de su  esposo, se dedico a vender libros nuevos y usados con el tiempo se dedico comprar ropa usada en la parada y  venderla en provincia  como Matucana y Tornameza por las afueras de Chosica.

Maria  solicita un préstamo de 800 soles por la campaña navideña quiere comprar Juguetes y sandalias     
El tiempo que tiene en  Finca, ha podido ahorrar y  comprar muchas cosas para su casa  al contado, nos dice que este año le ha ido muy bien, las dificultades que presenta Maria es en su salud por el trajín del negocio pero esta superándolas. 
Ella tiene un sueño que es tener un puesto propio pero le cuesta siete mil dólares y  necesitaría un préstamo grande y con el tiempo un motocar para ponerlo a trabajar y también le gustaría comprarse un carrito
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Bancomunal Niño Divino. She is separated and has six children, aged 33, 30, 28, 21, 18, and 17, all married except the youngest who lives at home with her and attends school. Maria works selling toys and sandals. She has worked in sales for the past 30 years: she had a stall at the hardware store but had to leave it when she separated from her husband; then she worked selling new and used books; and at one time she bought second-hand clothing to sell in provinces such as Matucana and Tornameza, outside of Chosica. Maria is applying for this 800 soles loan to buy toys and sandals to sell over the Christmas holidays. During her time in Finca, she has been able to save and buy many things for her home with cash. This year has gone well for her, although she's had health issues due to the toll of the business but she is overcoming these. Among her dreams are to have her own store (but that would require a large 7,000 dollar loan), to buy and work a motocar, and to buy a small car.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toys and sandals.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia O. is 55 years old and married with 5 children. She sells drinks and fried meat. She hopes to expand her business. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Nurmuhammad

texts.en:
Raising calves is a very common business in the village of Somgor in Khujad city. Nurmuhammad N.  has dedicated himself to this business with great effort in order to provide for his wife and three school-age children. To support his nuclear family, he sporadically purchases calves to raise them, fatten them, and then sell them or butcher them to sell the meat. Today, his major need is to acquire a calf for his business. For this reason Nurmuhammad asks for a loan of $500 to buy more cattle to make his family’s sustenance possible.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key place  along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle for developing his business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María H. C. es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene 07 hijos y posee estudios primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años con seis meses, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado menor, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de insumos para realizar el engorde de su ganado (alimento balanceado y forraje).  
Actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, el dinero le servirá como capital adicional para poder comprarse una vaca, para engorde y su posterior venta en la feria ganadera de Yunguyo, ella tiene la aspiración de brindar una educación adecuada a sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
María H. C. is a member of the Community Bank “Urbano Central”, district of Copani, Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 41 years old, she is married and has 7 children. She also finished primary school. She’s been working for the ‘Manuela Ramos’ Movement for 4 and a half years. She buys and sells small cattle. She received a first loan of 300 new soles, money that she used to purchase products for cattle fattening (balanced food and forage). Currently, she is requesting for an additional loan of 500 new soles, which will be repaid in 4 months. She will use this loan as additional capital to buy a cow, its fattening and to sell it later on to a farmer’s fair in Yunguyo. Her dream is to provide her children with a good education until they are professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow and complete its fattening process

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan K., 47, is a good homemaker who cooks tasty foods and cares for the children in the family home. Besides her daily housework, she always helps her husband in boiling palm juice into palm sugar for sale.

Her husband works as a palm climber, as well as selling firewood. With the palm climbing, he climbs over 10 palm trees to tap palm juice. The couple has three children who are married and are living away from the family home. Lan K. is applying for a loan to buy 2 cows for her husband use to transport firewood to sell and to raise their offspring in the future. The family lives in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy 2 cows

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
Frederick K. is a forty-six year old married man and a father of three children, one of whom is a male. According to him, all of his children are attending senior high school. His wife is a hard working woman who works with him to operate a provisions store and boutique business. Frederick lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in the town of Achiase. Achiase is a farming and busy trading community in the eastern region of Ghana. 

Frederick runs a provisions store and also owns a boutique shop. His store is by the roadside. He procures his goods from suppliers who distribute their merchandise from vans. Frederick has been in this business for four years and wants a loan to procure more goods to increase his stock. 

He is hoping to provide his children with the best of education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure provisions for his store

loans.name: Queli Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Queli Amelia A. G. tiene 25 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Unión y esfuerzo y vive en el caserío Túpac Amaru del distrito de Carabamba en la provincia de Julcán en el departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió por su propio esfuerzo hasta quinto año de secundaria, pero ya no continuó con la educación superior por falta de apoyo familiar.  Queli Amelia es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 6 años.
Ella tiene una pequeña bodega en su caserío.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles , lo invirtió en la compra de ropa.
Con este crédito de 700 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en azúcar, arroz, galletas  y cerveza.
Queli sueña con tener un negocio grande y apoyar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Señora Queli Amelia A. G., 25, belongs to Banco Comunal Unión, and lives and works in the Túpac Amaru housing, Carabamba District, Julcán Province, La Libertad Department, Perú. She worked hard up to the fifth year of secondary school, but then was not able to continue with higher education because she lacked family support. Queli Amelia is a single mother with a 6-year-old son. She has a small shop in her neighborhood. She invested her first loan of $100 in clothing. With this current loan of $250 that will be paid back in 4 installments, she will invest in sugar, rice, cookies and beer. Queli dreams of having a larger business and being able to support her son.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, cookies and beer

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas  es socia del Bancomunal Inmaculada Concepción.
Felicitas  es casada tiene 53 años, siete hijos todos mayores.
Felicitas empezó con su bodega desde que esta viviendo en villa el Salvador, mas de 30 años, sus hijos le ayudaron desde pequeños y uno de ellos se ha hecho cargo del negocio  trabaja en la bodega, ella  conseguido un trabajo en el cafetín de un colegio, allí vende golosinas.   
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de cerveza, gaseosa, detergente, leche.
Felicitas desde que esta en Finca pudo abrir una bodega, la cual ha crecido, le pudo dar educación a sus hijos, aprendió a saber cómo trabajar en e l negocio. 
 El sueño de Felicitas es comprarse otra casa para dejarles  de  herencia a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the “Inmaculada Concepción” Communal Bank. Felicitas is married, 53 years old, and has 7 grown children. Felicitas has had her store since she has lived in Salvador neighborhood, more than 30 years. Her children helped her from a young age and one of them is now in charge of the business and works in the store. She also works in a school snack bar, selling candy. Felicitas needs a loan for 2000 soles to buy beer, soda pop, detergent, and milk. Since working with Finca, Felicitas has been able to open a store, which has grown, and she has been able to provide an education to her children and learned how to manage her business. Felicitas dreams of buying herself another home to leave as an inheritance for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer, soda pop, detergent, and milk for her store.

loans.name: Yedunam

texts.fr: Yedunam B. est une femme de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle détient un bar dans un quartier populaire de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. elle opère dans ce secteur de puis 4 ans. Avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV, elle souhaite aménager son bar afin de donner un cadre plus accueillant à sa clientèle. Ceci fera accroître ses recettes et par ricochet une amélioration de ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Yedunam B., 30, is married and the mother of 2 children. She keeps a bar in a working class neighborhood of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has been in this sector for 4 years. With her first loan from FECECAV, she hopes to refurbish her bar so that it will be a more welcoming atmosphere for her clientele. This should increase her sales and thus lead to an improvement in her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: refurbish her bar and add to her inventory

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin L. started his jewelery business several years ago in a small shop located at Cayo Levantado. Cayo Levantado is a small island located off of the Samana Peninsula, which is located on the northern coast of the Dominican Republic. Even though the island is isolated, it still has one of the most beautiful beaches near the coast. Due to its beauty and location, thousands of tourists flock to the island yearly.

The popularity of the island with tourists was one of the reasons Augustin decided to open a jewelery business. He sells local designs of both gold and silver to tourists. Augustin’s third loan with Esperanza is indicative of his success and hard work. He has an excellent record of loan repayment, and with his next loan he hopes to expand his business even further.

As always, one of Augustin’s major goals is to continue his business growth. He and his wife have four children, and the main reason for his continual desire to grow the business is to continue to help his family out in any way possible. One of the major reasons he believes his business has been able to continue to grow is that over the years he has picked up the English language, allowing him to reach an even larger market. Learning English is a true testament to his business ingenuity that has allowed him run a successful business in the past, and he hopes to continue this optimism into the future.

loans.use: To increase inventory for retail

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen E. sells provisions. She 32 years old and married with a child. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She is indeed grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Tamara Liseth

texts.es: La joven Tamara Colon Ramírez, tiene 20 años de edad,  soltera y con un hijo de siete de meses, reside en el barrio Isaías Gómez en la capital de Managua, su negocio es la venta de fritanga desde hace cuatro años, ella inicio este negocio junto con su mama, este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara un inodoro para instalarlo en el negocio. Para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, da las gracias  a la institución por el apoyo con los préstamos ya que se ha beneficiado ya que con el préstamo anterior compro una cocina industrial para su negocio. Su objetivo es poder hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar la infraestructura.
texts.en:
Tamara Colon Ramírez is 20 years old, single, and has a 7 month old child. She lives in the Isaías Gómez neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. Tamara has been selling fried snack foods for four years, a business she started with her mother.

She is on her second loan cycle with AFODENIC and would like to install a lavatory in her business. Tamara would like to thank the institution for providing these loans because it has helped her provide better service to her customers. Her last loan was used to build an industrial kitchen for her business. Her goal is to continue growing her business and improving its infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a lavatory for her business

loans.name: Zaragoza

texts.es:
Zaragoza es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Zaragoza es casada, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos, Zaragoza tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte de pasajeros, para lo cual cuenta con un conductor. Además Zaragoza en algunas oportunidades vende tamales en su barrio.
Zaragoza necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios para carro.
Los sueños de Zaragoza son comprar un carro moderno y ayudar a sus hijos en su educación.
texts.en:
Zaragoza is a member of the Las Golondrinas Community Bank. Zaragosa is 52, married, and has two children. Zaragoza has a car with a driver, which is used to transport passengers. Zaragoza also sells tamales on occasion in her neighborhood. Zaragoza needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy accessories for her car. Zaragoza’s dreams are to buy a modern car and to help her children with their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy car accessories

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is already 60 years old.  She and her husband separated in 1977.  She is a mother of five adult children: Anoy, Roberto, Marissa, Elizabeth and Ferdinand. They are all married and live separately from her. She is now living alone in her house located in San Luis, Cauayan, Isabela. Mercedita is still strong and very determined to manage her business despite her age.  

She manages a grocery store which is open from 4:00 in the morning and closes at 9:00 in the evening. She is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to 20,000 PHP that she will use to improve her store. Mercedita hopes to fulfill all her goals in the business for the benefit of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To improve her grocery store.

loans.name: San Sebastián Group

texts.es:
Erika Concepción C. M. de 38 años de edad, de carácter  alegre, jovial y responsable, es la coordinadora del grupo San Sebastián, originario de la ciudad de Monimbo, de la zona que llaman Calles Reales (Por estar en el centro de la cuidad y ser principal vinculo con los pueblos blancos).ç

Su negocio es la elaboración de postres típicos como buñuelos, ojaldras, relámpagos, entre otros. Ella los vende tanto en su casa y en los distribuye en la zona franca de Tipitapa.

Erika tenía una panadería, que se vio truncada por el alza repentina en la materia prima. Su maquinaria quedo varada y sufrió muchas pérdidas debido a una crisis económica que pasaron. Actualmente desde más de 2 años, se dedico a la venta de postres, pero con este crédito quiere iniciar la venta de Donas y Churros de queso.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Onelia Guadalupe D. quien trabaja en la elaboración de bordados; Miguelina M. quien vende postres típicos y Ana Liseth F. quien trabaja los derivados del maíz como tortillas, revueltas, atoles de maíz, cereales entre otros.
texts.en:
