Erika Concepción C. M. is a 38 years old. She is a responsible woman with a cheerful and jovial personality. Erika serves as the coordinator of the San Sebastián Group, whose members are originally from the city of Monimbo. They live in an area called Calles Reales, which is in the central part of the city and the main link to Los Pueblos Blancos (a picturesque village known for its white stucco buildings).

Erika prepares traditional desserts such as sweet fritters, fry bread, éclairs, and other types of pastries. She sells her products out of her home and also distributes them in the free trade zone of Tipitapa. Erika had a bakery, but she was forced to close because of the sudden rise in the price of ingredients. Her equipment was confiscated and she suffered tremendous losses because of the economic crisis that occurred. She has now been making desserts for 2 years, so she will use her loan to start selling donuts and fried cheese snacks.

The other members are: Onelia Guadalupe D. who makes embroideries; Miguelina M. who sells traditional desserts; and Ana Liseth F. who sells products made of corn such as tortillas, stuffed flatbread, porridge, cereal, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Fata Ngouss Group

texts.fr: Nous groupement "Fata Ngouss" membres de l'écovillage de Palmarin(http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarin.php), venons solliciter auprès de kiva un prêt pour faire des activités d'embouche ovine . Avec le prêt,comme c'est la basse saison, nous souhaitons acheter des moutons à bas prix, les engraisser et les revendre surtout à l'occasion des fêtes de l'Aîd El Kabir, mais aussi à l'arrivée des pélerins venant de la Mecque.
texts.en:
We are the members of "Fata Ngouss Group" from the ecovillage of Palmarin and come to Kiva to apply for a loan to breed sheep. We want to use the loan to buy sheep at a low price, since we are now in the low season, and fatten them. We intend to sell them mainly for the festivities of Eid al-Kabir, but also when pilgrims return from Mecca.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To breed sheep

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira is the leader of this group. Having been married for 17 years, Gulmira and her husband have raised three splendid children. The eldest son, 16, and the middle one, 14, go to school. The youngest is just one and half years old. Gulmira’s husband is a policeman.  Gulmira works as a governor at the hospital. She has decided to apply for this loan to buy a new bedroom suite.  

Gulmira’s partners are Sharyikul, Eliza and K..

Sharyikul, 54, has raised four children. She and her husband work as sellers at the market. Sharyikul is engaged in selling potatoes which her husband helps her transport. During five years of selling potatoes, Sharyikul has been able to buy a container and a small truck for transporting potatoes. She needs a loan to purchase potatoes and bring them from another village. Once she makes a good profit, she wants to invest it in buying livestock.

Eliza, 24, is married and has one daughter. Her husband is a high school teacher. Eliza is a housewife. However, apart from doing her regular house duties, she also keeps 15 sheep and one cow. After work, Eliza’s husband actively helps her look after the cattle. Eliza has far reaching plans with respect to animal husbandry. Therefore, she has applied for this loan to purchase more sheep.

K., 55, is a widow. She has two children. Both of them are married and live separately.  K. does not depend on her children. Instead, she prefers to keep some cattle. Due to her small household, she has been able to buy a flat in Tokmok city. She plans to continue raising livestock and increase their total population. For the moment, she has two cows. K. wants to obtain a loan and invest it in buying more cattle. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: A bedroom suite

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy L. is 45 years old, married, and presently residing at Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has four school-aged children.

Juvy’s husband is a fisherman and this is their primary source of income. Her husband's catch is sold to public market or to their neighbors. Their fishing activity sustains their daily needs despite the weather conditions.

In 2000, Juvy decided to join Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services to help improve their daily living by receiving a loan from PMPC. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fish to sell because her husband isn’t making a a good catch.

Since joining PMPC, Juvy is now on her 6th regular loan. In the future, she looks forward to owning a stall in the public market where she can display her fish.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita N. is a 56 year old woman and mother of 7 children, 4 of them are dependents and still in schooling. She lives in Tagbak, Antipolo Rizal province in the Philippines. Her husband passed away so she is now single mother of her children.

With her belief and faith to get out of poverty, year 1999 she decided to join ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. During her previous loans, she carefully invested in her tricycle business and give her a reasonable income. Now on her 11th loan, she proposes the amount of Php 30,000 pesos as additional capital, still for her tricycle. Specifically, the amount will be used to purchase a motorcycle and sidecar.

As a mother, she dreams of sending her children to school up to college and find a job for a better living. She hopes that her business will expand for them so they will have savings for future use.

loans.use: purchase of motorcycle and sidecar

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 4 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 52 años de edad, cuenta con estudios primariso completos, es casada y tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos viven con ella y los otros cuatro tienen familia.
Paula se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró una oveja y un chancho.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar ovejas cara negra.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su propio capital. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro, las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Paula, 52, has been a member of the "Santa Rosa de Lima-Juli" communal bank which is in Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department for the last 4 years. She completed elementary school, is married, and has 6 children, two of whom still live with her, four have their own families. Paula raises livestock and she relates to us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement to buy a sheep and a pig. She now is requesting 500 new soles to buy black face sheep. Her wish for the future is to have her own capital. What she enjoys the most about her communal bank are the savings, the meetings, and the punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy black face sheep.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 35 years old, married and mother to seven school age children.  She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Margaret works hard and is a trader of maize. She supplies maize to food vendors in her community and treks to nearby towns as well.  She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities.  Margaret has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy bags of maize

loans.name: Simith

texts.es:
La Sra. Simith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 55 años y es madre de 02 hijos, ya independientes.

Simith, lleva  20 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su pequeño taller de costura y teniendo habilidad  para este tipo de actividad, no dudo en hacerlo y gracias al apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, logro implementarlo y que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

En la actualidad continua con su negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa, para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Simith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Simith, 55, is a member of the “Las Lameñas” communal bank, which is in the Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is married and has two adult children. Simith has been a seamstress for 20 years. Bit by bit she produced her own income and, saving her money to equip her small sewing shop and having the skills to engage in this kind of work, she did not hesitate to do so and, thanks to support from the Manuela Ramos Movement, managed to set it up in her own home in a space adapted to take care of customers. She tells us that her sales are good; she works on order. She is still engaged in this work and she has regular customers that come by her house daily to place their orders. She, herself, takes care of them with the kindness that so characterizes her. With this 3000 sol loan she will buy lengths of various kinds of fabric and tools like scissors, sewing needles (both manual and machine), pins, and buttons. Simith feels very fulfilled with a still stronger desire to succeed and see her dreams come true. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her set up her business as well as helping many other women that want to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lengths of various fabrics.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir F. is single and lives in Fuzuli region.  He is 22 years old. As seen in the above picture, Samir washes cars.  This young man has been in this auto-washing business for three years.  Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy an apparatus for washing cars to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy apparatus for washing cars

loans.name: Ruth Y Esther 2 Group

texts.en:
Mariluz, 34, is a borrower who lives in Samana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Ruth y Esther (Ruth and Esther), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Mariluz is a single mother of two who lives in a simple home in Samana, a city on a peninsuL. with the same name in the north-eastern part of the Dominican Republic. Life in Samana can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare. Despite these difficulties, Mariluz runs a successful business selling clothing to her friends and neighbors. With this loan, she will purchase pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, and undergarments, which she will then sell for a small profit.

This is Mariluz’ second loan with Esperanza International. With continued profits, she would like to take her business from the street, as it is now, into her own building. This would save her set-up time and create a more comfortable experience for her customers. Mariluz would also like to purchase a computer for her family to use. A computer is a great expenditure for a low-income household; not only does it give access to the world of information available through the internet, but it also gives children the valuable experience of working with technology, knowledge they will need throughout their lives.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Mariluz and the Ruth y Esther group!

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, skirts & undergarments for resale

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos ya son independientes, vive junto a su hija menor en casa de su madre, ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace 20 años. Cría aves de corral y cerdos en la parte posterior de su vivienda, los engorda para luego comercializarlos con los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Aurelia nos comenta que también cría vacas con el mismo fin pero que las cría en un terreno que posee en las afueras del distrito. Esta actividad se ha convertido en el principal ingreso económico con el cual sostiene los gastos familiares y cuida de su madre, que es de edad avanzada.

Aurelia desea mejorar la alimentación de los animales que cría con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y que ha luchado por salir adelante a pesar de su condición de madre soltera, sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una persona de confianza. Su sueño es hacer mejoras en la vivienda donde vive ya que es de construcción antigua.
texts.en:
Aurelia is 49 years old. She’s a single mother of three children, two of whom are independent. She lives with her youngest daughter in her mother’s house, which is in Zaña district, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has raised animals for 20 years. She raises barnyard fowl and pigs in her back yard. She fattens them up and then sells to merchants that visit the area. Aurelia tells us that she also raises cows with the same goal in mind but she raises them on property that she has on the outskirts of the district. This activity has become her main source of income with which she supports her family and cares for her mother, who is getting on in years. Aurelia would like to improve the nutrition of her animals so that they will produce higher profits at sale time. With this in mind, she finds herself in need of calling upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 700 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed. She is a hard-working woman who has struggled to get ahead despite being a single mother. Her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high regard and consider her to be a trustworthy person. Her dream is to make some home improvements on her dwelling because it is of very old construction.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Mr. H., age 60, is a father of five children; three are married and live separately and two are single and help the family work. Mr. H. is married to Pheap, age 40, who works as a local farmer on the land behind her house. 

H. is a local farmer who plants rice and vegetables on the land that he inherited from his parents. H. has a daughter who is jobless. He hopes to encourage her train for a suitable occupation, but he doesn't have cash to make that possible. Thus, he would like to ask a Kiva loan of $500 for his daughter to open a tailoring business.

loans.use: To begin a tailoring business.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa L. is from the village of Balingsag, Misamis oriental. She is 53 years old. Celsa is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Celsa owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing taxi services to local community members. Celsa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Celsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celsa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Celsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: 06.01.13 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
"Hai T. T. (61) is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa _ Thanh Hoa.  Hai is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 06.01.13 Hoang Chau _ Hoang Hoa (06.01.13 Hoang Chau _ Hoang Hoa).


Hai is married and has 3 adult children.  To making a living, Hai operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for saL..  Hai has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Hai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hai has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.078.900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  This will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hai plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Do T. Thien (78) is a 43-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  L. T. Gioi (69) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  N. T. Dung (34) is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  N. T. Hien (33) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.


5.  C. T. Khich (62) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hai T. T. (61) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở  Hoang Hoa _ Thanh Hoa.  Hai là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06.01.13 Hoang Chau _ Hoang Hoa (06.01.13 Hoang Chau _ Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Hai thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hai kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Hai đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hai đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.078.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua con giống.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Do T. Thien (78) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  L. T. Gioi (69) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  N. T. Dung (34) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  N. T. Hien (33) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ.


5.  C. T. Khich (62) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo de l’association  Badenyaton est composé de 5 femmes mariées de la ville de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Les membres du groupe Djekafo vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles se sont connues à travers le voisinage. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 7 enfants. Elles ont  une durée de collaboration de plus de 4 ans avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 9eme  prêt solidaire. 
Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers avec la vente de condiments alimentaires et  la restauration.
Batoma C. communément appelée Batoma Bakounkolo (tête de chèvre) à cause de son activité de restauration de la tête et pattes de moutons et de chèvres, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, la matière première  et les ingrédients pour la sa restauration. 
Elle achète par jour 12 têtes de moutons et de chèvres, 1kg d’oignon un panier de tomate et les autres petits condiments.
Elle se ravitaille et vend journalièrement au grand marché de San à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Batoma prétend obtenir un bénéfice de 56 000FCFA pendant que les autres membres du groupe comptent réaliser 48 000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé non seulement pour rembourser le prêt  mais venir en aide aux conjoints et réinvestir dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The Djekafo group of the Badenyaton association is composed of five married women from the city of San, in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The members of the Djekafo group live in large, traditional families. They got to know each other in the neighborhood. On average, they are 45 years old and have seven children. They have been working with Soro Yiriwaso for more than four years and are requesting their ninth group loan. Their business involves the sale of various items such as food condiments and also a restaurant. Batoma C., who is often called Batoma Bakounkolo (goat head) because her restaurant features sheep and goat heads and feet, plans to use her loan to buy base products and ingredients for her restaurant. Each day she buys twelve heads of sheep and goats, 1 kg of onions, a basket of tomatoes and other small condiments. She restocks and then sells daily at the San market to a diverse customer base. Batoma expects to earn 56 000 XOF, while the other members of the group expect to earn 48 000 XOF per month. Their earnings will be used not only to repay the loan, but also to help their spouses and re-invest in the business.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for the restaurant

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: Kol O., 39, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She and her husband produce Cambodian silk products for an income of about USD 1.5 each per day. O. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more silk for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy silk for resale

loans.name: Bibi Saheba Maqboola Group

texts.en:
Fraidoon, the son of M. M., is the 30-year-old leader of the Bibi Saheba Maqboola group. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan and is married with four children. He is a butcher and all the family members benefit from the income he generates. He has been involved in his butcher shop for more than 11 years. He works hard and wakes up early in the morning to sell more and to have a high monthly income. 

Fraidoon would like to expand his business and make his shop larger. He is grateful to the lenders who provide the opportunity for entrepreneurs to support themselves and their families through this process.

loans.use: to expand his business and make his shop larger

loans.name: Look Up To God Group

texts.en:
Rita Q., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Look Up To God.  She is 30 years old, married and has one child who is 11 years old. 

She was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For five years, she has been selling beans, oil, pepper, and peanuts at the Old Road Market, outside Monrovia, Liberia. 

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollars group loan to buy more beans, oil, pepper, and peanuts.  She describes herself as a hard working and faithful person.

Her plan is to grow her business, build a house and continue to support her child so that he can have a better future.

loans.use: Buy more beans, oil, pepper, and peanuts.

loans.name: Cherrymel

texts.en:
Cherrymel T. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 24 years old. Cherrymel is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Cherrymel owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling different kinds of dried fish in the local community. Cherrymel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cherrymel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherrymel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Cherrymel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & provide working capital.

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU est créé en juin 2010 lors de la scission du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 11 femmes toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage.

Madame Maty N., accroupie à droite de la photo, de blanc vêtue, et un foulard blanc sur la tête, est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants.

Elle développe un petit commerce. Elle va à TOUBA dans le département de MBACKE région de DIOURBEL pour acheter sa marchandise. Elle revend dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone et en faisant du porte à porte.

Son nouveau prêt permettra d'acheter en quantité plus importante des parfums et de l'encens.

Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille, surtout en ce qui concerne la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The Sope Serigne Fallou solidarity group was created in June 2010 when the « Banc Villageois » loan group was dissolved. It consists of 11 women from the same village who got together through personal affinities and as neighbors. Mrs. Maty N. is responsible for the group: she is shown kneeling on the right of the picture, clothed in white with a white scarf on her head. She is 35 years old, married and the mother of six children. She is developing a small commercial business. She gets her merchandise from Touba in the Mbacke region of the Diourbel department. She resells at weekly area markets and door-to-door. Her new loan will enable her to buy larger quantities of perfume and incense. She assists her husband in taking care of their family, particularly concerning nutrition and health matters.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume and incense

loans.name: Together Women Group

texts.en: Regina B., holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Together Women."  Regina is 36 years old, single and has five children who range from 6 to 19 years old. She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to lack of financial support. For 16 years, she has sold doughnuts in Omega Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 38,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, egg, milk etc. She describes herself as an earnest woman whose dream it is to grow her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Marieter D. is inset because she was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bags of flour, sugar, egg, milk etc.

loans.name: Tumendelger

texts.en:
Mrs. Tumendelger is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and three children, ages 7, 9 and 11, in a house in Ulaanbaatar city. The three boys are attending a local secondary school. 

Mrs. Tumendelger and her husband are both tailors specializing in making the traditional Mongolian national dress. They have been running this business since 2003 and have three sewing machines at the moment. One corner of their living room is fitted as a tailoring workshop. 

They have their own customers and make around 40 to 50 dresses and accessories a month. They also sell them at "Narantuul," the largest local outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. Nowadays, the traditional national dress is a very fashionable item in Mongolia. People wear them on special occasions, like wedding ceremonies, school graduations, during national holidays and so on. 

In 2007, they took a loan from the bank and bought a small house and paid it off recently. The reason they are requesting this loan is they want to buy building materials and make some modifications and repairs to the house. Mrs. Tumendelger's future plan is to extend her business, to repair the house and to have their own family car one day.

loans.use: Building materials to make some modifications and repairs to the house

loans.name: Dulam

texts.en: Dulam A. is 53 years old and lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family has been living at their current address for the past 25 years. Her husband is retired and stays at home. She operates a grocery trading business at her rented stall in the local community. She has been engaged in this business since 2007, when she retired on a pension, and since then she has built a stable operation. She sells a variety of meats and fruits to her customers. Dulam is a modest and kind person who says "My business earnings have enabled us to provide for our daily household consumption and I am no longer dependent on my pension money".  Dulam is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more products and to increase her product line.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for sale

loans.name: Sarah  Njoki

texts.en:
Sarah Njoki has been farming for 15 years in Kambaa village in Kiambu. She is 40 years old and married to Stephen Kiguru,  a farmer. They have three school-going children. She gets an income of KES 7,000 per month out of the farming activity. She is also earns some additional income from casual employment. 

Sarah had borrowed from another MFI [PAWDEP] and repaid that loan well. Later she happened to get information about what KADET LTD. offers and she gained interest and applied for her first loan of KES10,000. She plans to buy a young rabbit for rearing and sell later, at a profit. She sells her farm products to her neighbors and also at the nearby local open air market. She also sells milk to the dairy societies and horticulture traders from Nairobi.

She plans to save the profit she gets and later buy another dairy cow. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children to university level. She is a very humble and hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy a young rabbit for rearing and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus madre en Pomalca, un distrito cuyos pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de caña de azúcar y que se encuentra ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 6 años mantiene un pequeño puesto informal en los exteriores del mercado de Pomalca en donde vende verduras, abarrotes, especias y aderezos previamente preparados. Este único ingreso económico le ha permitido solventar los gastos de su hogar donde vive con su madre de 65 años de edad, quien depende de ella.

Su negocio esta teniendo bastante acogida por parte de sus clientes. Actualmente su demanda ha aumentado y Sebastiana desea ampliar su negocio con más productos de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Sebastiana ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el Fondo Kiva y su negocio ha crecido gracias al apoyo brindado. Ella se encuentra agradecida con los prestamistas que colaboraron con ella. Actualmente desea seguir trabajando para poder crecer como empresaria.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 36 years old. She is single and lives with her mother in Pomalca, a district whose residents whose principal work is growing sugar cane and which is located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 6 years she has maintained a small informal stall outside of the market of Pomalca, where she sells vegetables, groceries, spices and previously prepared condiments. This single source of income has permitted her to cover the expenses of their household, where she lives with her mother, who is 65 and depends on her.

Her business gets a good reception from her customers. Now their demand has increased, and Sebastiana wants to expand her business with more products so that she can increase her sales and earn more income. To do this, she thought it would be advantageous to apply to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 2000 PEN.

Sebastiana has worked with Kiva in the past, and her business has grown thanks to the support offered. She is thankful to the lenders who work with her. Now she wants to continue working to be able to grow as a businesswoman.

loans.use: Expand her business with more products

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the town of Banga. She is 62 years old. Teresita is married and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn and rice for sale. Teresita still works at the farm because she wants to help improve her family's living conditions.

Teresita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other inputs.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and other inputs

loans.name: Dorothy Yaa Amoakawah

texts.en: Dorothy Yaa Amoakawah G. is married and has four children. She has been through senior high school. Dorothy is a dressmaker at Abura. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She wants the loan to buy more cloth and other materials to enable her to produce items in large quantities for sale. She plans to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: buy more cloth and other materials

loans.name: Rubylyn

texts.en:
Rubylyn S. is from the village of Holy Friday. He is 29 years old. Rubylyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately $143 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rubylyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Rubylyn is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 3rd loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
O. Alisher is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was young, Alisher has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sales of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Alisher harbors in his heart is to increase his capital and invest in acquiring more animals. By doing this, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved children, who always support him unconditionally in his daily work. Alisher requests 12,500 TJS. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing stability and security to the members of his family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Nver

texts.en: Nver P. is a farmer. For the family of 6, the main income comes from land cultivating and cattle farming. In the harsh winter conditions and with few resources, it is vital to work hard all through the year to sustain the children and family. Nver has applied for the loan to buy cattle feed for the winter period.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed for the winter period.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria A. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 56 years old. Gregoria is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells food and drinks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately $63 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gregoria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buys palm-oil, rice, onions, beans, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more flour and other ingredients to fry more doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Gnel

texts.en:
Gnel A. is 48 years old. He lives in Tsakhkunk village, an area of Sevan. Gnel has a higher education and for several years he worked as a mechanical engineer. 
Since 1998, Gnel, his wife, and his son have engaged in farming. On their farm they raise cows, sheep and chickens. Gnel says farming is very laborious, but it allows him to meet his family’s needs. 
Gnel and his family intend to enlarge their farm, which will allow them to increase their family's income in the future.  Gnel is seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some cows for his farm.

loans.use: To buy some cows for his farm

loans.name: 6 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal ”6 DE ABRIL”, está iniciando su tercer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de ocho  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Delfina, como tesorera Ximena y como secretaria de actas a la señora Emiliana. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos:  venta de accesorios de automóvil, cerrajería, venta de carne, venta de mandiles, venta de medias Textilón (medias de nylon), negocio de carpintería, venta de verduras, venta de ropa.
La señora Delfina, presidenta de la Asociación Comunal ”6 DE ABRIL” es una mujer de 52 años, casada y madre de ocho hijos;   tiene  experiencia de diez años en el trabajo con asociaciones comunales, antes de formar parte de la asociación “6 de Abril”, fue parte de otras asociaciones comunales en Pro Mujer.  Desde hace varios años su negocio es la venta de diversos productos en una tienda de barrio, la misma que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio, ella recuerda que antes su negocio era la  venta de café, negocio que requería que dejara su hogar hasta el lugar de venta.  Con el monto de crédito solicitado piensa comprar mercadería para vender en la tienda.    La señora Delfina recibe el apoyo de su hija para la venta de los productos de la tienda. 
Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella  responde la “capacitación”.
texts.en:
The April 6th Communal Association is starting its third loan cycle as part of the Germán Busch Community Center. This group consists of eight members. Its Board of Directors consists of the following members: Sra. Delfina – President, Sra. Ximena – Treasurer, and Sra. Emiliana – Secretary of Records. The women of this group engage in different businesses such as selling auto accessories, managing a locksmith shop, selling meat, selling aprons, selling nylon stockings, managing a carpentry business, selling vegetables, and selling clothes.

Sra. Delfina, the president of the April 6th Communal Association, is a 52 year old woman. She is married and the mother of eight children. Delfina has ten years of experience working with Communal Associations. Prior to joining the April 6th Communal Association, she was a member of other groups within Pro Mujer. Delfina has been selling different products at a neighborhood store for several years. Her business is located in her home. She recalls that prior to this business she sold coffee, but this required her to work outside of the home in order to make sales. The amount she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise to sell in her store. Sra. Delfina receives assistance from her daughter, who helps with selling products in her store.

When asked what she enjoys most about Pro Mujer, Sra. Delfina said she likes the training classes.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to restock a neighborhood store.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel se llama así porque las personas que integran el grupo son devotas a este santo, además de que su población se llama San Miguel Tetepelcingo, una población muy hermosa donde todas las personas hablan la lengua indígena, y la mayoría de las mujeres se dedican a al elaboración de servilletas y manteles, este grupo esta integrado por 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras que se dedican al bordado de manteles y servilletas. 
La representante de este grupo es la señora Herlinda A. López de 39 años de edad quien esta casada con el señor Martín Barragán Mejia quien se dedica al campo, tiene 3 hijos. 
Herlinda se dedica a la elaboración de bordado de manteles, también se dedica a vender tamales los días lunes, miércoles y viernes, para así poder tener más ingresos y poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa.
Otra de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Verónica Hernández López de 27 años de edad quien esta casada con el señor Bonifacio Hernández Hernández quien se dedica al campo, tiene 3 hijos pequeños ella se dedica  al bordado de servilletas y manteles con la técnica del telar, para realizar cada uno de estos productos se llevan varios días, ella comenta que últimamente le va muy bien, para que Verónica venda sus productos tiene que trasladarse a la Pinotepa Nacional para venderlo en el mercado que esta a un hora de distancia de su población.  Verónica tiene 8 años realizando esta actividad ya que es una herencia que le dejo su mamá ya que esta técnica se va pasando de generación en generación. Ella sueña que sus hijos sean unos profesionistas para que así tengan mejores oportunidades. También de igual manera quisiera que sus productos se vendieran internacionalmente ya que son artesanías hermosas realizadas con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. La ganancia que obtiene de sus productos es para aportar dinero en su familia ya que con lo que obtiene su esposo no es suficiente, como el se dedica  al campo casi no obtienen dinero a veces solo hay para comer y es por ello que Verónica decido hacer sus productos y venderlos para así poderse ayudar.
Las personas de este grupo agradecen a todos los que apoyan a la fundacion para que así ellos de igual manera puedan ayudar a prestarles a gentes humildes que lo necesitan.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Verónica, Leonila, Margarita, Maria López, Feliza, Francisca, Abelina, Lucia, Angélica, Delfina, Rosa, Maria, Margarita Hernández se dedican a la elaboración de servilletas.
Herlinda A. López: De 39 años de edad  quien se dedica a la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de tamales.
Adelfa Avendaño J.: De 66 años de edad quien se dedica a la compra de refresco para la venta.
texts.en:
This group is called 'San Miguel' because the group's members are devotees of this saint.  Also, their town is called San Miguel Tepelcingo.  It is a very beautiful town where everybody speaks the indigenous language and most of the women work making napkins and tablecloths.  This group is made up of 15 very hard-working women who embroider tablecloths and napkins.

This group's representative is 39 year-old Herlinda A. López who is married to Martín Barragán Mejia who works in agriculture.  They have three children.  Herlinda's business is embroidering tablecloths.  She also sells tamales on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays in order to make more income and help her husband with their household expenses.

27 year-old Verónica Hernández López is another member of this group. She is married to Bonifacio Hernández Hernández who works in agriculture.  They have 3 young children and Verónica works embroidering napkins and tablecloths using a loom.  It takes her several days to make each of these products.  She tells us that lately her business has been doing very well.  In order to sell her products, Verónica must travel to Pinotepa Nacional where she sells them in the market.  This is one hour away from her town.

Verónica has been engaged in this business activity for 8 years.  She inherited it from her mom since it is a technique that is passed down from generation to generation.  Verónica dreams that her children will become professionals so that they will have better opportunities in life.  She would also like to see her products sell internationally since they are beautiful handicrafts that are made with a lot of effort and dedication.  Verónica uses the profits that she makes on her products to provide her family with money since her husband's income does not stretch far enough.  As he works in agriculture, they don't make much money and sometimes there is only enough money for food.  Verónica decided to make her products and sell them in order to help out.

The members of this group are grateful to everybody who supports Fundación so that they too can help lend to humble people who need it.  The members of this group are as follows: Verónica, Leonila, Margarita, Maria López, Feliza, Francisca, Abelina, Lucia, Angélica, Delfina, Rosa, Maria and Margarita Hernández make napkins.  39 year-old Herlinda A. López buys supplies to make and sell tamales and 66 year-old Adelfa Avedaño J. buys soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making and selling tamales

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yanira, resiD. en Concepción Batres, departamento D. Usulután, tiene 29 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y hermanos, su esposo es carpintero y ella se dedica a la venta D. pupusas y queso.
El negocio lo inicio debido a la necesidad D. tener ingresos y ayudar a su esposo a cubrir las necesidades del hogar, trabaja sola, no tiene un horario fijo y actualmente necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería como bebidas, refrescos y materiales para preparar las pupusas.
Con esta inversión contara con mas productos en su negocio y fortalecerá sus inventarios, con la intensión D. mejorar la calidad y atención a la clientela.
Su objetivo es montar un negocio amplio, tener clientes fieles y aumentar sus ganancias, para garantizar a su familia un futuro en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Yanira, a 29-year old resident of Concepcion Batres in the department of Usultan, lives with her husband and brothers. Her husband is a carpenter, and she works selling pupusas and cheese.

Yanira began her business because of the necessity of having income to help her husband cover household expenses. She works on her own, and she doesn't have a fixed schedule. She is currently applying for a loan to invest in merchandise such as drinks and materials to prepare her pupusas. With this investment, Yarina will have more products in her business and she will strengthen her inventory, all with the intention of improving her products' quality and her service to the customers. Her goal is to have a full business with loyal customers, increasing her earnings to guarantee her family a better future.

loans.use: to buy drinks and materials to make pupusas.

loans.name: Xiomara Teodora

texts.es:
Xiomara de 31 años, es una mujer muy inspiradora en su trabajo que por medio de una vecina que le indico que había una escuela del sector que necesitaba una persona para que abriera un bar en el lugar y por la misma razón que necesitaba trabajar la abrió.

Ella labora sola y su horario es de 8H00 am a 5H00 pm. Esta unida  su conyugue es maestro albañil y tiene tres hijos que no viven con ella. Con el préstamo va a comprar mercaderia para su negocio para aumentar más sus ingresos y construir mejor su casa comprando cemneto, bloques. En un futuro desea terminar su vivienda y poner un restaurant.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 31 years old and a very inspiring woman.  She learned, through a neighbor, that there was a school in her area that needed someone to open a snack bar and, as she needed to work, she opened one. 

Xiomara works on her own, from 8.00am to 5.00pm.  Her husband is a master builder and she has three children who do not live with her.  Xiomara will use this loan to buy merchandise for her business in order to further increase her income and better build her home, buying cement and blocks.  In the future, she would like to finish building her home and set up a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy cement and blocks to adapt her business

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria Dolores nació en la ciudad de Cusco del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 50 años edad, tiene dos hijos varones y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. 

Maria Dolores tiene un fundo llamado “Vista Florida” donde produce maíz blanco. Maria Dolores trabaja desde el año 1987 en su fundo, Su fundo está ubicado en la comunidad de Vilcabamba y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Maria Dolores requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores cuyes. 

Maria Dolores pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores was born in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department.  She is 50 years old, has two sons, and lives in the city in which she was born.

Maria Dolores has a large farm called “Vista Florida” where she grows white corn.  She has been working on her farm since 1987.  It is located in Vilcabamba community and Maria Dolores also raises animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She needs this loan to buy more animals (guinea pigs).

Maria Dolores is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Mamacha del Carmen” community bank.  The bank is in its third year and is doing very well.

loans.use: to buy more animals (guinea pigs)

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene 52 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Natividad se dedica a la comercialización de legumbres y frutas tienen terrenos alquilados con su esposo que es agricultor y siembran papas y maíz.. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para seguir trabajando.

Le gusta trabajar vendiendo las legumbres y ayudarle al esposo en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Natividad is 52 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has seven children.

The Pucara Group community bank is located in Pucara community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton, 15 minutes from Cooperativa's offices.  This bank has 22 members who work in farming, livestock raising and vegetable sales.

Natividad sells fruit and vegetables.  She rents land together with her husband who is a farmer.  They grow potatoes and corn.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda market and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Guaranda.

Natividad is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy land so that she can continue working.

Natividad enjoys working, selling her vegetables and helping her husband with their farming.

loans.use: to buy supplies and feed for her animals

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es: Yorleny, tiene la edad de 33  años, está soltera, el  vive con sus 2 hijos   que son su mayor prioridad. ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de herramientas para realizar la reparación de celulares.  Ella cuenta con  el local  en una área comercial y ya tiene varios clientes. Ella lo que pretende es  poder dar un servicio  a sus clientes en mejores condiciones  par así crecer con la clientela y tener cada día mejores ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus hijos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yorleny, 33, is single living with her two children who are her greatest priority in life.  She intends to use the loan to buy tools to repair cell phones.  She has a locale in a commercial area and has several customers already.  What she would like to do is provide customer service in better conditions so that her customer base will grow and she’ll have increased daily profits for her and her children’s wellbeing.

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR.  She’s had no previous loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with the best terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy tools to repair cell phones.

loans.name: Verenisa Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora verenisa es madre soltera , tiene 2 hijos uno de ellos aun esta en edad escolar, verenisa de dedica a venta de hamburguesas y pollo broaster en las afueras de su casa esta labor la realiza solo por las noches, teniendo una gran acogida , ya que se encuentra en un lugar  muy transitado de la ciudad, además verenisa tienes otros ingresos por la venta de artículos de belleza como son cosméticos perfumes y otros , y por las mañana vende comida a los profesores de un colegio se su zona generándoles otros ingresos, el dinero que esta solicitando será invertido en comprar mas productos de belleza ya que estamos en campaña por el día del padre , además  de darle mejoramiento a su vivienda, su sueño a futuro es en futuro es tener un local mas grande para ofrecer sus productos de belleza y tener sus casa Con todos sus acabados y con ello brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, verenisa esta muy agradecida con confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en: Verenisa is single and she has 2 children, one of whom is still school aged. Verenisa sells hamburgers and roast chicken fron the front section of her house. She works only in the evenings and she has great demand because she is located in a very well traveled area of the city. Verenisa earns additional income by selling beauty products such as cosmetics, perfumes, etc. In the mornings she sells prepared foods to the teachers of the school in her neighborhood, thereby generating more income. The funds that she requests will be invested in the purchase of more beauty products to prepare for Father's Day. She also wants to make home improvements. Her dream for the future is to have a larger store from where to sell her beauty products and to have her house completed in every detail to provide her children with a better quality of life. Verenisa is very thankful for the trust imparted upon her.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as perfumes, skin lotions, and makeup, and to make home improvements.

loans.name: Arinzechukwu E.

texts.fr: Revendeur de pièces frigorifiques et climatiseur auto, Arinzechukwu a 47ans et papa de 04 enfants. Sa femme est revendeuse.  Il s’approvisionne au NIGERIA et revend dans sa boutique. Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des gaz et des ventilateurs.
texts.en:
A retailer of refrigeration parts and car air conditioners, Arinzechukun is 47 years old and a father of four. His wife is a reseller.
He gets his supplies from Nigeria and resales in his shop. This loan will allow him to buy gasses and fans.

loans.use: to purchase refrigeration gasses and fans.

loans.name: Nelys

texts.es: Nelys dedicada al arte de la confección, ofrece entre sus diseños  prendas de vestir, femenina colchas, cubrelechos e individuales para la mesa,  a una  clientela compuesta por vecinos, familiares y referidos, que cada día plantean mayores exigencias de calidad, y esperan mejores precios,  lo cual la tiene muy entusiasmada y despertando aún más su creatividad a Nelys, quien tiene el  gran desafío de lograr, que su capital de trabajo,  le alcance para responder a su clientela de manera oportuna, pues vende a crédito la mayor parte de sus prendas.   Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a al Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el fin de comprar materias primas, e insumos en diversos colores y texturas, en mayor volumen, para obtener descuentos y adaptarse a los requerimientos que tiene su clientela con respecto a la moda. Desde muy niña Nelys aprendió de su tía el arte de la confección y cuando estuvo adulta eligió esta actividad como su trabajo principal, compró su primera máquina y desde entonces no ha parado. Hoy a sus 54 años se siente muy contenta por esta decisión, porque durante todo este periodo ha logrado conquistar un mercado muy rentable que hoy la refiere a otros clientes.  En la actualidad está incursionando en la línea de telas de hamacas que se encuentran muy de moda y tiene muchos encargos de nuevos clientes. Su meta más adelante es tener un local propio donde exhibir lo que confecciona y ampliar su infraestructura técnica con maquinarias que hagan cada vez mejor su producto y le permita crear nuevas fuentes de ingreso a otras personas. Mientras trabaja persistentemente, Nelys maneja una liquidez que le permite cumplir sus obligaciones, y una rentabilidad no menor al 15% que planea aumentar en la medida en que incremente su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Nelys is a dressmaker.  She sells women's clothes, bedspreads and table mats to a customer base which is made up of neighbors, family members and people who she has been recommended to.  They increasingly make more demands for quality products and expect better prices.  This makes Nelys very excited and awakens her creativity even more.  Her big challenge is ensuring that her working capital stretches far enough to allow her to respond to her customers in a timely fashion as she sells most of her products on credit.  For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan - her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo - to buy raw materials and supplies, in different colors and textures.  She will buy in larger volumes so that she can obtain discounts and adapt to her customers' needs with respect to fashion.

Nelys learned the art of dressmaking from her aunt when she was very young and, when she grew up, she chose this as her main business activity.  She bought her first machine and since then she hasn't stopped.  Now, at 54 years old, she feels very happy to have made this decision because, over the years, she has managed to capture a very profitable market and people recommend her to other customers.  She is currently starting a new line of products, making hammocks, which are currently very much in fashion.  She has lots of orders from new customers.

Nelys' goal for the future is to own her own store where she can display the goods she makes and expand her technical infrastructure with machines that help her to make better products and allow her to create new sources of income for other people.  While she continues working persistently, Nelys maintains a cash flow that allows her to meet her obligations and has a profitability of no less than 15%.  She plans to increase her profitability as she increases her working capital.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies, in different colors and textures, in larger volumes

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 42 years old, married and has two children. His biggest dream in life is to see his children finish their education and become professionals someday. Because of that, Jerry is working hard in farming to ensure his income. Along with him is his wife who serves as his partner in the business.
 
He has been 22 years in rice farming and usually, he earns Php 25,000 per harvest season (twice a year). He plans to increase his yield by applying exact amounts of fertilizers, spraying insecticides to avoid pests and applying herbicides to avoid growth of weeds for a better yield.

Jerry is requesting a loan amount of Php 27,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides and rice seeds. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his practices in farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides and rice seed.

loans.name: Pean

texts.en: Pean, 48 years old, is a farmer and potato planter. Her husband is a construction worker. They can earn $5 per day for their income. She has five children. Three of her children are studying and the other two are working. Their income is $10 for all. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $3 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy fertilize to put on her farm and her potato plantation. In the future, she wants to get a small grocery shop for a new career when she gets older. For her children, she wants to support them to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy fertilize

loans.name: Manfred

texts.es: Manfred es un joven trabajador e independiente, que vive sólo en una habitación alquilada en la selva central del Perú porque tiene más oportunidades laborales. “Quiero salir adelante y lograr mis objetivos”, afirma; desde muy pequeño le enseñaron a trabajar duro y parejo por alcanzar sus metas por eso estudió lo que más le gusta la música pues se dedica a tocar instrumentos musicales como arpa, piano y teclado desde hace 7 años atrás, paralelamente en sus tiempos libres trabaja trasladando pasajeros en su moto carro. Los contratos que más acepta son para ser arpista ya que tiene mayor demanda y es más rentable dentro del mercado del folklore, gracias a las ganancias que obtiene puede enviarles algo de dinero a su familia; también puede cubrir sus gastos personales, además está ahorrando para comprar más herramientas melódicas porque en el futuro desea tener su propia orquesta, asimismo planea instalar un negocio de venta de artefactos domésticos y artísticos ya está dando el primer paso en ello. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Gotitas de rocío” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Manfred de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de instrumentos rítmicos de segundo uso, aprovechando que tiene conocidos músicos que necesitan de diferentes instrumentos.
texts.en:
Manfred is a hardworking and independent young man. He lives alone in a rented house in the central Peruvian jungle because there are many job opportunities. “I want to move forward so that I can achieve my goals,” says Manfred. As a small boy, he was taught to work long and hard to achieve one’s goals. For this reason, he studied what enjoys most – music. He took up musical instruments such as the harp, piano, and keyboard seven years ago. At the same time, he has a job driving passengers in a motorcar in his spare time. His most frequent engagements are as a harpist because there is more demand. The market for folklore music is very profitable. Thanks to the earnings he has generated, Manfred has been able to send some money to his family. He is also able to cover his personal expenses. In addition, he has been saving money so that he can buy more musical equipment because he wants to have his own orchestra in the future. Manfred also plans to start a business selling household goods and artwork, and he is taking the first steps toward accomplishing this.

He is a member of the Communal Bank “Gotitas de Rocío” (Little Dewdrops) and this is his eighth loan with MFP. Manfred hopes that a small loan will allow him to continue with his goals. In addition, he promises to complete his payments on time. With the support he will receive, Manfred plans to invest the money he requested in the purchase of secondhand rhythm instruments. Manfred will take advantage of known musical groups who are in need of someone who plays different instruments.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika tiene 31 años, vive con su hermana y sus padres en su casa que es propia. Desde hace 6 años se dedica al alquiler de inmuebles de departamentos y mini departamentos. Este negocio se inicio con unos pequeños ahorros, además de un prestamo para la compra de su propiedad para luego alquilarla. Con el tiempo su capital de trabajo se ha incrementado y en la actualidad tiene varios inmuebles en su poder de las cuales sigue arrendando, le agrada este negocio porque es rentable ya que en su ciudad el alquiler de inmuebles tiene mucha demanda y su meta para el futuro es  dedicarse a los bienes raíces a gran escala. Es la segunda vez que esta solicitando crédito en MFP,  esta muy contenta de ser parte de este grupo muy unido a la que pertenece. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para la remodelación de la infraestructura de uno de los inmuebles que va a arrendar.
texts.en:
Erika is 31 years old and lives with her sister and parents in their own house. She has been renting out apartments and studios for 6 years. She started this business with limited savings and a loan to purchase a property to rent out. With time, her working capital has increased to the point where she now has various properties under her possession, which she continues to rent out.

She likes this business because it is profitable since there is a high demand to rent properties in her city. Her goal for the future is to go into real estate on a large scale. This is her second time requesting a loan with MFP (Microfinanciera Prisma). Erika is very happy to be part of this very tight-knit group. With the requested loan, she will purchase construction materials to remodel the infrastructure of one of her rental properties.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 23-year-old young woman who is married and has one son and one daughter. Her husband is a worker with a modest salary. 
Amal has a project raising sheep and selling their products, which is another source of income for her family. She wants to purchase more sheep to raise and benefit from selling their products, but the amount of money she has isn't enough. Therefore, she wants to take a loan of 500 JOD from Kiva partner, FATEN. When Amal gets the loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will expand her project and buy more sheep. She will benefit from their products and will be able to increase her income, which will improve her family life positively and bring about better living conditions. 
Amal is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep to raise.

loans.name: Mwaffaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married, and lives with his wife and his two children.

Mwaffaa has been an owner of a bookshop since 2009. He sells books, stationery, cards, magazines, gifts, games and toys. He has more than two years of experience in this field and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He has decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to redecorate and renovate his shop.  He is aiming to gain more profit to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate and renovate his shop.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia de 58 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto con sus dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Rosa es una mujer increíble ya que ha trabajado toda su vida para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su familia es su principal inspiración para seguir luchando y espera algún día lograr mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de productos de elote como: atol, tamales, elotes cocidos, etc. Gracias a su carisma y amabilidad ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas en la zona y cada día son más las personas que demandan sus deliciosos tamales y sabroso atol. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la materia prima necesaria (elotes, azúcar, sal, agua, aceite, gas propano, etc.) para la elaboración de los tamales y atol que cada día ofrece con mucho amor y cariño a todas las personas que requieren de ellos. Espera poder lograr resultados positivos y poder tener acceso a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa Emilia is 58 years old. She lives in her own house together with her two children, both of whom are in school. Rosa is an incredible woman who has worked her entire life to provide for her children. Her family is her principal source of inspiration to keep fighting. She hopes that one day she will improve the quality of their life. She prepares and sells corn foods, such as: hot corn drinks, tamales, cooked corn on the cob, etc. It is thanks to her charisma and kindness that she has been able to win the trust of so many people in the region. Every day there are more people who request her delicious tamales and her tasty corn drinks.
