She has made the decision of requesting this loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) to invest in the purchase of the necessary ingredients (corn, sugar, salt, water, cooking oil, propane gas, etc.) to make her tamales and corn drink. Every day she offers these for sale with great love and attention to all those who have need of these. She hopes to attain positive results and to have access to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, sugar, salt, water, cooking oil, and propane gas.

loans.name: Juana Bautista

texts.es: Doña Juana esta contenta con su anterior credikiva con el cual compró una parte en materias primas como algodón, franela, madera y cepilleria y la otra parte la invirtió en la adecuación de su pequeña bodega donde ahora puede almacenar sus materias primas y productos acabados de manera protegida y ordenada. En la actualidad está preparandose para responder a una gran demanda de cepillos y traperos y esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo credikiva, pues planea con el, comprar materiales para producir y aumentar su capital. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores : " Muy agradecida por el apoyo recibido de ustedes para seguir creciendo."
texts.en: Juana is very happy with her previous Kiva loan that she used part of to buy raw materials like cotton, flannel, wood and brushes and part to furnish her small warehouse where she’s now able to store her raw materials and finished products in a secure and orderly way.  She is currently getting ready to respond to a large demand for brushes and mops and this is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan once again.  She plans to use it to buy supplies to produce and increase her capital.  She sends the following message to her lenders: “I’m very grateful for the support I got from you to continue growing.”

loans.use: to buy supplies to make mops and brooms.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 49 years old, married, and has four children.  He lives in Lebanon. Mostafa has owned a mobile phone shop for the past two years. He is well known in his village and sells high-quality items. Since 2004, Mostafa has been the mayor of his town. 

Mostafa is requesting a loan for $1,200 from Ameen s.a.l., which he will use to increase his merchandise selection of new mobile phones and accessories, thereby increasing his sales and his income.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise selection of new mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a hard working single mother of 3 children aged 15 to 2 years old living in Hioma, Uganda. She has a dependent and she is the only source of income in the family. She lives in a rented house and her dream is to build a permanent house for residence.

Eva owns a fresh food business and has been running it for 10 years now. She has no hardships and she hopes to expand her business. Eva is in need of a loan to purchase fresh food to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh food.

loans.name: Alfeu

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 7 filhos 3 dos quais frequentam a Escola e os outros trabalham.Fez a 4ª clase e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 1 neto que vive com ele. 

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida.É motorista na Macademia dos Libombos ha mais de 4 anos e tem um salario de 8.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos,conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa(areia, barrotes, ferro, cimento, e outros.).O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt, para habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da a sua casa e comprar um trator para investir na actividade agricola, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the district of Massinga, province of Inhambane, southern Mozambique. He is married and has seven children. Three of them still attend school and the other ones are in the workforce. He completed 4th grade and stopped because his parents lacked financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports one grandson who lives with him.
He left Inhambane for Maputo in search of better living conditions. He has been a driver for Libombos Academy for over four years and earns a salary of 8.500mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building his house (sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.). The first loan was for 10.000mt, for personal housing.
He pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future he intends to finish building his house and to buy a tractor in order to invest in farming. For that purpose he plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building his house (sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Engisa Group

texts.en:
John is the facilitator of the Engisa group. John and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

John takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for One Acre Fund's low prices, to ensure food security for his family, and, later, to educate them. In the recent 2011 season, John had a good maize yield harvesting seven bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest four bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, John will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Engisa group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Soli

texts.en:
Soli is 59 years old and is married with 8 children.

Soli owns & operates a business venture: raising pigs for sale.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.  Soli needs a loan of WST $1750 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Soli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Soli's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Blanca Elvia

texts.es: La señora Blanca tiene un restaurante de asadero de pollos, esta actividad inició luego de haber quedado viuda, por lo que requería de generar sus propios ingresos para su sostenimiento. Con el ánimo de generarle empleo a un familiar y mejorar sus ventas, la señora Blanca necesita de la compra de una olla fritadora con la cual pueda tener una mayor producción y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la del nuevo trabajador.
texts.en: Ms. Blanca has a chicken restaurant, which she started when she became a widow because she needed to generate her own income to sustain herself. With the goal of creating a job for a family member and improving her sales, Blanca needs to purchase a pot for frying. This will make it possible for her to increase her production and thereby improve her own quality of life as well as that of her new employee.

loans.use: to buy a pot for frying

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 58 years old and she has four children and several grand-children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last eleven years.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000. She will use the loan to buy cattle feed i.e. dairy meal and molasses. She will use the anticipated profits to buy another dairy cow.

Her hopes and dreams are to venture into large scale dairy farming and help improve the living standard of her children.

loans.use: To purchase cattle feed.

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en: Mihail has a vibrant little farm with his family, where chickens, ducks, geese, sheep and pigs are all to be found. The mainstay of the farm’s income, however, is pork sales. He currently has two female pigs, which he bought earlier this year, and the nine piglets which have since arrived. He plans to keep three of these for breeding and to sell the remaining ones for meat, either live or butchered at the farmers’ market. To grow his business, Mihail wants to buy two more sows and continue breeding piglets to sell next year.

loans.use: Animal Purchases

loans.name: Seyevush

texts.en: Seyevush M. is 52 years old and is married with 3 children. Seyevush owns a car wash on the main road that passes by Aghsu. He started his business 2 years ago. He wants to improve his business and with the $500 loan purchase equipment to make his work more efficient.

loans.use: to purchase equipment

loans.name: Liliolevao

texts.en: Liliolevao has always had passion for gardens, but it wasn’t until she put her experience to good use that she started earning a living by selling her vegetables to the local market and villagers. The mother of seven from Mulifanua-fou works six days a week on her garden. She would like to use the loan to buy seeds.

loans.use: To buy seeds for the vegetable garden

loans.name: Michail

texts.en: Michail B. operates a taxi service from Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine. In business for four years, Michail’s taxi service operates throughout the country. His business is the primary source of income for his family of three. Michail is humble, responsible, and hardworking – traits that have helped him to earn a high reputation among clients and co-workers alike. Michail has differentiated his business from others by maintaining a portable radio in his taxi. This added service has kept his business in high demand. Currently, Michail is seeking a loan for $500. This loan will help Michail to complete car repairs and continue offering quality taxi services to his clients.

loans.use: Repair taxi

loans.name: Claudia Del Carmen

texts.en:
My name is Claudia del Carmen and I have a small home-based business baking and selling bread. I have run this business for several years and generate enough income to cover my family's living expenses and pay my suppliers. I am a single mother and have two children who attend school and help me with the business in their free time. Thanks to this business I have been able to support my children.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Claudia del Carmen, mi actividad principal es la elaboración de pan ( producto para consumo Humano) cuento con una micro empresa de elaboración de pan en mi casa de habitación, tengo varios años de realizar esta actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores, soy madre soltera y tengo 2 hijos lo que estan en la escuela y me colaboran en su tiempo libre. Gracias a este negocio he sacado adelante a mis dos hijos.

loans.use: To purchase firewood, flour, sugar and lard

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu is 40 years old and has 6 children.  Her husband works as a driver but the income is insufficient for their family expenses.  For this reason, Isatu is engaged in a small business to earn income for their children.  She sells basic items such as onions, salt, canned fish, and chicken stock cubes.  Her inventory has increased with the loans from SMT.  Isatu meets her loan obligations on time and she is now requesting another loan of $275 to further expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her inventory to generate additional income

loans.name: Shakhla

texts.en:
Shakhla B. is a 34-year-old married woman who lives with her two daughters in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar region. Shakhla is an internally displaced person from the occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993.
She started her business in 2001 when hunger knocked on her door. 
In every Azerbaijani family you can find mattresses made of fleece. People find it healthy but it takes much time to sew a mattress of fleece. There are people who provide this service in every region and town. But before sewing the fleece, it needs to be washed three times, dried and fluff for a week. Shahkla has been providing  this particular service. She washes, dries and fluffs fleece. She has many orders every day and it brings her about six dollars for each order. When she started providing this service it wasn’t in very high demand but now orders increase every day and the number of people who provide this service has increased also. Shakhla took training in sewing and now she is qualified. She has expanded her activity and currently she also accepts orders to sew the mattresses. She does everything manually. It takes her a long time to finish one order, and she looses  money while orders are increase but time is limited. Shakhla has applied for 400 USD with a repayment term of 15 months  to purchase a sewing machine, quality needles and threads.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine,  quality needles and threads

loans.name: Saleema

texts.en: “I have lived all my life in Vehari, a small town located in the agricultural heart of Pakistan. I live in a brick house with my family, which consists of 12 members including myself. My husband and I have been running a bedding business for the last 10 years. We purchase sheets from manufacturers in bulk and re-sell them for a reasonable profit. We need a loan to purchase stock in bulk and thus save on costs. Also, since the Eid (traditional Muslim festival) is around the corner, we want to buy some goats, which we will sell at a high profit during the Eid, given the extra demand for them for the feast day. I am hoping that with the profits, I can get my daughters married off.”

loans.use: Purchase bed sheets in bulk for re-sale and goats to sell at the Eid

loans.name: Afsar

texts.en: Afsar J. lives in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 49 years old, married and has two children. He has been engaged in cattle-breeding for more than 15 years. He borrowed 3 loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch and used these loans for his business. Now he needs a loan in the amount of $800 to buy a calf as he wants to increase the number of his cows.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria Bogarin is 40-year-old mother of tour. Her two eldest are in the university and the other two are still in high school. In 1994, Victoria began a small convenience store with capital her husband gave her. He grows and sells animals, like pigs and chickens.

Victoria is asking for a loan to buy more products for her store. She will invest in fruits and vegetables, sugar, oil, and soft drinks. She needs to continue working to save enough money to help her two younger children enter college.

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, flour, fruits and vegetables, general groceries for her convenience store.

loans.name: Salelologa Tumupapa Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
While Salelologa, the capital village of Savaii Island, is largely semi-urbanized, while its outlying areas are still agricultural. The Salelologa Tumupapa is located in a largely agricultural area, and the people in the community still subsist on farming and vegetable gardening. For this group, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and guarantee on-time payments.

Salelologa Tumupapa group will be using their loans for the following purposes:

Foleni Pei I. (31, married, no children): purchase pan fryer, chicken legs, soy sauce, bananas, and taro to make BBQ chicken and sausage.

Olaiala U. (35, married, 5 children): purchase forks, rakes, a weed-killing sprayer, and chemicals to raise and sell cabbages, tomatoes and pumpkins.

Olive T. (40, married, 5 children): purchase a stove, corn seeds, oil, plastic bags and pots to produce popcorn.

Ruby Salota P. (21, single, no children): purchase a broom, glass and materials to make shirts, puletasis (dresses) and glass.

Sefulu S. (49, single, no children): purchase corned beef, soft drinks, cans of herring and cigarettes to sell in the village.

Susan F. (27, married, 1 child): purchase mutton flaps (lamb ribs), chicken legs, soy sauce, tomato sauce and foil to make and sell snacks, donuts and pork cakes.

Tailua Manulua M. (43, married, 6 children): purchase cabbage seeds, barbed wire, a spade, a pick, a bush knife and a weed-killing sprayer to cultivate and sell cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers.

Tina I. (52, married, 3 children) purchase oil, a sack of taro, bananas, plastic bags, large pots and large pan fryers to bake taro and banana chips.

loans.use: Purchase of assorted farming equipment and other materials, etc..

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
T. Mary sells porridge and doughnuts. She is married and has 1 child. The prices of food supplies have increased and is effecting her profit.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more food supplies for her food production and sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more food supplies for her food production and sale.

loans.name: Bidhya

texts.en:
Bidhya T. lives with her husband, Tulshi Ram T., and two children in the town of Sainbu-Bhashapati in the Lalitpur region of Nepal. Tulshi works in construction, building houses for a living. They have a daughter who is in the first grade and a son in primary school.

Two years ago, Mrs. Bidhya opened a poultry farm as a way to improve her family's standard of living and so that she could send her children to good schools. Mrs. Bidhya sells her chickens in a local market, and her husband and daughter help her in this work.

Today, the demand for chickens is increasing rapidly in Nepal, and Bidhya would like to meet this demand by expanding her business. That is why she has applied for a $375 loan to buy baby chicks to raise and eventually sell.

loans.use: To buy baby chicks for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more pigs and pigs feed

loans.name: Edwing

texts.es:
Edwing is a young entrepreneur who grows flowers (gladiolas) and other agricultural products as a way of having his own income. Not only has he made earnings for himself, he also contributes to his parent’s household expenses. In order to increase these earnings he needs flower and agricultural product seeds, which is why he is asking for a 1200 soles loan, with the hope that you can respond to his request. He promises to be responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Edwing es un joven emprendedor, incursionó en el cultivo de flores (gladiolos) y otros productos agrícolas, buscando la manera de tener recursos propios.No solo ha obtenido ganancias personales, sino que también aporta para el hogar de sus padres.Para incrementar estas ganancias requiere de semillas de flores y de productos agrícolas, el monto que solicita en calidad de préstamo es de 1200 soles, con la esperanza de que puedan responder su pedido, promete ser responsable con sus pagos.

loans.use: Buy seeds to grow and sell flowers.

loans.name: Mbarawa

texts.en:
Mbarawa is 33 years old. She is married and she has 3 children aged between 3 and 8 years old. She has been selling decorations since 2004. Every day, she works from 7 AM to 3 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mbarawa now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Serigne

texts.fr:
M. B. est un tailleur tres experimente qui beneficie d une bonne reputation aupres de sa clientele. Il gere un atelier de couture tres cote dans la zone de Guediawaye .
Avec le credit qu il sollicite ; il envisage d acquerir une nouvelle machine pour accroitre sa capacite de production
texts.en:
Mr. B. is a very experienced tailor who enjoys a good reputation with his customers. He manages a tailor's shop very near the Guediawaye area. With this loan that he is requesting, he envisions acquiring a new machine for growing his production capacity.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire a new sewing machine

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en: Haider, 39, is married and has three children. He lives in Beirut, the capitA. of Lebanon. Haidar owns a automotive repair business, and he has asked A. Majmoua for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase a compressor for painting cars. In the past he has rented a compressor from his neighbors but this is very expensive. By purchasing his own compressor, he can increase his profit by 50 percent.

loans.use: To buy a compressor

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
A single parent with one child, Rose A. sells a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey' which is made out of corn and is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country. This type of Kenkey has a fairly long life span and is normally kept in plastic bags and sold at the roadside, most customers being travelers. As well, Rose bakes bread for sale at Yamoransa Junction near Cape Coast. She has operated both businesses since 1996.

Rose is responsible for the payment of utility bills and her child's school fees. Her loan request will enable her to buy more maize, firewood and other materials needed in the preparation of Kenkey. She also wants to invest in her bread production business, hoping to save the additional profits to eventually acquire a piece of land upon which she hopes to build a house for herself and her child.

loans.use: To buy more maize, firewood and other materials needed in the preparation of Kenkey.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales viven con ella 2 de ellos. Hace 30 años que se dedicaba al cultivo de la tierra, ya que heredó varias chacras de su padre, pero lamentablemente para llegar no hay mucho acceso a la movilidad, entonces no puede sacar sus productos, y si paga por hacerlo, el costo del producto sube demasiado, entonces ella vio por conveniente comprar una casa en la ciudad, donde viven ella y sus hijos, mientras su esposo se quedó cuidando y cultivando las chacras. Susana empezó a dedicarse a la venta de comida a los chóferes de las minibases de transporte público que se estacionan en el paradero cerca de su domicilio, esta actividad, por el momento, le es muy rentable, ya que prepara cantidades medidas para que le sobre y pierda, además está contenta porque está viviendo y viendo estudiar a sus hijos. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfnanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado va acondicionar un lugar en su casa para vender la comida, de ese modo ya no tendrá que cargar ollas pesadas hacia la calle.
texts.en:
Susana is 49 years old, is married and has six children. Two live with her. She has been dedicated to farming for thirty years since she inherited various ranches from her father. Lamentably, to get there, there is little access so she cannot get her products out and if she pays to do so, the cost of her products will increase too much. Consequently, she saw buy a house in the city as desirable, where she lives now with her children while her husband remains taking care of and farming the ranches. Susana began to dedicate herself to selling food to public minibus drivers who are parked at the stop near her house. This activity, for the moment, is very profitable since she prepares measured quantities so there is little leftover and no waste. In addition, she is happy because she is living and seeing her children get an education. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting, she is going to air condition a place in her house so that she may sell food. In this manner, she will not have to carry heavy pots to the street.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Establish a space in her home from which to sell food.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es: Lucía tiene 29 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos en edad escolar, vive con su conviviente quien la ayuda mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida dentro de su vivienda desde hace 5 años y medio, esta actividad la realiza durante todo el día, ya que vende desayuno, almuerzo y cena, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes la ayudan mucho, además, conoce a mucha gente, una de las razones por las que le gusta cocinar es para que las personas degusten de su buena sazón y se sientas satisfechas con su comida. Lucía cuenta con una fiel clientela desde hace mucho tiempo y por el momento no tiene dificultades, ya que su negocio marcha bien. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP y está con muchas ganas de trabajar responsablemente en su banco comunal. Con el dinero de este crédito comprará sillas, mesas y materiales de cocina para implementar cada vez mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucia is 29-years old and is a mother of four children who are of school age. They live with Lucia and help her out a lot. For the last 5.5 years, Lucia has dedicated herself to selling meals from her home. This activity is an all-day affair; she sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. She enjoys her job because she is supported by her children who help out a lot. Moreover, she knows many people and it’s for this reason that she enjoys cooking so that patrons can sample her style and get a feeling of satisfaction from her meals.

Lucia has a loyal client base for a long time now and for the moment she is not experiencing hard times, as business is going well. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from MFP and she’s eager to work responsibly with her community bank. With this loan she will purchase chairs, tables and cooking materials which will each be used to improve the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase furniture and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Cristal Group

texts.es:
En la zona de Villa Exaltación, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “cristal” Un grupo muy simpático y particular formado por doce miembros, trabajan de manera organizada hace varios años.  Las actividades que realiza la asociación Cristal, son de todo tipo, Martha por ejemplo tiene una tienda de lubricantes, otras se dedican a la venta de verdura; venta de ropa americana; artefactos electrónicos; ropa usada, otras elaboran jugos en base a la quinua.
Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de materia prima e insumos (dependiendo el caso), para  poder ampliar sus negocios y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
The Villa Exaltación center is located in an area with the same name. The Cristal association, which belongs to this center, is comprised of twelve very pleasant members who have been working in an organized manner for several years. The Cristal association members partake in different types of business activities. Martha, for example, has her own motor oil shop, while other members sell vegetables, American apparel, electronics, used clothing and homemade, bottled quinoa juice.

They state that they need more work capital in order to purchase supplies and raw materials (depending on each business) in order to expand their businesses and generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and raw materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 42 years old and is married with 3 children. Esther sells local gin. The demands for her local gin are high within her community. Esther needs a loan of N50,000 ($350) to purchase more local gin to sell. She says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Mariefe N. is already 28 years old and still single. Her parents currently reside in Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She stays with her sister in a house at Baranggay Minante 2, a rural area. In the village, Mariefe manages a sari-sari store, a common name for a small community store.  

Her store has been operating for almost two years, and her desire to maintain and develop it leads her to borrow PHP5,000. She will use the loan to purchase additional merchandise for her store. “Do your best and God will do the rest” is her guiding principle in life. With that, Mariefe patiently works hard to develop her business and through God’s grace, she believes, it will improve in the coming years with the assistance of lenders who continuously support small entrepreneurs like her.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu O. O. is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She has a business centre where she sells rechargeable phone cards and does typing and photocopying of documents. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Glendys

texts.es: Glendys tiene 23 años, es madre de un pequeño de 2 añitos, vive junto a su pareja, quien es trabajador dependiente y la apoya en lo posible. Desde hace 4 años vende productos de belleza por catálogo en todas su variedades, a pesar de no contar con un local adecuado, Glendys ha implementado un espacio en su casa, donde tiene una vitrina para guardar y exhibir sus productos a sus clientes, y solo vende a pedidos. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas y hace buenas amistades, además le es rentable porque sus clientes traen a otros clientes que requieren de más productos y así su lista de solicitudes mensuales se va incrementando. En el futuro Glendys quiere tener una tienda de ropa. Con MFO, tiene 2 préstamos y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque son pocas personas y todos son responsables en sus obligaciones. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará los productos de belleza que le han solicitado sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gladys is 23 years-old and has a two-year old child. She lives with her partner, who is a hard-worker and supports her as much as possible. For the past 4 years, she has sold all kinds of (catalog-based) beauty products. Even though she doesn't have a store, she uses a small space in her house with a window to store and exhibit her products. She enjoys her job because she knows many people and continues to build friendships. In fact, her clients consistently refer other clients to her, so her client base (and therefore monthly orders) continue to increase. In the future, Gladys hopes to own a clothing store. She has received 2 loans from MFO, and she enjoys working with her community bank because its a small group of people who are very trustworthy and responsible. She will use the loan to purchase more beauty products that have already been ordered by her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (beauty products)

loans.name: Tany Fiorella

texts.es:
La señora Tany Fiorella A. P. tiene 22 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella cursa estudios Superiores, tiene 1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Tany se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, cuando inicio ofrecía sus productos entre familiares y amigos que viven cerca de su casa, ahora también ofrece dichos productos en el centro de estudios, del cual ella forma parte.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza.
Con el crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de catálogos, productos de belleza y una vitrina para exhibir sus productos en su casa.
Tany tiene como sueño culminar sus estudios, realizarse como profesional y dar lo mejor a su bebé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tany Fiorella A. P. is 22 years old and lives in the Florencia de Mora district, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a college student and has a daughter who is financially dependent on her. Tany works selling beauty products and began by selling products to family members and friends who lived near her home. Now she also sells her products at the school where she is a student. With her first loan of 300 soles that she received from the United for a Better Future II Communal Bank, she invested in the purchase of beauty products. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay over 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of catalogs, beauty products and a glass display case to display her products in her home. Tany dreams of finishing her studies, becoming a professional, and giving the best to her child.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy catalogs, beauty products and a glass display case

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres del Dos Mil.
Jenny  es casada tiene cuatro hijos de 26, 24,22, y 13 años, este último está en la escuela estatal.
Jenny tiene un carro que lo da en alquiler, pero su hijo mayor ha estudiado computación y le dio la idea para poner un negocio de venta de repuestos de computadora, este negocio funciona en su casa, hace cinco meses. Ella se encarga de las compras.
Jenny necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de repuestos para computadora.  
 Desde  que Jenny esta en Finca  aprendió como mejorar su negocio por las charlas que ha recibido, aprendió a invertir y  ahorrar  
El sueño de Jenny  tener una casa propia para poner un negocio.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the Communal Bank Women of the Two Thousand. Jenny is married and has four children ages 26, 24, 22, and 13, the last who in attending state school. Jenny has a vehicle that she rents out for income, however her eldest son who is studying computer science gave her the idea to open a business in the sale of computer repair parts; this business has been running out of her house for the past five months. She is in charge of purchases. Jenny needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to purchase computer repair parts. Since Jenny has been with Finca she has learned how to improve her business through the workshops that she has attended, and she has also learned how to invest and save. Jenny’s dream is to have her own house in which to establish a business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jenny needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to purchase computer repair parts.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: B. Julienne est née  vers 1979. Julienne est célibataire sans enfant.  C’est dans la maison de son grand-père à Zogbo un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin que Julienne vit depuis vingt (20) ans. Julienne a abandonné les cours au secondaire pour se lancer dans le commerce.  Julienne a vendu d'abord les produits cosmétiques. Depuis trois (3) ans maintenant, c’est les œufs que vend Julienne. Julienne a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de ALIDé et a bien remboursé ce crédit. Actuellement, Julienne sollicite un second prêt de ALIDé pour accroître le niveau de son activité et relancer la vente de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
B. Julienne was born around 1979. She is unmarried and has no children. She has been living for 20 years in her grandfather’s house in Zogbo, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She dropped out of secondary school in order to get started in commerce. First, she sold cosmetics. For three years now, she has been selling eggs. Julienne has already benefited from an Alidé loan and has repaid it. Currently, she’s requesting a second Alidé loan to increase her level of business and to restart her cosmetics sales.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thirty trays of eggs and some cosmetics products (bath soap, creams, and body lotions)

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty D. sells used clothes. She hawks her goods as well as trekking to other towns to sell on their market days. With low working capital, Betty is not able to buy more bales of used clothes to sell. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of used clothes with good variety to increase her stock.

Betty is 39 years old. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes

loans.name: Kaswa North Nabufu Peninah Group

texts.en: N. Peninah is a married lady, thirty years old and blessed with four children who are all going to school. She has been in her business of selling bananas for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase bananas in volume which is adding stock as in capital to her business. She is a hard-working business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: purchasing bananas in volume for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials to change the roof on her house

loans.name: Nancy Zoila

texts.es:
La señora NANCY ZOILA A.  M., tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEÑOR DE LA PIEDAD II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene  3 hijos quines dependen económicamente de ella, porque aun se encuentran en el colegio.
NANCY se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en la tienda instalada en su propia casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes, tales como: arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, fideos, jabones, detergentes.
Este crédito de 1000 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar mas productos alimenticios y una vitrina para poder exhibir sus prendas.
NANCY sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener todos los productos que le solicitan sus clientes.

loans.use: comprar mas productos alimenticios.  Comprar una vitrina.

loans.name: Wahed Group

texts.en:
Wahed is the group leader of Ahmad Wahed group. There are five members in this group and each of them is taking a loan to expand her or his business.
Wahed wants to take a loan to for his business of DVD shop.Nekena wants to take a loan for her husband, who has small electric materials.Nekena husband wants to purchase a new electric materials for his shop.K. Mohammad wants to take a loan for the photo shop business and he wants buy new camera for his shop because he has lots of problems and help with families. Faryba and Gullaly want to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Their want to buy new machine for their business. 
They requested a group loan of 70000 Afghani. They are very thankful to Kiva lenders that support the entrepreneurs in the progress of their business.

loans.use: their improve for their businee

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.en:
Emperatriz is a member of the “We are Leaders” village bank. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children who are 15 and 5. They both study at public school.

Emperatriz began to work in the afternoons as a cleaning lady for many years until she broke her arm and had to stop cleaning. Since nine years ago she has made her living selling sweets (candies) and sodas from her house. She began with a small table because she was not able to afford a showcase as they were very expensive. Also she began with all her goods in plastic so the sun wouldn’t affect them. She enjoyed her work because she was able to be close to her family.

With FINCA Peru, her economic situation and morale have changed for the better, thanks to the loans and the training which have helped her grow little by little. Emperatriz is happy for the successes in her life.

Emperatriz needs a loan of 1,400 soles to buy an exhibition showcase, and more sweets and sodas. Her dream is to have a soda fountain and with hard work she will obtain it.

loans.use: To buy an exhibition showcase, sweets, and sodas

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora María del Rosario es casada con el señor Rodolfo Campos quien es pensionado. Ella y su esposo son una familia unida y como tal iniciaron un negocio desde hace 2 años de nombre “Abarrotes Campos”. Están tramitando este crédito para la construcción de un techo de concreto en el frente de su vivienda para una mayor comodidad de su familia y hogar.
texts.en:
María del Rosario is married to Rodolfo Campos. He is retired and receives a pension. She and her husband are a united family. As such, two years ago they started a business called “Abarrotes Campos” (Campos Groceries). They are processing this loan for the construction of a concrete roof on the front of their house. This is for greater comfort for the family in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a concrete roof on the front of their home

loans.name: Mira's Group

texts.en:
Mira, a 53 year old widow is the leader of this group.  She keeps cows and sells milk. She has 30 years of experience in animal husbandry.  Even though her husband passed away, she has been able to provide for her family.  When she started raising cattle, she invested around $115. Now, she makes half of her investment back in a month, just by selling milk.  Mira decided to apply for this loan to buy two sheep. She is going to feed them and resell them in the cattle market.  Mira wants to build a big farm in a village. 

Mira’s partners are: 

Burulush, 54, has four children. She is a widow. To make a living she keeps cows and sells milk. She needs a loan to prepare a dowry for her daughter. 

Kalbubu, 49, has three children. Her husband works at a gas station.  She stays at home and looks after cattle.  Kalbubu needs a loan to purchase calves for breeding.

Kulira, 53, has two children. She keeps three calves and wants to increase their population. She looks after cattle herself, while her husband does other jobs. She needs a loan to purchase more calves.
----------------------------------------------------------
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: Buy animals.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: 37-year-old Rosalyn B. is a married woman. She lives on rice farming and learned to love doing it. Rice farming is her source of income. She does her best to keep the farm in good condition because she does not want to fail again. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and asked for a loan of 12,000 PHP. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farming necessities.

loans.use: Fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Moeun Kruoch Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of 20 people who live in Prey Chheu Teal village in Takeo province.  Moeun K. is the bank president who was selected by the members.  She is a farmer who owns a small field to cultivate rice.  Moeun is also a pig breeder.  She is applying for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.use: Buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe Jiguiya sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans,  5 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koko un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali.. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quinzième  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts antérieurs ont été bien  remboursés. 
Elles font entre autres la vente  du  bois de chauffe, de l’atiécké,  du savon traditionnel,  de l’huile alimentaire, des  bananes etc.   
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, un chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 600 morceaux de savons traditionnels, 10 bidons de 20litres d’huile alimentaires, 1centaine de régimes de bananes et 5 sacs de 100kg d’atiécké. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent au marché de Kadiolo, de façon ambulante  et à domicile, au comptant et  à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The seven members of Jiguiya group are basically married women who have an average age of 39 years and five children. They live mostly in polygamous families in Koko, a neighborhood of Kadiolo town,third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They work with Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to meet the needs of their clientele and they are on their fifteenth group loan. All previous loans have been repaid correctly.They sell, among other things, firewood, atiécké, traditional soap, food oil, bananas etc. With their new loan, they intend to buy a truck load of firewood, 600 pieces of traditional soap, 10 gallons of 20 liters of food oil, about a hundred bunch of bananas and 5 bags of 100kg of atiécké. They get their supplies in the market of Kadiolo town and in neighboring villages. They sell in the Kadiolo market door-to door and at home for cash and for credit to a clientele made up of male and female. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 27.500FCFA each of which a part will be used for saving and for the needs of the family and the other part will be invested in the business.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of miscelleneous products

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo V. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos. 
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para reparar la barda trasera de su casa, ya que le preocupa la seguridad de su familia. 
El planea pagar el crédito con sus ingresos que obtiene de su empleo en una compañía de trasportes. 
Desea que su familia tenga seguridad, ya que tiene cuatro hijos y le preocupa que le pueda pasar algo.
texts.en:
Gerardo V. is very thankful for your cooperation with the last loan, which enabled him to pay his children's school bills. He is requesting a new loan to repair the fence behind his house since he is worried about the safety of his family. He plans to pay the loan with the income that he obtains from his job at a transportation company. He wishes that his family has security since he has four children and he worries that something may happen to them.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the fence behind his house.

loans.name: Gladiz

texts.es:
La señora Gladiz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sarita Colonia”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 42 años y es madre de 03, que aún depende de ella.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella decide iniciar su propio negocio de venta de gallinas vivas, con un capital de S/. 250.00, donde comenzó vendiendo poco a poco y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes, que ya conocen de la actividad que realiza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará aves de corral como gallinas. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando alimento balanceado y vitaminas, para mantener sanos a sus animales y libres de cualquier enfermedad.

Gladiz, se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gladiz belongs to the Sarita Colonia Communal Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 42, in a common law marriage, and has three dependent children. Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and energy and the necessity to get her children ahead, she decided to start her own business selling live hens. With 250 PEN in capital she started selling little by little. She was making herself more known by her customers, who now know the work she does. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy poultry like hens. She will use part of the money to buy balanced food and vitamins to keep her animals healthy and free from illness. Gladiz feels very satisfied with the work she does. In spite of it being hard work and having to get up early, she believes it is worth the sacrifice to make her dreams come true and to reach the goals she has designed for her life. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for offering support to her and other women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poultry like hens

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Las socias del banco comunal “Nueva Vida” son 19 en total. Ellas viven en la localidad de Labranza, ubicada cerca de la ciudad de Temuco. Los negocios de ellas son principalmente de repostería, venta de tortillas, venta de ropa nueva y usada, venta de joyas, fotocopias y bazar.
Marianela es la presidenta de este BC. En la foto ella está en 2º fila, vistiendo blusa celeste y con los brazos abiertos. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de carbón, el cual vende en su casa. Tiene 2 hijos adolescentes. Marianela invertirá este préstamo en carbón y en piñas para vender, además de remodelar el techo de su bodega, para que no se mojen sus productos. Su sueño es tener un almacén establecido en su casa. Su gran motivación es brindarle estabilidad económica y estudios a sus hijos, para que tengan un futuro sin necesidades.
Una de las cosas que le gusta mucho a Marianela de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza son los talleres de formación emprendedora que FE les entrega.
Temuco es la capital de la Región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativa. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Vida” ("New Life") communal bank has a total of 19 members. They live in the community of Labranza, near the city of Temuco. The most common businesses in the group are pastry-making, selling tortillas, selling new and used clothing, selling jewelry, making photocopies and running a bazaar. Marianela is the president of this communal bank. In the photo, she is in the 2nd row, dressed in a sky-blue blouse, with her arms open. Her business is buying and selling charcoal, which she sells out of her home. She has 2 adolescent children. Marianela will invest this loan in buying charcoal as well as pineapples to sell, and in remodeling the roof of her storage room, so that her products do not get wet. Her dream is to have a permanent store in her home. Her great motivation is to provide her children with economic stability and a good education, so that they will not lack the necessities in the future. One of the things Marianela enjoys very much about working with the Fondo Esperanza (Hope Fund) are the entrepreneurial training workshops provided by the Fund. Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía Region. The city lies 670 kilometers south of Santiago (Chile's capital) and has a number of lakeside beaches and very striking native flora and fauna. Another noteworthy fact about the area is that 50% of Chile's Mapuche people, an indigenous group, live there.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing charcoal and pineapples

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA PAULINA ES VIUDA, FUE MUY DURO SUPERAR LA MUERTE D. SU ESPOSO, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D.  REFRESCOS  DIARIAMENTE SU TRABAJO EMPIEZA A TEMPRANAS HORAS DEL DIA  05:30 D. LA MAÑANA LA SEÑORA SE DESPIERTA PARA HACER HERBIR EL AGUA CON EL CUAL REALIZA SUS DELICIOSOS REFRESCOS D.  CANELA, MANZANA , DURAZNO Y OTROS DEPENDIENDO A LA TEMPORADA. VENDIENDO YA HACE BASTANTE TIEMPO, CUANDO LA INFRAESTRUCTURA DEL MERCADO ERA PRACTICAMENTE TIERRA, ES CONSIDERADA Y RECONOCIDA POR LOS TRASEUNTES. TENIENDO UNA VENTA CONSIDERABLE DURANTE EL DIA ,LA SEÑORA SE RETIRA CONTENTA YA QUE ESTE ES SU UNICO INGRESO PARA MANTENER SU FAMILIA. LA COMPRA D. ESTA HELADERA TENDRA UN VENEFICIO PRODUCTIVO E HIGIÉNICO PARA SU VENTA. 
ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO
texts.en:
Paulina is a widow. It was very hard to get over the death of her husband. She sells cold drinks everyday. Her work starts early in the day at 5:30 in the morning. She gets up in order to start boiling the water she uses to make her delicious drinks. The drinks are cinnamon, apple, peach and other kinds, depending on the season. She has been selling for quite a while, since the market’s infrastructure was almost all dirt. She is respected and known to the passers-by. Having considerable sales during the day, she ends her day happily because this is her only source of income to support her family. The purchase of this refrigerator will have a productive and hygienic benefit on her sales. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Labo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, she is married, and has one adult child.

Teresita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Teresita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: used to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora F. is from the town of Poblacion East, Sta. Ignacia Tarlac. She is 46 years old. Aurora is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Aurora owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Aurora has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aurora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aurora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel L. is from the village of Sa-a, Gingoog City. She is 26 years old. Maricel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Maricel runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Maricel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.rr

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en: Benjie G., 39 years old, dreamed of having a sustainable income to support the daily needs of his family. He learned about CEVI’s micro finance services and ventured into a rice farming business. He sells rice and the income that he generates is what he uses to buy food, clothing and pay the other expenses in their home. He started his business in May 2009. He would like to apply for another loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Venture. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Yankadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Yankadi, toutes mariées,  ont une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans,  4 enfants et vivent  dans des  familles polygames à Mancourani II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et tous les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers  tels les condiments alimentaires (avec Dialia Traoré), les brochettes de bœufs, de la pomme de terre  etc.
Dialia Traoré compte acheter avec son  prêt,  5 paquets de condiments ( tels que de l’oignon, de la tomate, du sel de cuisine, de laurier, des légumes ...).
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et  dans les villages avoisinants .
Les condiments sont vendus au  marché de Mancourani et en famille à une clientèle composée de femmes, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Yankadi group are all married and are on average 42 years old with four children. They live in polygamous families in Mancourani II, one of the boroughs in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). This is their 6th collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI. All past loans have been repaid in full. This group of women retails various food products such as beef kebabs, potatoes, or food condiments like Dialia Traoré. Dialia Traoré wants to use her loan to buy five packages of condiments such as onions, tomatoes, kitchen salt, bay leaves, vegetables, … She gets her supplies from the main market and villages in the vicinity. The condiments are then sold in the Mancourani market and through home delivery, for cash and often for credit, mainly to women customers. She is hoping to attain an average monthly income of 18,500 FCFA of which part will be used for family expenses and the remainder reinvested in the commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mr. San S. (pictured near the pigpen) and his wife, Mrs. Sinoun Phal, have been married for over five years. They have two daughters and both of them are still young and stay at home. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

San and his wife have been raising pigs and chickens for more than three years. He hopes to continue expanding his business. So, he is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase 10 more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy 10 more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.en: Abdumalik is a 37-year-old married man and the father of three children. He is an experienced farmer. He grows vegetables and fruits on a piece of land next to his home. At the same time, Abdumalik and his wife are engaged in the business of raising and selling cattle. Currently, he needs the amount of 6,000 Somoni. Abdumalik wants to expand his business further, as this will allow him to generate more revenue for his large family and improve their livelihood. This is his first loan with IMON International, a Kiva partner. Abdumalik will invest his funds into the purchase of seeds and fertilizer for his crops. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Glorious J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is Able. She is 29 years old, married and has two children who range from 6 to 14 years old. 

She was only able to attend school through 7th grade due to lack of financial support. She cares for one sibling.

For four years, she has been operating a beauty salon in the Old Road Market, outside Monrovia, Liberia. 

She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 32,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more hair product such as gel, shampoo, sheen oil etc. She describes herself as a respectful person.

Her dream is to grow her business and travel abroad to do international business.

loans.use: Buy more hair product such as gel, shampoo, sheen oil etc.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en: Nasreen lives in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She is a 26-year-old housewife who spends most of her time taking care of her home and her children who are very young and have not yet started school. She also has a buffalo from which she gets milk to sell to earn extra income. Her husband has two businesses. In the day he sells milk with Nasreen and in the evening he sells fruit. Nasreen has applied for a loan for the first time from Asasah for her husband who wants to buy some seasonal fruit for his fruit-selling business. She hopes that their fruit-selling business will improve the same way they improved their-milk selling business.

loans.use: Purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Danny Felipe

texts.es:
Danny de 31 años, Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), el tiene una lavandería para poder solventar los gastos familiares. 

Por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en lavadoras para poder tener dinero y mantener a sus dos hijos que ahora tienen 7 y 8 años. Hace 5 años atrás comenzó con una lavadora ahora tiene tres y trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Para continuar con su negocio el quiere comprar dos lavadoras con el préstamo y en el futuro quiere tener sucursales de lavado y secado de ropa.
texts.en:
Danny, 31 years of age, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil (an urban area where a majority of residents are merchants). He runs a laundromat to support his household’s expenses. Due to lack of opportunities, he had to invest his savings into washing machines so he could support his two children, now 7 and 8 years old. Five years ago, he started with one washing machine and now he has three. He works from 7 am until 10 pm every day. He would like to use the loan to buy two washing machines, in order to grow his business. In the future, he would like to open more branches of his laundromat.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase washing machines.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es:
Berta reside en barrio el centro Corinto departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposo y una hija de la edad de 26 años la cual le ayuda a trabajar en el negocio de venta de carne.
Tiene 20 años de trabajar en la venta de carne el horario es de 7 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde, y una de las dificultades es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para la inversión en el negocio.
Esto lo invertirá en la compra de  mercadería como carne pollos, esto le ayudara a contar con los productos necesarios para satisfacer la demanda del cliente y le beneficiara ya que obtendrá mejores ingresos.
Sus aspiraciones son ampliar más su negocio y así poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Berta lives in the central Corinto neighborhood of the Morazán department, along with her husband and 26 year old daughter who helps her in her butcher business. She’s been selling meats for 20 years and works from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM. One of her challenges is that she doesn’t have the money to invest into the business. She will invest the money from this loan in merchandise, such as chickens. This will help her to have the products on hand that she needs to satisfy her customer demands and will help her increase her income. She aspires to expand her business so that she can improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro C. is from the town of Siayan. He is 63 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Alejandro owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily goats, for sale. Alejandro has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Alejandro joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandro is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the first loan taken out by Alejandro from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Muliauma Vitale

texts.en:
M. V. is 42 and married with six children. She plants and harvests taro to sell. M. has many years of experience in this business.

In 2010, M. joined SPBD. SPBD's loans are M.'s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. M. is requesting a loan, her first from SPBD, of 1000 WST to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 WST per week) to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Sos

texts.en: Sos B. is a skilled and experienced businessman who has longstanding relationships with his suppliers and customers. He trades in leather clothing and shoes from one of the city markets and also distributes goods to another trader in the same market. Sos started his business in 1992 with $2000 startup capital, working in Armenia’s border region. Sos moved to Yerevan in 1999 to be with his loving wife and 3 children and has applied for this loan to purchase new clothing stock.

loans.use: To purchase clothing stock

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Mrs. Svay C., 41, is a widowed mother in Kompong Chhnang Province. Her husband passed many years ago, and Mrs. Svay C. has been living with her daughter. Mrs. Svay C. is an old local farmer, she has almost spent her whole life in the field. 

Most of her income comes from her daughter, who works at the garment industry, and has a formal salary. Currently, Mrs. Svay C.’s daughter has purposed to open a new business as a tailor in front of her house. As she lacks fund to buy tailoring equipment, her savings are not enough to make it possible. So Mrs. Svay C. has decided to request a loan from Kiva forward to her daughter to purchase tailoring tools for starting a business.

loans.use: purchasing tailoring tools to start a business

loans.name: Nalya Agali Awamu Group 1-Kampala

texts.en: Keeping an open mind, being honest and tenacious is what has obtained for 33 year old Angellah K. a place of advantage in her banana, charcoal and vegetables business in Nalya-Kampala.  5 years is the time this good humored mother of 6 has been at the helm of her business. Angellah is also a lady so partial to hard work that she says it has become second nature to her. With this loan Angellah wants to buy more bags of bananas and charcoal for resale. She is a member of the Nalya Agali Awamu group1-Kampala.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of bananas and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Dina Adjoa Kumima

texts.en: Dina Adjoa Kumima M. is married and has three children. Dina is a hairdresser at Abura. Her husband is a tour guide at Kakum National Park in Cape Coast. Dina assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She is requesting the loan to purchase more hair products to use on her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dina plans to build a shop.

loans.use: purchase more hair products to use on her customers

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda L. is 47 years old, married with two children and is from San Francisco, Agusan del Sur. She has been a fish vendor since 1992.  She has five children. Everyday she sells fish in the street to be able to save enough money for the educational needs of her children. Rosalinda also helps her husband till their rice farm. She helps keep the farm free of weeds and pests.

She said that getting a loan from CEVI would help her expand her business. She would like to apply for a loan because this would make her business competitive and more profitable. She could use the money to buy for more fish that she could resell for profit and for purchasing farm supplies for their rice farm.

The income she will be able to generate will help her family buy an adequate supply of food and other basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and additional fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and cartons of laundry soap

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es:
Marcos es un joven de 20 años de edad, está soltero, vive con su madre y tres hermanos, residen en Corinto departamento de Morazán, él se dedica al ganado y crianza de cerdos, desde temprano su oficio es ordeñar y darle comida a los cerdos, este oficio lo aprendió principalmente de su madre.
Él quiere adquirir un préstamo para comprar una vaquilla y para recolección de cosecha de granos básicos, con la compra de esta vaquilla estará aumentando el número de reces y con la recolección de granos básicos ayudara al grupo familiar.
Su aspiración es continuar mejorando su trabajo para poder estabilizar los ingresos económicos a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos is a young man of 20.  He is single and lives with his mother and three siblings in Corinto, in Morazán department.  He raises cattle and pigs.  Early every morning he milks his cows and feeds his pigs.  He learned this trade mainly from his mother.

Marcos would like a loan to buy a heifer and to harvest his basic grains.  With the purchase of this heifer, he will be increasing his number of cattle and, with the harvesting of the basic grains, he will help his family group.

Marcos' aspiration is to continue improving his work so that he can stabilize his family's financial income.

loans.use: To buy a heifer

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a 59 year old married woman who supports her family by operating two businesses: a general store and an e-load retailer (SIM/phone card) business. She lives in Medellin, Cebu. Crispina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and e-load businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 11,300 PHP. 

Crispina is borrowing 16,000 PHP to purchase more inventory to sell. This will be her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP, which she fully repaid, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Crispina aspires to elevate her family’s living condition and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase stock and e-load inventory

loans.name: Cuanicuti Group

texts.es:
La señora Fabiola B. L., es parte del grupo “CUANICUTI” comentan que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que donde vive ella los condominios tienen ese nombre y ahí harán sus reuniones semanalmente y que esta muy orgullosa de pertenecer a este grupo porque ella es la representante de este. Doña Fabiola es originaria de Naucalpan de Juárez en el Estado de México pero desde hace 20 años se vino a vivir con sus papas a la población de Zitacuaro Michoacán por cuestiones familiares. Ella cuenta con 30 años de edad, estudio la carrera técnica de trabajo social, y comenta que ya no laboro en su profesión por que se caso y decidió dedicarse a su hogar. Doña Fabi como le dicen sus amigos y familiares se dedica a vender productos por catalogo y también tiene el puesto de coordinador de ventas en la empresa de cosméticos, dice que tiene con esta actividad hace mas de 4 años, y que empezó a vender los productos por catalogo porque desde muy pequeña le ayudaba a su mama a vender los productos por catalogo. También le ayuda a su esposo a vender y a dar mantenimiento a copiadoras, también vende cartuchos para las copiadoras, tóner y papelería,  dice que con el negocio de las copiadoras tiene aproximadamente 10 años, y que su esposo fue que le enseño este tipo de negocio.
