La señora Fabiola, está casada con el señor Uriel, el se dedica a la venta y reparación de copiadoras y tienen su negocio en su casa aunque es muy chica dice que se ahorran la renta de un local, ellos tienen una hija de nombre Melanie la cual tiene 8 años de edad y estudia la primaria. Dice la señora Fabiola que su meta en la vida es poder hacer un local estable donde pueda vender sus cosméticos y las demás cosas que vende por catalogo, y también poner el negocio de las copiadoras. Comenta que con las ganancias que saque de vender sus productos por catalogo y de la venta de copiadoras ahorrara para comprar un terreno para hacer el local que tanto sueña.

Blanca Estela C. M., es parte del grupo “CUANICUTI” tiene 54 años y estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria comenta que no siguió estudiando porque sus papas ya no la siguieron apoyando ya que antes los papas decían que las mujeres no tenían que estudiar porque ellas se casaban y ya no les serbia el estudio. Doña Blanca está casada con el señor Miguel él cual se dedica a reparar línea Blanca ellos tuvieron 6 hijos todos ya casados. Doña Blanca se dedica a vender ropa usada en la central de abastos de Zitacuaro, ella tiene un puesto desde hace aproximadamente 8 años, y decidió emprender este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del médico que ella necesitaba ya que padeció la menopausia, y tenía que comprar medicamentos muy caros y por eso también ella se puso a trabajar, dice que anteriormente ella era costurera y que hacia vestidos de novia, de quinceañera y vestidos de noche, pero que desgraciadamente la enfermedad que padece perdió poco a poco su vista y ya no continuo cosiendo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora se levanta a diario a las 6 de la mañana para ir a vender su ropa y los días jueves se va más temprano para apartar un lugar en el tianguis de la población. Ella compra sus pacas de ropa usada en Toluca estado de México. Doña Blanca está solicitando su préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa usada y ella pretende comprar zapatos usados para vender en su puesto, y la meta que ella tiene para su negocio es ahorrar para rentar un local donde pueda tener más ropa y bien surtido e incrementar el número de clientas que ella tiene.

Los otros 8 integrantes se llaman Manuel Humberto O. C., Judith López García, Decire Marín P., Minerva Rúelas C., Melina López Colín, Nadia Iveth López G. ellos quieren los préstamos para invertir en  la compra de productos y cosméticos por catalogo, venta de ropa, venta de antojitos mexicanos, en repostería etc.
texts.en:
Señora Fabiola B. L. is a member of the group "CUANICUTI".  They named their group after some condominiums in their area and this is where they will hold their weekly meetings.  She is very proud to be a member of this group as she is the representative.  Doña Fabiola is originally from Naucalpan de Juárez in Mexico state.  Because of family matters, she came with her parents to live in Zitacuaro Michoacán 20 years ago.  She is 30 years old and studied social work.  She says that she is not working in her professional field because she got married and decided to dedicate her time to her family.  Doña Fabi, as her friends and family call her, sells catalog products and also works as a sales coordinator for a cosmetics company.  She has worked at this job for more than 4 years.   She started selling catalog products because, when she was a young girl, she used to help her mother sell catalog products.  She also helps her husband sell and maintain copiers as well as selling copier cartridges, toner and stationary.  She says that she has approximately 10 years of experience in the copier business and that her husband, Señor Uriel, was the one who taught her this business.  He runs this small business out of their home, saving on rent. They have a daughter named Melanie who is 8 years old and attends elementary school.  Señora Fabiola says that her goal is to have a fixed location where she can sell cosmetics and other catalog products and move the copier business there.    She says that she will save the earnings from her catalog and copier sales to purchase a piece of land where she can have the commercial site that she dreams of. 

Blanca Estela C. M. is another member of the group "CUANICUTI" and is 54 years old.  She finished school until 6th grade and says that she could not continue her studies because her parents couldn't continue supporting her.   Her parents said that women didn't have to go to school because they would just get married and an education would be no use.  Doña Blanca is married to Señor Miguel who works as a line repairman.  They had 6 children and they are all now married.  Doña Blanca sells used clothing at the supply center in Zitacuaro.  She has had a stand there for about 8 years now.  She decided to start this business as a way to help her husband with her medical expenses because she was suffering from menopause and had to purchase expensive medication.  She used to work as a seamstress.  She made wedding dresses, quinceañera dresses and evening gowns, but, unfortunately, her illness caused her to slowly lose her sight and she couldn't continue sewing.  She is a very hard-working person.  She gets up at 6 am every day to go to work in Toluca in Mexico state to sell her clothing and every Thursday she leaves even earlier to get a spot in the open air market in town.  In Toluca, she buys large quantities of used clothing.  Doña Blanca is requesting a loan to purchase used clothing and she also plans to buy used shoes to sell at her stand.  Her goal is to save enough money to rent a commercial site for her business she can increase her stock and her customer base.  

The other 8 members of the group are Manuel Humberto O. C., Judith López García, Decire Marín P., Minerva Rúelas C., Melina López Colín and Nadia Iveth López G..  They are all requesting loans to invest in their various businesses including cosmetic and catalog sales, clothing sales, Mexican snack sales, confectionery shop, etc.

loans.use: To invest in cosmetic and catalog products ,Mexican snack sales, clothing sales and a confectionery shop

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua P. is married and has seven dependants. She has been through junior high school. Ekua sells banku (a staple in Ghana made of a mix of fermented corn and cassava dough) and serves it with fried fish and hot pepper sauce at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. She has been cooking for sale for 13 years. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses her income to provide food for their family. Ekua will invest the loan into the banku business. Her business goal is to build a cafeteria.

loans.use: To invest in the banku business.

loans.name: Roxana Magaly

texts.es: La Sra.  Roxana de 38 años de edad estado civil casada tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, vive en casa familiar en la zona quinto anillo de la ciudad de Santa Cruz. La Sra.  Roxana da a trabajar su auto como taxi y percibe una renta diaria, ya que ella tiene la actividad de promotora de cosméticos,. El dinero que solicito la Sra. Roxana es para  la (Compra de conversión de  equipo a gas y mantenimiento) y así reducir el gasto de lo implica la compra de gasolina  La clienta quedo muy agradecida por la confianza depositada en su persona y por la atención que recibió.
texts.en:
Roxana, 38, is married and has three school age children.  She lives in the family home in Santa Cruz’s Quinto Anillo zone.  

Roxana leases out her vehicle to be used as a taxi and she receives a daily rental fee since her job is as a cosmetics saleswoman.

The money she’s asking for is to buy a gas conversion kit and for vehicle maintenance and repair to reduce the cost that gasoline usage implies.

She was very grateful for the trust placed in her and for the way she was treated.

loans.use: To buy a gas conversion kit and for vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Grey Maribel

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora, dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

Aquí conocimos a  la señora Grey, ella tiene 45 años de edad y es madre soltera de un niño de 10 años de edad el mismo que estudian en escuela. Vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por cuatro ciclos y le gusta porque a pesar de que esta sola le ha dado el respaldo para tener su propio negocio y así poder darle lo mejor a su hijo.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y zapatillas, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 11h00 ya que tiene que esperar que llegue su hijo de la escuela y de 14h00 hasta las 16h00, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra toda los sabados. Su mercadería  la compra en Guayaquil, lleva  10 años que se dedica a esta actividad pero antes ella trabajaba para otra persona hasta que se independizo hace algunos años.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, zapatos, zapatillas, entre otras cosas pero de preferencia de temporada. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the 'La Mocora' community bank meet in the town of La Mocora, in Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its hard-working people who farm and raise livestock.

Here we meet Grey.  She is 45 years old and the single mother of a 10 year-old child who is in school.  She lives in her parents' home.  Grey has been a member of her community bank for four loan cycles and she enjoys being a member because, although she is alone, the bank has given her the support she has needed to run her own business and provide her son with the best.

Grey's business is selling all types of clothes, shoes and sneakers.  She makes her sales door to door.  She works every day from 8.00am to 11.00am and then has to wait for her son to come home from school.  She works again from 2.00pm to 4.00pm.  She leaves her goods with her customers on credit and collects payment every Saturday.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil.  Grey has been in this business for 10 years.  She used to work for another person but a few years ago she started working for herself.

Grey will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, shoes, sneakers and other seasonal products.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, shoes, sneakers and other seasonal products

loans.name: Trabajando Por Fe Group

texts.en:
Orfa Dalila is 38 years old, married, and has four children. All of her children are currently in school. Her husband works as a bricklayer and helps support the family. Orfa sells general goods near her neighborhood school and has been doing so for the past three years. 

As part of the ¨Trabajando por Fe¨ group, Orfa is requesting a loan to purchase more products to sell in her store. She would like to purchase a variety of school supplies since most of her customers are the students and parents of a nearby school. The other members of the group are involved in the following business activities: vegetable sales, dressmaking and sales, and general goods sales.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Reyna De La Paz

texts.es:
Doña Reyna, tiene 54 años D. edad, resiD. en San Rafael Oriente, departamento D. San Miguel, vive con su esposo y un nieto, ella se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos, este negocio lo inicio con el apoyo D. su esposo, no tiene un  horario fijo, y su experiencia es granD. ya que lleva muchos años dedicándose a ello. 
Actualmente necesita realizar la compra D. cerdos y concentrado para su alimentación, para lo cual solicita un préstamo, esta compra le permitirá crecer y fortalecer su economía.
Su aspiración es aumentar la granja D. cerdos, y poder comercializarlos a buen precio, ya que este negocio es el que le da sus ingresos para la alimentación D. su hogar.
texts.en:
Reyna is 54 years old and lives in San Rafael Oriente, in San Miguel department, with her husband and one grandchild.  Her business is raising pigs.  She started the business with her husband's support.  Reyna does not work fixed hours and she has a lot of experience as she has been in this line of work for many years.

Reyna currently needs to buy pigs and concentrate to feed them with.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to grow and strengthen her finances.

Reyna's aspiration is to increase the size of her pig farm and sell her pigs for a good price since she uses the money she earns in this business to feed her household.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrate to feed them with

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Eliana Gueny

texts.es:
Eliana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad.  Es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar.  Eliana cuenta con estudios de educación superior. 
Viene  trabajando  con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos más de cuatro  años.  Su primer préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de artículos artesanales.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 1300.00 nuevo soles, comprará materiales como: cinco conos de lanas, cinco kilos de  lana de alpaca y de bebe alpaca, todo esto  para la producción de chompas, chullos,  chalinas que  luego venderá a sus clientes. Sus hijos le ayuda en el negocio.
Su sueño es ser una gran empresaria y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Eliana is a member of the “Sweet Dawn” Communal Bank, located in the district and department of Puno. She is 39 years old and lives with her partner; together they have 3 children of school age. Eliana has a college education.

Eliana has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for over four years. Her first loan of S/ 300.00 nuevo soles was used in her business to sell artisanal products.

With Eliana’s new loan of S/ 1300.00 nuevo soles, she will buy materials like: five wool cones, five kilos of alpaca wool as well as baby alpaca wool, all of it will be used to make sweaters, chullos (woolen hats with earflaps), chalinas (Peruvian scarves), that she will later sell to her customers. Her children help her in the business.

Eliana’s dream is to be a great entrepreneur and to improve her earnings.

What Eliana likes about her communal bank are the meetings and their talks.

loans.use: buy materials like: five wool cones, five kilos of alpaca wool as well as baby alpaca wool.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 29 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo Jefferson de 6 años de edad y lo que más desea es poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que gracias a las enseñanzas que recibió desde muy niña, hoy en día puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, El tejido de chompas, guantes, chalinas, entre otros, es la actividad a la que se dedica y le gusta mucho por que le gusta crear y estamparlo en cada prenda que teje. Ella pone gran dedicación y esfuerzo para lograr el acabado ideal, además con este trabajo le hace ser independiente. Para el futuro desea incursionar en otro tipo de negocio y es por eso que esta pensando comprar ropa y calzado para vender en provincia, para lo cual tendría que viajar frecuentemente. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados,  comprará mayor cantidad de lana y material para sus tejidos y si fuera posible un maquina tejedora.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 29 years old.  She is a simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her 6 year-old son Jefferson.  What she wants more than anything is to be able to provide her son with a better quality of life.

Yolanda is a very hard-working woman who, thanks to the teaching she received when she was very young, is now able to cover her household expenses.  Yolanda knits sweaters, gloves, scarves and other items.  She enjoys her work a lot because she loves to create and imprint this on every item that she knits.  She puts a lot of commitment and effort into finishing her items off really well.  This work enables her to be independent.  In the future, Yolanda would like to break into another type of business and so she is thinking of buying clothes and footwear to sell in the provinces which will mean she will have to travel frequently.

This is Yolanda's fourth loan from MFP.  She has always been very punctual in making her loan repayments.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy a larger quantity of yarn and materials for her knitting and, if possible, a knitting machine.

loans.use: to buy yarn and materials so that she can knit more items

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
María Margarita tiene 49 años, es viuda vive con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

María se dedica al negocio de quesos y a la agricultura, tiene seis cuadras de terreno, siembra naranjilla, mora, además tiene potreros y seis cabezas de ganado. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar un buen estudio a los hijos y arreglar la vivienda.

Le gusta salir a pasear con los hijos y salir a comprar.
texts.en:
María Margarita is 49 years old.  She is a widow and lives with her children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has four children.

The Pucara Group community bank is located in Pucara community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton, 15 minutes from Cooperativa's offices.  This bank has 22 members who work in farming, livestock raising and vegetable sales.

María sells cheese and farms.  She has nine and a half acres of land where she grows naranjillas (a native fruit) and blackberries.  She also owns pasture and six head of cattle.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda market and her sales in the wholesale market in Guaranda.

María is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to provide her children with a good education and to fix up her home.

María enjoys going for walks with her children and going out shopping.

loans.use: to buy supplies and feed for her animals

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen  vive en Soledad con su esposo y sus hijos en las edades de 19 a 22 años, allí se dedica al comercio como actividad principal, a la cual se aferró para apoyar la gestión de su esposo en el hogar, pues hasta antes de emprender Carmen su negocio de mercancías a crédito, él tenía toda la carga de su hogar. Hace 10 años  la  hermana de Carmen  le ha enviado  calzado, suéteres bermudas, blusas y jeans  para la venta y con ello ha logrado una estructura de clientes fijos que permanentemente le encargan productos y le recomiendan nuevos compradores.  Este es el quinto financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la que ha estado vinculada hace 13 años y que ha apoyado su formación empresarial y orientado la inversión, con la cual ha tenido un visible mejoramiento y un adicional capital de trabajo, que la ha ayudado a generar mayores utilidades, eso sí imprimiéndole su trabajo y  aplicando sus valores morales para responder a estas obligaciones mientras beneficia a su hogar, con el que sueña lograr el bienestar de su familia especialmente en el tema de educación profesional  para sus hijos. Su meta más adelante es tener un local comercial, aunque su mayor desafío es crear alternativas diarias para sostenerse competitiva en  el mercado. Con su credikiva comprará mercancías variadas, como suéteres, camisetas, bermudas blusas y pantalones, inversión a la cual aspira rotar rápidamente porque está encargada por clientes que le pagan muy bien.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in Soledad together with her husband and her children who are 19 and 22.  Her main business activity is buying and selling.  She started her business in order to support her husband since, up until she started her business selling merchandise on credit, he was solely responsible for supporting the household.

Ten years ago, Carmen's sister sent her some footwear, sweaters, shorts, blouses and jeans to sell and, with these products, she managed to gain a set of regular customers who permanently order products from her and recommend her to new buyers.

This is Carmen's fifth loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo: an organization she has been working with for 13 years.  It has supported her with business training and helped direct her investment.  As a result, she has experienced a visible improvement in her business and had additional working capital available to her.  This has helped her to make more profits.  She has given her all to her work and used her moral values to respond to her obligations whilst at the same time benefiting her household.  She dreams of creating well-being for her family, especially as regards helping her children pursue a higher education.  Her goal in the future is to own business premises.  However, her main challenge is dealing with daily ups and downs so that she can remain competitive in the market.

Carmen will use her Kiva loan to buy various merchandise such as sweaters, t-shirts, shorts, blouses and pants.  She hopes to see a quick turn over of her investment because she has orders from customers who pay her very well.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise such as sweaters, t-shirts, shorts, blouses and pants

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Doña Amelia tiene la edad de 42 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Rafael el cual trabaja de choofer con el cual tiene un hijo de nombre David que asiste a la preparatoria, ella y su familia viven en una comunidad de nombre Tetela la cual se encuentra en el estado de Oaxaca, la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera a solo 15 minutos de el ingenio azucarero Don Pablo Machado. 

Doña Amelia nos platica que hace mas de tres años tuvo la inquietud de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar  asi que decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio de venta de antojitos mexicanos(empanadas, gorditas, tostadas, chiles rellenos, tamales, papas, y patanitos fritos) los cuales vende en un pequeño local que tiene ensu casa que da a la carretera al cual a llamado Antojitos Don Chipotle, ella vende solo los fines de semana de viernes a domingo apartir de las siete de la noche, sus vecinos comentan que la comida de doña amelia es muy sabrosa. ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de cebolla, chiles, tomates, cilantro, carne, maiz, tortilla, papas, platanos, aceite, huevos, repollo, crema queso y gas para la elaboracion de sus antojitos y posteriormente venderlos.

ella espera que con esta invesion su negocio prospere ya que desea invertir sus ganancias en la remodelacion y ampliacion de su negocio
texts.en:
Doña Amelia is 42 years old and only has a high school education. She is married to Sr. Rafael, who works as a chauffeur. They have a son named David who is attending preparatory school. Amelia and her family live in the community of Tetela, which is in the State of Oaxaca. This town is located in an area known for growing sugar cane and is 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Doña Amelia says that three years ago she was concerned about helping her husband with the household expenses. She decided to start her own business selling Mexican street food such as empanadas, gorditas, tostadas, stuffed chili peppers, tamales, potatoes, and fried plantains. Amelia sells her food from a small stand at her house that faces the highway. The name of her business is “Antojitos Don Chipotle”. She only sells on the weekends, Friday through Sunday, starting at 7pm. Her neighbors say that her food is very flavorful.

Amelia needs this loan to invest in the purchase of onions, chili peppers, tomatoes, cilantro, meat, corn, tortillas, potatoes, plantains, oil, eggs, cabbage, cream cheese, and gas so that she can prepare and sell her street food. She hopes that this investment will help prosper her business. Amelia has plans to reinvest her earnings by remodeling and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies for her street food business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 55 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Carmen de 56 años de edad. Ellos tienen  2 Hijos, todos mayores de edad que trabajan de forma independiente.
El junto a su señora tienen una modesta despensa, con lo cual pueden mantenerse de forma decorosa. Ellos ya tienen una clientela bien formada, ya que desde hace ya varios años se dedican a este trabajo. Por medio de su despensa ellos pudieron ofrecer una vida digna y decorosa a sus hijos.
Ya que sus hijos ya no dependen de ellos, el trabajo que realizan es para el sustento de ellos, para poder así asegurarse una subsistencia sin privaciones ni necesidades futuras. El solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderías con lo que podrá abastecerse y así ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes. Las mercaderías consistirían en carnes, bebidas, hortalizas, es decir artículos en general para la venta.
texts.en:
Señor Mario is from the city of Santaní.  He is 55 years old, and is married to Señora Carmen who is 56. They have 2 grown children who work independently from them.  He runs a modest store together with his wife, which they are able to maintain decently.  They already have a well-established clientele since they have been doing this work for several years. Through their store they were able to provide a decent and dignified life for their children.

Because their children no longer depend on them, their work now is to support themselves, so as to be able to secure a livelihood free from want and future needs.  He is requesting the loan for the purchase of goods so he can stock up to offer more variety to its customers.  The goods consist of meat, drinks, vegetables, i.e. general items for sale.

loans.use: to buy meat, drinks, vegetable and other items to stock up his store.

loans.name: Vilma Esther

texts.es: Doña Vilma de 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene una hija; trabaja como fisioterapeuta del hospital Jacinto Hernandez desde hace 13 años, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien asume los gastos del hogar. Vilma solicita su 9no crèdito para terminar  de construir una habitaciòn y de esta manera tener mejores condiciones en su hogar para su familia y ademas darle mas valor a su propiedad, ademas tiene la ventaja que su esposo trabaja como albañil y se ahorra el pago de la mano de obra que es bien cara. Su sueño en la vida es seguir estudiando y que a su unica hija goze de salud y  que no le falte lo basico en el hogar.
texts.en: Mrs Vilma, age 36, is married and has one daughter. She has worked as a physiotherapist in the Jacinto Hernandez hospital for 13 years. Her husband, who covers the household costs, supports her. Vilma is requesting her ninth loan to finish building a room and thus have better conditions in her home for her family. This will also increase her property value. They also have the advantage of her husband doing the brickwork, which saves them the cost of labour, which is expensive. Her dream in life is to continue studying, and for her only daughter to have good health, and to never lack the basic necessities.

loans.use: to finish a room.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is 31 years old, married and has three daughters. She is a very good-natured lady and performs her duties as a housewife and mother very well. All of her daughters are very young and haven’t started their education yet.
Rehana supports her husband in operating a grocery store business. Her husband is also a factory worker and when he goes to work Rehana handles the customers by fulfilling their needs. Rehana and her husband run their store from their home and sell daily household items such as sugar and spices etc. at very reasonable rates.
Rehana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy more groceries for his store to achieve greater sales and higher profits. They started this business three years ago and it is working well for them. They hope that an investment will put their business in a more profitable position.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Bebiegean

texts.en: Bebiegean, a 20-year-old married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a retail shop that sells boiled duck eggs or balot for five years.  A new member of HSPFI, Bebiegean is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy duck eggs or balot to sell, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy duck eggs or balot to sell.

loans.name: Qabil

texts.en: Qabil, 46 years old, is married and has three children. Five years ago, Qabil decided to start his own business selling carpets and dowry items. He began the business with his hard earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. He is familiar with this business and provides good customer service. Qabil's shop is located in the central bazaar of Sabirabad. His monthly income is 200 AZN and his son actively helps him. Qabil has many clients and his business keeps growing. In order to increase the range of his carpets, Qabil is requesting a loan of 600 AZN, which he will use to purchase more inventory.

loans.use: to purchase more products to increase profit

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, de 42 años de edad, convive con Gabriel de 44 años y fruto a su relación tienen 03 hijos en etapa escolar y juntos residen en su propia morada situada en la ciudad de San Francisco. Rebeca empezó desde muy niña a trabajar como ayudante de distintas tiendas comerciales, creció con los anhelos de poseer su propia tienda comercial. Su deseo se hizo realidad, que gracias a unos ahorros logró concretarlos, de esta manera han pasado 13 años trabajando de forma independiente. Hoy, con una sonrisa muy despejada y fortalecida, siente que ha cumplido uno de sus primeros objetivos, lo cual le está arrojando buenos resultados económicos, debido a la calidad y la variedad de productos que ofrece a su clientela. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Su puesto de ventas esta situado en la zona céntrica de la comunidad de Rosario. Gracias al préstamo solicitado podrá comprar andamios y una refrigeradora para conservar mejor sus productos. Espera contar con el apoyo financiero para poder reordenar y ofrecer sus productos de manera organizada ya que con ello piensa mejorar y prestar un servicio adecuado a sus consumidores. Este será su segundo crédito y esta muy contenta de  saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de los financistas, ya que así se sentirá segura de progresar. Con el monto solicitado comprará productos para abastecer su puesto de ventas.
texts.en: Rebeca is 42 years old, lives with Gabriel who is 44 years old, and together they have 3 school-aged children. They all live in their own home in San Francisco. Rebeca began working at a very young age in many different stores. She grew up with goals to start her own business. Her dream came true thanks to some savings she made and she has been working independently for 13 years. Nowadays, with a wide and enthusiastic smile she feels she has accomplished one of her most important goals. Her business is rendering lots of profits due to the quality and variety of products she offers to her clients. Normally, she works on her own, but occasionally her children help her. Her store is located in the center of the Rosario community. Thanks to the requested loan she will buy scaffolding and refrigerators to conserve her products.  She counts on this financial support to reorganize and offer her products neatly so her clients can receive adequate treatment and service. This will be her second loan and she is very happy knowing that she can count on this financial help once again since she has confidence in progressing. With the requested loan she will buy more merchandise to stock up her store.

loans.use: buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Vergilio

texts.en:
Vergilio is a 25-year-old married man living in the village of Bugallon Proper Ramon. He earns a living by running a general store, which he has had for one year. From this business alone, he is able to generate an income of 20,000 PHP per month, which he uses to meet his family's daily needs.
Vergilio would like to take a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy a greater variety and greater quantity of basic goods such as assorted biscuits, canned goods, cooking ingredients, soft drinks, instant noodles, oils, eggs, milk, sugar and candies for his general store. He is hoping that this will enable him to meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers to his store. With the requested loan he hopes to be able to generate a bigger income, save some and improve his family's living conditions. Vergilio will be glad if his loan request is granted.

loans.use: to buy groceries for his general store.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 28 years old and a married woman with three children. None of them are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Jigomoni in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Joyce requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Leonida has a "vermi farm" that produces "vermi" waste (worm castings) that can be used as fertilizer. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional "vermi" worms.

Leonida has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Leonida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional "vermi" worms to make fertilizer.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maribel, es conviviente; la socia tiene 32 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos,la socia sigue teniendo sus negocios de venta de salchipapas y venta de ceviche,ella tiene un carreta donde vende estos platos,ella lo realiza en forma ambulatoria,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el ngeocio de venta de salchipapas y ceviche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar salchipapas y ceviche como pescados,papas,salchichas y verduras al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maribel is 32, lives with her partner, and has two children. She continues to have her business selling salchipapas (sliced fried sausage and potatoes), and ceviche (fish marinated in citrus juice). 

She has a cart which she uses to sell these dishes in the street. She works from 8:00am to 9:00pm. She wants to expand and improve her business selling salchipapas and ceviche.

She is applying for the loan to buy ingredients at wholesale for making salchipapas and ceviche, such as fish, potatoes, sausages and vegetables. Maribel is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy ingredients at wholesale for making salchipapas (sliced fried sausage and potatoes)  and ceviche (fish marinated in citrus juice), such as fish, potatoes, sausages and vegetables.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 40 years old and married woman with five children, two of them in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for six years.
Eva requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married and together the couple has 3 children living in Hioma, Uganda. Sarah was dealing in vegetables formerly but now she has diversified her business to include farming. Sarah is venturing in maize, cassava and banana growing. However, she faces a challenge with seasonal weather changes. In the future, she hopes to diversify her business and include other business too. Sarah intends to use the loan to grow maize.

loans.use: to grow maize

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es: La señora Adriana a sus 47 años de edad es madre de cinco hijos de 28, 26, 23, 16 y 11 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida rápida desde hace cuatro meses, luego de tener problemas familiares, la señora Adriana tuvo que independizarse y dejar de trabajar con su hermana. Alterno a esta actividad, la señora Adriana se dedica a la venta de mercancía junto con su esposo, ellos venden en los pueblos cercanos al municipio de Amaga localizado al sur de Antioquia artículos como accesorios femeninos y masculinos como aretes, hebillas para el cabello y bisutería. La señora Adriana desea comprar materia prima para elaborar sus productos comestibles como harina, aceite y huevos y adicional a esto comprar surtido para la venta de mercancía en la cual la demanda aumenta gracias a la temporada de fin de año, con lo cual aumentaran sus ingresos y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia e hijos. La señora Adriana sueña con tener su propio local de comidas y un almacén propio con su esposo.
texts.en:
Señora Adriana is 47 years old and has 5 children aged 28, 26, 23, 16 and 11 years. She has been making and selling fast food for the last 4 months. After some family problems, Señora Adriana had to become independent and stop working with her sister. In addition to this business, she sells merchandise with her husband. They sell items such as men's and women's accessories such as earrings, hair lotion and haberdashery in the towns near the municipality of Amaga, located to the south of Antioquia. Señora Adriana wants to buy raw materials such as flour, oil, eggs with which to make food and in addition buy stock for their sale of merchandise as demand grows with the end-of-year season; this will increase their income and improve their  family's quality of life. 

Señora Adriana dreams of having her own premises selling food and a store with her husband.

loans.use: to buy raw materials with which to make her products such as flour, eggs, oil and in addition buy merchandise to stock and sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya and is married with two children aged two and one still under one year-old.  He has been in farming for seven years and also engages in transport using a donkey cart. His farm produces maize and beans which he sells to the local market.

Simon has requested for a loan of 62,400 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  He says the loan will improve his farming business and help him realise his dream of making farming his source of livelihood.

He laments of the poor state of roads locally and lack of finances for commercial farming. He however states Juhudi loans will be of great help to farmers.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn, pictured with her loom, is a 32-year-old weaver. Her husband is a chef. They have been married since 2000 and have three sons who are in school. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokhorn is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various goods such as Colgate, toilet paper, soap, lotions, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty  is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Letty  has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Letty has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Letty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.es: Doña Ruperta tiene 68 años de edad y está casada con el señor Fidel los cuales tuvieron 4 hijos pero ya todos están casados y viven solos. Desde hace mas de 5 años doña Ruperta se dedica a vender y a criar borregos en su comunidad y comenta que empezó con este negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que con lo que gana su esposo como jornalero no le alcanza para los gastos de la casa. Ella está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de 5 borregos y comprarles alimento para que crezcan más sanos y le urge comprarlos porque en el mes de diciembre es cuando mejores ventas tiene por que las gentes de su población hacen fiestas grandes por la temporada navideña. Dice que uno de sus  propósitos es hacer un nuevo corral donde sus animales puedan estar protegidos de las inclemencias del clima para que no se le enfermen. Comenta doña Ruperta que está muy contenta por trabajar con la financiera por que así su negocio crece y así pueden comer un poco mejor su esposo y ella.
texts.en: Ruperta is 68 years old and lives with her husband Fidel. They have four adult children. For more than five years Ruperta has worked selling and raising sheep in her town. She began this business to help her husband because his earnings as a day laborer were not enough to cover their household expenses. She will use the loan to purchase five sheep and the animal feed needed to keep them healthy. She hopes to purchase them soon because December is the best month for selling sheep because the people in her town have large parties during the Christmas season. One of her plans is to build a new corral where her animals will be protected from the bad weather, so they do not fall ill. Ruperta is very happy working with the bank because it can help her grow her business, and she and her husband can eat a little better.

loans.use: raise and sell sheep

loans.name: Katimbang

texts.en:
Katimbang works hard to support her family. Katimbang is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Katimbang is borrowing PHP 7,500 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because wants to be able to extend her business hours even after nightfall.

Katimbang is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
With 16 years experience in the field of sewing and tailoring, Salma understands the sector, her clients and the concept of supply and demand very well. She also knows that sometimes it is best to change a business and its profile to respond to the costumers' needs and run a profitable small enterprise based on the new directions.

Salma started as a woman's dressmaker in 1997, but since 2010 she is a partner and tailor in a men's suits workshop - a much more profitable and demanded service providing business. The small enterprise is a shared family business and fits perfectly with the demand for having quality traditional suits for men. The imported men clothes do not suit the local market needs neither in design nor in functionality and cultural acceptance.

The demand for Salma's products is high and Salma would like to increase the productivity of the workshop and expand its capacity. An important item for the expansion is a specific equipment, a machine that works well with the thick, quality suit fabrics. 
With the potential for growing her business, Salma qualifies to participate in the WLIFT program and is taking a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 14,000 USD for the expansion of the tailoring workshop and the purchase of equipment for the enlarged business.    

Salma is enthusiastic about learning more about how to improve her business managerial skills. With a highly positive attitude she is an ambitious and hard working tailor, at the same time she is also a wife and a mother of 3 children. At the age of 40 she is already a role model to many other Iraqi women in her area, having earned much respect for both the quality of her work and her dedication to the business.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to expand the tailoring workshop and the purchase equipment for the enlarged business.

loans.name: Leyla Vicenta

texts.es:
María es una mujer ejemplar de profesión maestra de educación primaria, actualmente se desempeña como bibliotecaria en un colegio de la localidad donde vive, se  ha destacado por la atención y apoyo que le brinda a los estudiantes, es casada con 1 hijo al que está apoyando para sus estudios técnicos, su esposo tiene un pequeño taller de ebanistería como otra alternativa económica, 
Esta señora quiere mejorar su vivienda por eso visito ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y realizar un Repello a las paredes, ya que el mismo lo utilizara en la  
 Compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, piedrín, arena y mano de obra, el que le vendría a dar mejores condiciones  a su familia.
texts.en:
María es una mujer ejemplar de profesión maestra de educación primaria, actualmente se desempeña como bibliotecaria en un colegio de la localidad donde vive, se  ha destacado por la atención y apoyo que le brinda a los estudiantes, es casada con 1 hijo al que está apoyando para sus estudios técnicos, su esposo tiene un pequeño taller de ebanistería como otra alternativa económica, 
Esta señora quiere mejorar su vivienda por eso visito ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y realizar un Repello a las paredes, ya que el mismo lo utilizara en la  
 Compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, piedrín, arena y mano de obra, el que le vendría a dar mejores condiciones  a su familia.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as perlin beams, zinc, metal tubes, gravel, sand, bolts, cement, iron, blocks, and wire.

loans.name: Khandy's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Khandy is a 32-year-old mother of three children, all of whom are dependent and still in school. The main source of family’s income is from rice farming. She has been with business for 12 years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR60,000 per day to spend for daily expenses. 
This is the fifth loan for Khandy with VisionFund. She successfully paid back the loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor and land plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman. She has two children with ages 5 years and 12 years. She operates an M-pesa business and a retail shop where she offers mobile-phone-based money-transfer services and also sells sugar, bread, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are individuals. 

She will use the 80,000 KES loan to add M-pesa float and buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have several Mpesa businesses within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have an expanded business. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to better her life.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float and buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items

loans.name: Sok Phap

texts.en: P. Sok Phap is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to help pay for his son's schooling to be a medical doctor. His son has great experience around medicine since P. Sok Phap makes and sells medicine in their village. P. Sok Phap earns about $12.50 a day from his medicine business. His wife is a tailor and earns about $1.25 per day. In addition to caring for his son P. Sok Phap cares for his young grandson. The family is very excited about sending their son to medical school, and anticipates an increased standard of living once he finishes his schooling and becomes a doctor.

loans.use: Pay for son to go to medical school.

loans.name: Anagiz

texts.en: Anagiz M. owns a beauty supply store in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Anaqiz wants to increase the quantity and diversity of her inventory to attract more customers.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and diversity of her inventory

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en: Fetu is a 49-year-old lady who is a Center secretary for the Puipaa Center. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a full-time fisherman, and this is their main source of income. This business pays for the education of their children, clothing for the kids, family dues and village and church financial activities.  Fetu works in her business six days a week and she earns $80+ per day.  She earns a total net profit of $100 a week, and some of this money goes into her savings account with SPBD to assist with her weekly loan repayments if the weather is bad, and her husband can't supply the fish she sells. She is requesting a loan so they can upgrade their fishing equipment and increase their catch.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Mari

texts.es:
Mari is 42 years old and is a single mother with three children. She was abandoned by her children’s father, so she has had to raise them alone. Due to this complicated situation, she confronted the difficulties of life with her small business, which is located in the municipal market of Carapeguá. With this business, she is supporting her children and also her mother, who has come to live with her.

She has a very good client base and would like to invest in selling children’s clothes, since this is what she has had the most demand for over the last few months. In order to do this, she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy baby clothes at whole-sale price. In this way she will progressively increase her income. Her plan is to push her business as far as she can, so that she can continue to provide for children, as father and mother, and see to it that they continue studying.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mari tiene 42 años, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Ella fue abandonada por el padre de sus hijos por lo que tuvo que criarlos sola. Debido a esta complicada situación enfrentó las dificultades de la vida con su microempresa ubicada en el mercado municipal de Carapeguá, con la cual está sustentando a sus hijos y ahora también la madre vino a vivir con ella, a quien también debe dar sustento y cuidados. Ella posee muy buena clientela y ella desea invertir en la venta de ropa para niños, pues es la que mayor demanda ha tenido estos ultimos meses; para ello solicita un crédito que lo utilizará para la compra al por mayor de prendas infantiles y de esta forma aumentar progresivamente sus ingresos. Su plan es empujar al máximo su negocio de esta manera continuar proveyendo a sus hijos como padre y madre, y lograr que sigan estudiando.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing

loans.name: Sindia Adalitza

texts.en:
My name is Sindia Adalitza and I run a small grocery store from a room in my house, which is centrally located within my community. I have been running this business for 3 years and it generates enough income to pay my suppliers and help with my family's living expenses. I have 2 sons who attend elementary school.

Because my sales have increased, I need to buy additional inventory to offer my customers a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Sindia Adalitza, soy comerciante, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los compromisos con los proveedores y contribuir con los gastos de mi familia , tengo 2 hijos los que estan cursando educación Primaria.

Considerando que el volumen de venta ha crecido necesito surtir mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, lard, flour, oil, sausages, dairy products and soap

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha is a married woman whose husband is a day laborer. She started her own business because her husband's salary was not enough to cover their family's basic needs. 8 years ago, she started selling jewelry to her friends and family, and later they began to recommend her to others. Today she has a large clientele that always goes to her when they want to buy jewelry. She is a hard-working and dedicated individual and hopes to continue the growth of her business. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $1100 USD to buy more merchandise for her business, and will pay back the loan in 6 months. She thanks you for your support that allows her business to continue moving ahead. This photograph is of Bertha with a jewlery catalog in her hands.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha es una mujer casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado, ella empezó su negocio por que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, por eso hace 8 años atrás ella empezó vendiendo joyas entre sus familiares y conocidos, y luego ellos la comenzaron a recomendar y ahora ya tiene su cartera de clientes fija y siempre van con ella cuando quieren comprar sus joyas. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora y trabajadora y desea continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer cada vez más.

Bertha está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 1,100 para comprar mercancía para su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married with two children – an 11-year-old daughter (she's in the picture with her Mom) and a 3-year-old son. She and her family live in Berdyansk, Ukraine. Alla owns a business selling men’s and women’s outer wear in the local Kamayevskyi market. Her business is well-known in the market for relatively low prices, the favorable locations of her vending kiosks, and her personal integrity. Presently, Alla has $1000 in inventory and about $1400 of turnover capital. Her monthly net profit is about $700.

Additional financial assistance will help Alla purchase more inventory at reasonable wholesale prices, sell at retail prices, and earn a profit. Generated income will be invested in further expansion of her small venture as well as in improvement of her living standards. One of Alla’s plans for the future is to open one more vending facility. This client can be characterized as a person who always achieves her set goals. We believe Alla’s personal strengths and the sustainability of her business will guarantee prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase inventory for sale

loans.name: Janat

texts.en: “I am fifty years old and have one child. My family and I live in a two-room house in the agricultural belt of Pakistan. One of my sons died a few years back and left a daughter. I have to help my daughter-in-law take care of this grand-daughter. Since I prefer working from home, I run a livestock business so that I do not have to go out much except to the market. I need a loan so that I can purchase a cow ro raise and sell later at a higher price, when the cow is strong enough.”

loans.use: Purchase a cow to raise and sell later at a higher price

loans.name: Paula Antonia

texts.es:
Paula Antonia P. M. is a woman that, for the past six years, has been dedicated to her grocery store, located at the Chichigalpa municipal market in Chinandega.

Since she started her business she has gone through very difficult circumstances, as she is a single mother, who is responsible for her three school-age children. In spite of her low income, she has managed to give her children the education they deserve, supporting them unconditionally and meeting all their needs. In order to advance, Paula has been working with CEPRODEL for four years. She is very satisfied with the obtained loans, as they have been granted timely, enabling her to buy new products to sell at her store. She has a record of 17 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Paula Antonia P. M. es una dama que desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de productos varios (pulpería), teniendo su negocio en el interior del mercado municipal de Chichigalpa en Chinandega.

Desde que inició su negocio, ha pasado por circunstancias muy difíciles debido a que es madre soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres hijos en edad escolar. A pesar de sus bajos ingresos económicos, ha sabido darle a sus hijos la educación que se merecen, cubriéndoles todas sus necesidades y apoyo incondicional en sus estudios. Para poder salir adelante, Paula trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos recibidos, pues se le otorgaron en el momento más oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio, en la compra de nuevos productos para la pulpería. Ella tiene un record de 17 créditos.

loans.use: Investment in her grocery store stock.

loans.name: Fabiola Marleni

texts.es:
Mrs. Fabiola Marleni R. V. is 32 years old, and she finished elementary school. She has 5 children who still depend on her. She lives downtown in the small town of Simon Bolivar, which belongs to the district of Mache, Otuzco province, La Libertad department in Peru.

She works buying and selling small animals such as: pigs, chickens and guinea pigs. She travels through the district of Julcan to buy these animals, fattens them for some time, and sells them for a profit. She offers them to different restaurants in the districts of Mache and Agallpampa.

Her business started with a few small animals, and with the profits she made, she little by little started buying sweets and general store products to set up a small store in her home. After a shot time, she had to close this business because her children ate the sweets and she had nothing to sell; she decided to sell only animals.

With the first loan she received from her communal bank, "Mujeres con Future" (women with future) for S/. 300.00, she was able to increase the quantity of animals to offer for sale, buying piglets and chickens.

With the loan for S/. 800.00, which she will pay in 4 months, she will buy 6 sheep which she will kill at the slaughterhouse to sell their meat.

Mrs. Fabiola is a member of a mothers club in her area called "Corazon de Jesus" (Jesus' heart). Her greatest dream is to open her general store again, to be able to have another source of income to cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Fabiola Marleni Rodríguez V. tiene 32 años de edad, con grado de instrucción primaria completa. Tiene 5 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el centro poblado menor de Simón Bolívar perteneciente al distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco departamento La Libertad - Perú

Se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores tales como: huachos, gallinas, chanchos y cuyes. Viaja al distrito de Julcán para comprar éstos animales, por un tiempo los engorda para venderlos a mayor precio, los ofrece por diferentes restaurantes de los distritos de Mache y Agallpampa.

Su negocio se inició con pocos animales menores, con la ganancia que obtenía poco a poco fue comprando golosinas y abarrotes para acondicionar una pequeña tienda en su casa, al poco tiempo cerro ese negocio debido a que sus niños consumían las golosinas y ya no tenia que vender; decidió vender sólo animales.

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres con Futuro”de S/. 300.00 pudo incrementar la cantidad de animales para vender, compro chanchos pequeños y gallinas.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual pagara en 4 meses ,comprará 6 carneros que matará en el camal para distribuir la carne.

La señora Fabiola es socia del club de madres de su sector llamado “Corazón de Jesús”. Su mayor sueño es aperturar nuevamente su bodega, de esa manera tener otro ingreso para ayudar a cubrir los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Buying animals to sell them later

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. is a trader who buys food stuffs from the farming area and then sends them to town for sale. Demand has increased but she lacks funds to purchase more goods to sell.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to enable her to buy more food stuffs and also to meet the transportation cost.

loans.use: Additional capital to enable her to buy more food stuffs and also to meet the transportation cost.

loans.name: Heanh

texts.en:
Heanh S. is 28 and has had a small business selling groceries in her community since 1999. She earns approximately $2 per day. Her husband, Phan Phan, is a vegetable and rice farmer who works from their farm at home. He makes around $1 a day. The couple have two children who are too young to attend school.

Heanh S. would like to borrow $200 to purchase additional grocery products to expand her inventory and increase her business. She believes that the additional inventory would allow her to be more profitable and contribute more to her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery products to increase inventory

loans.name: Rejena

texts.en:
Mrs. Rejena N. is 31 years old and works as a seamstress in the town of Kalanki. She opened a shop three years ago, and specializes in making custom-fitted dresses that are very popular with Nepali women. Before starting her business, Mrs Nalarmi took a six-month course in tailoring at a shop near where she lives.

She plans to use her loan to buy raw materials for making dresses, and wants to use her income for self improvement and for her daughter's education. In Nepal, the cost of providing a good education is rising, and Mrs. Narkami wants to begin saving her income now so she can provide for her daughter later.

Her husband, Sudip Singh N., is a high-school and college teacher. Their daughter is three years old and attends nursery school .

loans.use: To buy materials for her shop

loans.name: Luk

texts.en: Luk K., 54, is a widow who lives in Sa Ang with three of her children. She is supported by two of her children who work in a garment factory and as a waiter in a local restaurant. Inflation has been very high in Cambodia over the past year, and it has affected food prices and the costs of other basic necessities. Luk K. has turned to CREDIT for a loan of $800 to help her family increase their income and improve their standard of living. With the loan, she would like to purchase a motorbike for her children to ride to work, and with any leftover money, she would like to renovate her home. Public transportation costs have risen alongside gas prices, and this purchase would cut down on needless expenses. Her home is also in need of repair, and the loan can provide enough money to meet both of these needs.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike; Renovate house

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru:
Zebo O. is a 52 year old dressmaker living in the city of Vahdat. She is married and has 5 children. She has been making an income tailoring dresses to order for 10 years. In addition, she owns a plot of land where she grows wheat and vegetables, most of which she ends up selling, but keeps some for herself. Because of this, her business provides her family with an additional source of income. It will soon be time to re-sow her plot, which is why it is essential for her to prepare the land. She has decided to take out a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer. In addition, it is essential for her to buy fuel for her to be able to plow the land. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Ойматова Зебо портниха. Возраст 52 года . Замужем , имеет пятерых детей. Живет в городе Вахдат.10 лет зарабатывает пошивом платьев на заказ. Кроме того имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей и овощами. Получаемый урожай использует для продажи. Но часть оставляет себе. Поэтому этот бизнес дает ее семье дополнительный доход. Скоро наступает сезон посева , поэтому ей необходимо подготовить землю. Она решила получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. Кроме того необходимо купит горючее для вспашки земли. Погашать кредит она сможет в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Sabra's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Sabra is 46 years old. She is married and she has 5 children aged between 10 and 27 years old. She has been selling food, decorations and juice since 2003. Every day, she works from 7 AM to 6 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Sabra now hopes for a loan to buy more food items and decoration items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Salma, who has a business dealing with charcoal and bread sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items and decoration items for her business.

loans.name: Ean

texts.en:
Mrs. Ean S., 30, is married with three children and works as a rice farmer. She grows rice twice a year, depending on the season. In Cambodia, there are two big seasons: dry season and rainy season. The majority of farmers can grow their crops in both seasons, but sometimes they face a problem with water irrigation in a dry season.

Mrs. Ean S. can earn around $1.50 each day from selling her crops. Her husband can make about $5 per day working at a construction site. To increase her family's income, Mrs. Ean S. requests a loan from Kiva to purchase pigs to breed so that she can earn additional income when she sells those pigs six to seven months later. (Her husband is pictured here because Mrs. Ean S. was not available.)

loans.use: Purchase pigs to breed for addtional income

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mme Afi A.  est née en 1970 au Ghana. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Pour faire face aux charges familiales aux cotés de son mari, elle s’est lancée dans l’agriculture, notamment dans la culture du mais, un secteur très prometteur dans la région. Pour augmenter son rendement elle sollicite  un financement pour acheter de l’engrais. Ce financement lui permettra  d’agrandir sa surface cultivable et l’amélioration de sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Afi A. was born in 1970 in Ghana. She is married and the mother of five children. In order to shoulder family responsibilities alongside her husband, she went into agriculture, into raising corn in particular, a very promising sector in the region. Afi is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer in order to increase her yield. This funding would enable her to expand the amount of land she has under cultivation and to improve her way of life.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural additives

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 45 años de edad, es viuda hace 12 años, tiene tres hijos que viven con ella. Después de haberse quedado viuda se dedicó a vender postres en la plaza de su pueblo, después le dieron la oportunidad de vender comida y postres en el cafetín de la escuela. Así trabajó hasta hace 8 meses, que tuvo que dejarlo por motivos de salud.  Paralelamente a su negocio, toda su vida ha sembrado papa, ahora con la ayuda de sus hijos siembra diversas variedades de este tubérculo, para su consumo y para la venta, ya que le dan un buen precio y le deja ganancias fuera de su inversión, su mayor dificultad es que no le alcanza dinero para poder sembrar en mayores cantidades. Elena tiene su 7mo préstamo con MFP, todo este tiempo demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos. La compra que hará será de 20 sacos de guano para el abonado de la papa que le cuesta un aproximado de S/.500.00, además de pagar al operario.
texts.en:
Elena is a 45-year-old woman who has been a widow for 12 years. She has three children who live with her. After having been widowed, she decided to sell pastry in the town square. She was then given the opportunity to sell food and dessert in a school snack bar, where she worked up until 8 months ago when she had to leave the job due to health reasons. Aside from her business, she has grown potatoes all her life. Now, with the help of her children, she grows several varieties of this tuber, both for their consumption and for sale. Customers pay well for her crops, and she is able to make a profit. Her biggest problem, however, is that she does not have enough money to be able to plant greater quantities of potatoes. This is Elena’s 7th loan with MFP, and she has demonstrated payment punctuality the whole time. She will purchase 20 sacks of guano, which will cost approximately 500.00 PEN, to fertilize the potatoes, and she will pay the workers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for potato crops

loans.name: Charito

texts.es: Charito tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su conviviente y sus dos hijos que la quieren mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes dentro de su vivienda desde hace 3 años atrás, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus clientes y que los mismos se sientan satisfechos por la atención que ella les da. Le es rentable debido a que a su negocio concurre mucha gente, además que cuenta con una clientela fiel y le va excelentemente. Es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio, además comprar más productos para surtirse con lo necesario.
texts.en:
Charito is 33 years old and lives with her partner and her two children who love her very much. She has sold groceries from her home for the past 3 years. What she likes about her work is giving good service to her customers, who feel satisfied with the attention she gives them. Her business is profitable because a lot of people come to her and in addition she has a loyal clientele, so things are going quite well. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is a very punctual with her payments. With the money she requests she would like to enlarge her business as well as buy more products so that she can offer what her customers need.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enlarge her business and increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Bancomunal Perlas de la Sabiduría
Ana es conviviente tiene 41 años, tiene cinco hijos los de 24 y 20 estudian en un instituto superior, el de 13 años esta en el colegio y los de  2 y 4 años  en casa 
Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace dos años también vende ropa, su hijo mayor se fue al norte a estudiar, y le tiene que enviar cada mes dinero para sus estudios, también ella manda al norte videos para que su hijo los venda.
El estar en Finca le ha ayudado a especializarse en las ventas y como llevar su negocio, sobre todo ve un crecimiento.

Necesita un préstamo de 800 que va invertir en la compra de ropa para la campaña navideña
Los sueños de Ana son poner una tienda en su casa  que este bien surtida, que sus hijos sean profesionales, tengan un  buen trabajo, tener una casa propia
Manda videos al norte para venta
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the “Perlas de la Sabiduría” (Pearls of Wisdom) Communal Bank. Ana is 41 years old, has a partner, and five children. The children ages 24 and 20 study in college, the 13 year old is in school and the 2 and 4 year olds are at home. She has been selling cosmetics for 2 years and she also sells clothing. Her oldest child went north to study, and she has to send him money every month for his schooling. She also sends videos north for her son to sell. Being a member of Finca has helped her focus on sales and learn how to run her business, and above all experience growth. She needs a loan for 800 soles to invest in the purchase of clothing for the Christmas season. Ana dreams of opening a well-stocked store in her home, that her children become professionals, that they have good work, and that she has her own home. She sends videos north to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith tiene 21 años, es madre soltera, vive con su pequeño hijo en su casa hecha de material noble. Con el fin de brindarle estudios adecuados a su menor hijo, Judith se levanta todos los días a las 6 de la mañana, prepara los objetos de segundo uso que compró y arregló un día antes y sale a venderlos, sabiendo que de esta manera logrará su objetivo de hacer de su hijo un hombre de bien. La venta de sus artículos es continuamente una alegría para Judith, puesto que conversa con sus clientes, quienes siempre le dejan un buen dinero por su mercadería. Nos comenta que lo más difícil de su trabajo es refaccionar los objetos usados que compra, pero de todas maneras, siempre lo hace con una sonrisa en el rostro. Este es ya, el segundo préstamo que Judith realiza con Microfinanzas PRISMA, y al igual que el primero, está comprometida a pagarlo a tiempo. Con este dinero planea comprar más objetos usados para aumentar sus ventas, Judith sabe que de esta manera asegurará el futuro de su hijo.
texts.en:
Judith is 21, she is a single mom and lives with her little boy. With the purpose of providing her young son with adequate studies, Judith gets up at 6 a.m. every morning, gathers the second hand items that she bought and fixed the day before, and goes out to sell them, knowing that this way she will achieve her goal of helping her son become a good man. The sale of items is a continuous joy for Judith, because she gets to talk to her clients, who always give her good money for the merchandise. She tells us that the most difficult part of her job is to fix the used items that she buys; however, she does it with a smile on her face anyway. This is now the second loan that Judith gets through Microfinanzas PRISMA, and just like the first loan, she is committed to repay on time. With this money she plans to purchase more used items to increase sales. Judith knows that this way she will secure her son’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for sale

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Sabaly de l’association Benkadi  est composé de huit femmes qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Tobougou dans la préfecture de Dioïla région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce et de parenté.
 Dans l’objectif d’augmenter le volume de leur stock elles ont adhéré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
 Ces femmes comptent acheter, 600 sacs de charbon de bois auprès des charbonniers de N’Tobougou et environs. Les charbons de bois sont revendus en gros et au comptant dans le village aux grossistes venus de Dioïla. 
Elles comptent avoir, 10 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune  qui  servira à acheter des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The Sabaly group of the Benkadi association is made up of eight women who average 35 years of age and 6 children. They live in extended traditional families in the village of N’Tobougou, in the prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. These women got acquainted through bonds of business and kinship. With the goal of bolstering their stock, they joined Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their fifth solidarity loan (group loan). The previous loans were repaid without problems. These women intend to buy 600 sacks of charcoal from producers in N'Tobougou and in the surrounding villages. Charcoal is then resold, for cash, to wholesalers coming from Dioïla. They intend to turn a profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 20) each, to be used to purchase small ruminants.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell charcoal

loans.name: Guadalupe Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Guadalupe" esta representado por la señora Pacesa y es un grupo nuevo que esta formado por 12 personas que se dedican a actividades comerciales como a la venta D. dulces, comida, pan, ropa, servicio D. trasporte en moto taxis y al servicio D. limpieza. Los socios (as) están concientes D. la competencia pero su deseo D. superación y su necesidad D. mantener a su familia es más granD.. El financiamiento esta destinado a la compra D. insumos, materiales y al mejoramiento D. las herramientas D. trabajo. Los socios (as) cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios y saben como cumplir con sus obligaciones en especial si les sirve para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Guadalupe Communal Bank has 12 members and is represented by Señora Pacesa. It is a new group and many of its members dedicate themselves to businesses like selling sweets, meals, and clothing. Other members run motorcycle taxis or offer cleaning services. The group's members are good at what they do but more than anything, they are driven by a desire to succeed and the need to support their families. This loan will be used to buy ingredients, supplies, and to improve the tools that the members work with. The members have experience with communal banking and are mutually supportive. They also know how to manage their obligations responsibly and do so because it helps them improve their families' quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El cliente tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su hijo Diego de 17 años de edad que está cursando el 3º año de la media en el colegio 12 de Junio de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo. El señor Jorge C. es viudo hace 6 año y desde entonces se hace cargo de su hijo y de su mantensión. 

Su trabajo de toda la vida es el trabajo en reparación de chaperia y pintura de vehiculos, ademas de soldaduras y trabajos de pintura.
