Dicho trabajo lo realiza en su propio domicilio en donde monto un tinglado para los trabajos que realiza. Solicito dicho monto para levantar un vehiculo que tiene en su taller hace tiempo.
texts.en:
The client is 45 years old, lives with his son Diego of 17 years of age who is in the third year of high school in the June 12th School of the city of Coronel Oviedo. Mr. Jorge C. became a widower 6 years ago and since then has been taking care of his son and his support. He has worked all his life in auto body repair and painting, also welding and painting. He does his work at his residence where he built a shed for this purpose. He is requesting this amount to be able to finish a vehicle that he has had in his shop for some time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 35 años, es madre de 3 hijos, vive con su esposo quien es maestro constructor. Esta familia habita en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches afuera de su casa, en un espacio que acondiciona cada día para esta labor, para complementar sus platos a la parrilla y otros, también vende bebidas heladas, debido al intenso calor de la zona. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es relacionarse con muchas personas, además le es rentable porque ya cuenta con clientes regulares que siempre acuden a degustar de su buen a sazón. Esta es la primera vez tiene un préstamo con MFP y se siente muy contenta por la oportunidad  de salir adelante en su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita comprará calaminas y madera para construir un local más adecuado y dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nancy is 35 years old. She has 3 children. She lives with her husband who is a construction supervisor. They own they house where they live. Four years ago, she started selling food at night outsider her home, in a stand she has ready for this task. She sells barbecue dishes and ice drinks, due to the high heat of the area. What she likes about her job is to be able to talk to many people. Besides, it is also very profitable as she has regular customers that attend her stand every day to taste her delicious meals. This is the first time she requests of a loan to MFP and she is very happy about this opportunity to continue running her business. With the money she will receive, she will purchase plate sheets and wood to build a more suitable stand and provide a better service for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build her own business

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Irma es conviviente, tiene 38 años, tres hijos de 14, 12 años y el último de 4 meses, los hijos mayores están en la escuela estatal.
Empezó vendiendo tamales para pagar la mensualidad del colegio de sus hijos, reparte tamales a todo los mercados de Manchay – Pachacamac, semanal reparte 100 tamales con la ayuda de sus hijos. 
Irma necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra poner un locutorio publico en la puerta de su casa, y compra de celulares.
Desde que esta en Finca  aprendió ahorrar a ser responsable y ser  puntual.  
El sueño de Irma es que sus hijos sean profesionales, actualmente tiene los primeros puestos en el colegio ella quiere verlos  estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the community bank, Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.

Irma lives with her partner, is 38 years old, and has three children aged 14, 12 and 4 months. The older children study in the state school.

She began selling tamales to pay the costs of her children’s schooling. She delivers tamales to all the markets in Manchay, Pachacamac. She delivers 100 tamales weekly with the help of her children.

Irma needs a loan of 1200 soles ($425 USD) to put a public phone booth in the door of her house and buy cellular phones.

Since she has been with the Finca, she has learned to save, be responsible and be punctual.

Irma’s dream is that her children become professionals. Currently, they are first in their classes in school. She wants to see them study in a university.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Irma necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra poner un locutorio publico en la puerta de su casa, y compra de celulares.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Johnape

texts.en:
Johnape B. is from the village of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Johnape is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Johnape owns and operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. She is also engaged in the food service business, cooking snack foods and peddling them to her neighbors. Johnape has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Johnape joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Johnape is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Johnape from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family and for the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Santos Juliana

texts.es: La señora Santos Juliana L. es Originaria de la Comunidad de Patzarajmac del municipio de Totonicapan ha su edad quiere dar un buen ejemplo para sus nietos y para su familia apesar de la edad hoy sigue trabajando en el bordado  manuales, para el bienestar de ella y de su familia ella comenta que el trabajo  que ella aprendio muchas señoritas llegan a su humilde hogar en quere aprender el arte con el unico fin de mejorar su nivel de vida  con un ofici, doña Santos necesita de un credito para la compra de herramienta, telas, conos, moldes.
texts.en:
Santos Juliana L. is from the Patzarajmac community in the Totonicapán municipality. At her age, she wants to set a good example for her grandchildren and for her family. In spite of her age, she keeps working at embroidering by hand for her own well being and that of her family. Many ladies come to her humble home wanting to learn her art. Their only goal is to improve their quality of life with a skill. Santos needs a loan to buy tools, fabric, spools of thread, and patterns.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Benedit

texts.en: Benedit E. is married with nine children. He is a 49-year-old farmer. He hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to hire laborers to clear his farmland. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire laborers to clear his farm

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is the proud owner of her own in-home daycare business in Massachusetts. In her home country of Ecuador she was also a businesswoman. Ten years ago she came to the United States to start something new and it was natural for her to pursue a business of her own. Teresa is married with two children. Her husband cleans commercial businesses and her two children are grown professionals. 

Teresa has had a low number of children this summer, which can be a common challenge for many daycare providers. To help her through the fluctuation in her income, she has requested a loan from ACCION USA to provide her with working capital and to purchase supplies and toys for the children. This loan will help her to stay in business during the slow season. Without the loan she was worried that she may have to close her doors.

Teresa has been a victim of predatory lending in the past, but working with ACCION USA she says: "I felt secure – they gave me a hope, a medium, a way to continue forward; they’ve opened a pathway to proceed."

Teresa adores children. She says that it is a lot of responsibility to care for other people's children – their safety is her top concern. Currently Teresa has two employees and she has even higher hopes for the future. Teresa's plan is to one day own a daycare training institute where she would train future daycare providers.

loans.use: To use as working capital and to purchase supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca I. is from the village of Laturan, Libona Bukidnon. She is 64 years old. Francisca is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling products such as dried fish in the local community. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Francisca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Francisca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nurmahmad

texts.ru: Нурмахмад Исоев проживает в районе Абдурахмони Чоми. Возраст 33 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Нурмахмад более 7 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Его основные покупатели это мясники. Жена смотрит за домом и детьми. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Nurmahmad I. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 33 years old, married and has 4 children. Nurmahmad has been involved in animal husbandry for over 7 years. He raises and sells livestock. His primary customers are butchers. His wife looks after the house and children. Nurmahmad is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Josefa Betty

texts.es:
Josefa es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasun que significa Trabajemos.
Josefa es soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Josefa vende frutas variadas en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria, ademas Josefa trabaja en una panaderia. Josefa se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en su casa.
Josefa necesita un prestamo de 1200 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra de pollos y cuy.
Los sueños de Josefa son tener una negocio estable y una pasteleria.

loans.use: Para la compra de pollos y cuy.

loans.name: Tiburcio

texts.es:
Tiburcio  vive en la avenida 4  de la zona Puerto Mejillones en la ciudad de El Alto, ocupa tres habitaciones en la casa de sus padres, su esposa colabora con los quehaceres del hogar y el cuidado de sus tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar.
Trabaja como comerciante de condimentos (ají, locoto, ajo, canela, clavo de olor, etc.) de manera ambulante en diferentes mercados de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de mayor cantidad de mercadería y así mejorar sus ventas
 
Es el primer  crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada  califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Tiburcio.

loans.use: compra de condimentos (aji, locoto, ajo, canela, clavo de olor, etc.) al por mayor, para su venta al por menor

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy C., 52 and her husband, Chanthy C., 51, live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1979 and have three children: two daughters are married and live in separated homes and one son attends school. 

Chanthy and her husband have rented space in their house since 1990.  Their house is located near a garment factory.  The couple hopes to build more rooms to met their customer’s needs. 

Hence, Chanthy is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to build more rooms to rent.

loans.use: Build more rooms for renting.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky O. is from the village of Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Vicky is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Vicky owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp. Vicky has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vicky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and enable her to engage in business activities. Vicky is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Vicky from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chuchie

texts.en:
Chuchie farms rice for a living. She is 35 years old and has three children; the eldest of which is only six years old. In addition to her rice field, she has a pig pen. The income she gets from her business is enough to meet her family's needs.

Through Community Economic Ventures, Inc. she is requesting a loan of 15,000 Php to buy fertilizers and farming supplies. With this loan, she will be able to finance her business with a low interest.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and farming supplies.

loans.name: Kukatonor Group

texts.en:
Comfort M. is the leader of a group of 4 borrowers called 'Kukatonor'. She is 35 years old, married with 2 children aged 6 and 10 years old , and their educational levels are 4th- -7th grade. She cares for 2 siblings.

Comfort is a 7th grade drop-out due to lack of financial support. She lives and works in the Phebe community, Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county, Liberia. Her business is the sale of general goods and palm oil. She buys goods wholesale and sells retail to residents of her community in Gbarnga.

Comfort has been running this business for 4 years, and is hoping to improve her business to selling internationally. She faces a problem with the bad road conditions and high transportation rate from where she buys goods to her business site.

Comfort needs this loan to purchase additional goods to improve business. She dreams of giving her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to improve business

loans.name: Norome Group

texts.es:
El grupo Norome está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras ellas son Anastía G. quien desde hace dos años empezó a comercializar perfumes y cosmético, Petrona M. P. de 20 años vende frutas y Zeneyda del Socorro M. negocia ropa usada. 

Ellas desean invertir su crédito en el negocio aprovechando que en estas fechas el comercio aumenta.
texts.en:
The Norome group is made up of 3 hardworking women, they are: Anastía G., who started selling perfumes and cosmetics two years ago, Petrona M. Paramo, who has sold fruit and vegetables for 20 years, and Zeneyda del Socorro M., who sells used clothing. They would like to use the loan to invest in their businesses, taking advantage of the fact that during this season sales tend to increase.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cosmetics

loans.name: Chi Vorn

texts.en: Mr. Chi Vorn S. lives in Ampil Rieng village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Chea Lin Na, are grocers in the local market. Since this business is going well, they want to expand it so Mr. Chi Vorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to re-sell. Mr. Chi Vorn S. is a father of a child who is too young to work or study. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy groceries to re-sell.

loans.name: Pacaycasa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Pacaycasa, inicia su ciclo 20 con 19 socias. Las socias son del distrito de Pacaycasa que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de abarrotes en general, verduras, animales menores, tara, cochinilla, comida, golosinas, ladrillos y frutas.

Como es el caso de la señora Justina que es soltera, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Justina se dedica a la compra y venta de tara, cochinilla, tuna, además tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, Justina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abarrotes.

Mientras que Otilia es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Otilia vende comida en el campo deportivo de su distrito, actividad que realiza los días domingos, además compra y vende tara, cochinilla. Otilia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de peones.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total de 12,900 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de verduras, tierra, arroz, azúcar, animales menores, tara, cochinilla y para el pago de peones.

Los sueños de las socias son construir su casa, ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos, ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Pacaycasa group began their 20th loan with 19 members. The group members are from the Pacaycasa district which is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. The members have different businesses like the sale of groceries, vegetables, small animals, tara, cochinilla, foods, candies, bricks and fruits. As is the case with Señora Justina, who is single and is 34 with one son, Justina buys and sells tara, cochinilla, tuna, and also has a grocery store in her house. Justina needs a loan of 600 soles to invest in the purchase of groceries. While Otilia lives with her partner, she is 36 años and has 2 children, Otilia sells food at the sports field in her district on Sundays, she also buys and sells tara and cochinilla. Otilia needs a loan of 900 soles to pay workers. The group members need different amounts of loans from 300 soles, 600soles, 900 soles making a total of 12,900 soles loans for the group. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of vegetables, dirt, rice, sugar, small animals, tara, cochinilla and to pay employees. The dreams of the group members are to build a house, to save for the education of their children and to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables, dirt, rice, sugar, small animals, tara, cochinilla and to pay employees

loans.name: Olga Amada

texts.es:
Olga Amada G. C. tiene 52 años, es casada, y vive con su esposo y 9 de sus hijos.  Tenía 12 hijos pero 11 están vivos porque uno falleció cuando unos ladrones le robaron y le mataron mientras venía a casa una noche de su trabajo en Quito.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas. La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maíz como los principales cultivos.

Olga se dedica a los haceres domesticos.  Cocina, plancha, limpia, y cuida a los hijos en la casa. También ayuda a su esposo en el trabajo del campo.  Su esposo trabaja sembrando maiz, papas, habas, arvejas, trigo, y cebada.  Sacan los productos a las ferias en San Pablo y San Miguel.  Solicita el crédito para comprar los abonos para sembrar el maiz.

Su meta es ayudarles a sus hijos en las vidas y en los estudios para que salgan adelante.  En sus ratos libres, le gusta preparar la comida y ensaladas de las cosechas para los hijos.
texts.en:
Olga Amada G. C. is 52 years old, married, and lives with her husband and nine children. She had 12 children but only 11 are alive because one died when thieves robbed and killed him while he was returning from his job in Quito one night. This member belongs to the rural communal bank "San Jose de las Orquideas" which is located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the community of San Jose de Palmas. Most people in the community are farmers whose principal crops are potatoes and corn. Olga does housework. She cooks, irons, cleans, and takes care of the children who are at home. She also helps her husband with his work in the fields. Her husband plants corn, potatoes, beans, peas, wheat, and barely. They take their products to the fairs in San Pablo y San Miguel. Olga is asking for the loan to buy fertilizers to plant corn. Her goal is to help her children get ahead in their lives and studies. In her free time, she likes to make food and salads (from their harvests) for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to plant corn

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha G., 43, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. Married to Ernesto G., an overseas Filipino worker, they are blessed with six children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her food vending canteen for nine years.

Editha has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than eight years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow several times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy food ingredients for her canteen.
 
Now, with your help, Editha would like to obtain a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying ingredients for the viands she sells in her canteen.

Editha dreams that her business will grow so that she and her husband can save enough money to buy their own house and lot.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the viands she sells in her canteen

loans.name: Mema Group

texts.en:
Rehema W., age 26, is single. She has a grocery and a retail shop, which she started two years ago.  She works from 6am to 11pm and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $148.

This will be Rehema’s second motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. (A motisha loan is a loan product offered by Tujijenge that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.) She used the previous loan to increase her business stock and she has paid back the loan successfully. She hopes for a new loan to improve her grocery and retail shop stock.

Rehema will share this loan with her subgroup, Mema Group, which totals six members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Rehema is the only woman.

loans.use: To increase her grocery stock

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina es una madre de familia de 66 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el centro poblado menor Lives del distrito de Unión Agua Blanca, un distrito ubicado en la serranía de la provincia de San Miguel, en la región Cajamarca, ubicada a cuatro horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Como la mayoría de habitantes del lugar, Carolina se dedica junto a su esposo a actividades agrícolas y de ganadería para sobrevivir. Gracias a estos ingresos han podido salir adelante y críar a sus hijos que ahora ya tienen sus propias familias. Actualmente en la zona se siembran diversos productos como maíz, papa, trigo, quinua, entre otros.

Adicionalmente también crían vacas de las cuales extraen la leche para luego venderla y así hacerse de ingresos diarios, ya que la agricultura es una actividad que no les brinda ingresos estables. Carolina desea mejorar la producción de su ganado lechero, por eso piensa adquirir alimento balanceado, como no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para realizar esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Carolina es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre ha velado por el progreso de su familia. Ella es muy estimada por las personas que la conocen, las que la consideran una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Carolina is a 66-year old mother with a family, who lives together with her husband in the small central village Lives, in the district of Unión Agua Blanca, a district located in the mountainous region of the San Miguel province, in the region Cajamarca. It is located four and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Like the majority of residents of this place, Carolina and her husband do agricultural activities and livestock farming to survive. Thanks to this income, they have been able to get ahead and raise their children who now have their own families. Currently in the region they harvest diverse products such as corn, potatoes, wheat, and quinoa, among others.

Additionally, they also raise cows from which they extract the milk to then sell and make their daily income, since agriculture is an activity that doesn't offer them stable income. Carolina wishes to improve the production of her milk-producing livestock and for this she is thinking about acquiring feed. As she doesn't have sufficient resources to do so, she sees it necessary for the first time to request from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 2,000 new soles.

Carolina is a hard-working woman and has always watched over the progress of her family. She is very dear to the people who know her, and they consider her a responsible women with confidence.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for improving the production of her milk-producing livestock

location.town: CPM Lives - Unión Agua Blanca - San Miguel - Cajam

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo G., 45 years old, dreams of having a healthy income to support the daily needs in his family. He learned about CEVI’s microfinance services and ventured into a rice farming business. He sells rice, and the income that he generates is what he uses to buy food, clothing and pay the other expenses in their home. He started his business last May 2009. He would like to apply another loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Yansy Marcela

texts.es: Yansy Marcela B. R., tiene la edad de 28 años, está soltera y vive con su hijo de 8 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de inventario para su negocio. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de productos para ofrecer en su pulpería. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio, además de aportar mayores ingresos para su economía. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecida con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Ella espera en un futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
texts.en:
Yansy Marcela B. R. is 28 years old, single, and lives with her 8 year old son. This loan will be used to purchase inventory for her business. She wants to have a larger stock and wider variety of products to offer in her store. Yansy started this business several years ago and has very good customers. She needs to offer a better variety of products in her business so that she can generate more income to support herself financially. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the services that have been provided. She hopes in the future to have a better quality life and greater financial stability. In addition, she wants to continue growing as a person and as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Saica

texts.en:
Saica M. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 30 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Saica owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of her income comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Saica has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Saica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saica successfully repaid her last loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase additional products to sell. She has now requested a new loan, her fifth with GDMPC, of 20,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is currently in the business of selling dresses and pairs of trousers at the local market and is requesting a loan to stock bedsheets and sandles to sell.  Josephine is 47 years old and is widowed.   She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bedsheets and pairs of sandles to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
La solicitante Erlinda V. M., es una persona joven, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 9 meses, con su pequeña tienda de barrio quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida y también con este trabajo puede cuidar a su hijo mientras está trabajando. 

Erlinda vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba, es su casa abrió una tienda de abarrotes de primera necesidad como ser azúcar, fideo, arroz, leche, pan y otros como galletes, papel higiénico, dulces.  La zona donde trabaja es una zona lechera, hay una parada de transporte publico y hay flujo de gente, lo que le ayuda en el movimiento de su negocio.

El crédito que solicita es para poder comprar más abarrotes para así poder tener mayor variedad  de productos que pueda vender y así de esta manera poder incrementar sus ingresos, su mayor sueño es tener en  un futuro suficiente plata para poder abrir un macro mercado o supermercado en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Erlinda V. M. is a single, young woman who has a 9 month old son. She runs a small neighborhood store that she hopes will help improve her living conditions. She can also take care of her son here while she is working. Erlinda lives in the city of Cochabamba. She opened a grocery store in her house that sells basic necessities such as sugar, noodles, rice, milk, bread and other things like cookies, toilet paper and candy. Her store is located in a dairy farming region. There is also a public transportation stop nearby, as well as a stream of people, which helps business. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise so that she can offer a wide variety of products to sell and increase her income. Her dream is to have enough money in the future to open a large store or supermarket in the area where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her neighborhood store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B. is from the village of Balaos, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 40 years old. Evangeline is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business providing hairdressing & beauty services, especially pedicures and manicures, to local community members. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

location.town: Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Julio Omario

texts.es:
Julio Omario A. C. tiene 25 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 niña de 4 años.

Julio es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Julio se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao cada fin del mes. 

Solicita el préstamo para cultivar sembríos de cacao para cambiar su economía personal y familiar. Su sueño es seguir adelante con su trabajo y de esta manera dar una buena educación a su hija. 

Le gusta practicar el juego de billar.
texts.en:
Julio Omario A. C. is 25 years old. He lives with his common-law wife in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolívar province. He has one daughter who is 4 years old. Julio is a member of the rural solidarity group El Placer, located three hours from Chillanes. It has a total of 19 members, most of whom are involved in growing corn and cacao [cocoa]. This is their first loan through the San José Cooperative. Julio works in agriculture, growing corn and cacao. He makes his purchases and his sales in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month. He is requesting the loan so he can cultivate more cacao crops, in order to improve his personal economic situation and that of his family. His dream is to continue with his work so that he can give a good education to his daughter. He enjoys playing billiards.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing cacao

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
Dulce Maria M. A. reside en el Barrio Las Flores de la ciudad de Juticalpa, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus dos hijos. Dulce tiene una pequeña sala de belleza que atiende de Lunes a Sabado desde las 7:00 am hasta las 7:00 pm y cuando sus clientas lo requieren ella presta sus servicios los dias Domingos y cuando estas no pueden ir a su negocio ella va a su domicilio a atenderlos. 

Dulce es una persona muy conocida en el barrio y cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus clientes y vecinos. Ella solicita este prestamo para poder comprar una gran variedad de tintes y tratamientos para el cabello, shampoos, acondicionadores, listick, barniz para uñas, desodorantes, de manera que sus clientas encuentren lo que necesiten para estar siempre bellas. 

Es una mujer que se esfuerza mucho en hacer su trabajo bien para que la clientela de su negocio crezca o en todo caso sigua manteniendose estable. El prestamo sera de mucho beneficio ya que con las ganancias que obtenga podra seguir sosteniento a sus hijos ya que dependen completamente de ella. Ella sueña con tener su propia casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales. Ha sido clienta de FAMA por varios ciclos y conducta de pago es buena.
texts.en:
Dulce Maria M. A. is a 35 year old single mother with two children. They live together in the Las Flores neighborhood of the city of Juticalpa. Dulce has a small beauty salon that she runs Monday through Saturday, from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM. She is also available on Sundays, whenever her customers need her, and also makes house calls when they are unable to go to her salon. [She] is very well known in her neighborhood and comes with very good references from her customers and neighbors. She is asking for this loan in order to buy a large variety of hair coloring, hair treatments, shampoos, conditioners, lipsticks, nail polish, and deodorants, so that her customers will always be able to find what they need to be beautiful. She is a woman who puts a great emphasis on doing her job well, so that her customer base will grow, or at the very least remain stable. This loan will be of great benefit to her because the income that it will produce will allow her to continue supporting her children who depend completely on her. She hopes to have her own home someday and also that her children will have professional careers. [Dulce] has been a client of FAMA for a number of cycles and has had a good repayment record.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and inventory

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia M. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Jomgao, Argao, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband, Dionisio M., who is 53 years old, works as a Barangay Kagawad (a village councilor) and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 15 and 27 years old. Eugenia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 9th loan, Eugenia is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save for the future for the improvement of her business. Eugenia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mr. Sum B., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Chanthy Minh, 43, live in a small village on National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1987 and have four children: one son and three daughters.

Sum and his wife are farmers, growing rice on their farmland in the village. They do not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their rice farm and so Sum is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to help him solve this problem.

Mr. Sum B. was not available for the picture, so his wife is pictured.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm

loans.name: Seihry Isabel

texts.es: La señora Seihry es Madre soltera de dos niños, es una mujer muy admirable ya que ah sacado a sus hijos adelante. Ella trabaja mucho para darles a sus pequeños hijos lo mejor. Hace poco tiempo adquirió una casa de interés social  pero no se ah ido a vivir ahí por que teme por la seguridad de ella y de sus hijos, por eso esta solicitando este crédito, para construir una barda al frente de su vivienda y así poder vivir ahí con sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Seihry is a single mother of two children. She is an admirable woman in that she has managed to move her children ahead. She works hard to provide her young children with the best. She recently acquired a house through a government subsidized, low income housing program but hasn’t moved in yet because she fears for her own and her children’s safety. This is why she’s asking for a loan to build a wall in the front of the property so that she can live there with her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson has been practicing mixed farming for thirty-five years in Kisii town, western Kenya. He has employed four farmhands from his community. His farm produces bananas, maize, milk, eggs, pineapples, nappier grass and tea which he sells at the local market and through Kenya Tea Development Authority. He depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the needs of his family. His biggest challenge has been lack of enough animal feed and transportation problems.

Samson recently repaid his previous loan of 30,000 KES and has requested this loan of 60,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He hopes the income from this loan will enable him to send his children to better schools. In future, he plans to expand his dairy farming and own at least four good quality dairy cows and also expand his poultry farming. 

Samson is 52 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 7 children who are between the ages of 15 and 31.  Three of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg A. is 51 years old and lives with her daughter in a Mongolian nomadic dwelling called a ger in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her daughter, Ariunzaya, helps with her business but her daughter is planning to operate a coal and wood trading business individually in the future. Erdenechimeg operates a grocery trading business in her local town. She started her business in June of 2010 after working as a tailor in a sewing company. Her business helps her to support the family. She hopes to expand her business by increasing her working capital so that she can improve her family's standard of living. For the future, she plans to enlarge her small grocery shop into a big supermarket. She needs more funds in order to increase her current working capital; therefore, she is requesting a 700,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase coal and firewood for her daughter's trading business.

loans.use: To purchase coal and firewood

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Tsetsgee S. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Bayanhongor Province in Central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. One of her children is a university student and a second attends a local secondary school. 

Tsetsgee currently operates three separate businesses in her town with the help of her husband. Their businesses include used shoe trading, a cafe and a taxi service. Tsetsgee manages the cafe and the second hand shoe trading business. Her husband is responsible for managing the taxi service. She started her cafe in 2007 and has built a stable operation. Since 2008, she has been selling a variety of second hand shoes imported from Germany and has built a stable operation except during the winter months. They have found success in all three ventures and have a strong customer base throughout their community.

 For the future, the couple is planning to continue growing all their businesses. Tsetsgee is a modest and hardworking woman. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of second hand shoes for her retail business.

loans.use: To purchase second hand shoes for resale

loans.name: Forkland Group

texts.en:
Bartazar K. is in his early 20s and is single. Bartazar runs a general store. The store is open between 6am and 10pm and earns him a good monthly profit. 

This will be Bartazar's fifth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to buy a motorcycle and open another general store nearby. These loans were all successfully repaid. With this loan, he aims to start building his own store and stop renting. 

Bartazar's dream is to travel overseas and buy clothes and shoes for a good sale.

Bartazar will share this loan with his loan group Forkland, which totals 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Bartazar can be seen second from left in a blue shirt, in the back row.

loans.use: To start building his own store.

loans.name: Sara Esther

texts.es: La señora Sara González V. es una emprendedora mujer que desde hace 12 años se dedica a vender mercancía por catálogo en Barranquilla. Vive en un pequeño apartamento al norte de la ciudad en compañía de su único hijo varón, que es mayor de edad y está próximo a casarse. La usuaria ha logrado consolidar una buena clientela que desde años tras año crece. Recientemente fue ascendida a la categoría de “lider” por el volumen de venta y el número de nuevos vendedores que ha vinculado a la empresa. Ella bonifica por las ventas que realicen sus recomendados. Las ventas promedios mensuales de la señora Sara son de $ 1.200.000, su margen promedio de utilidad es del 35%, aunque en ocasiones aumenta cuando aprovecha las promociones del mes y compra grandes cantidades de artículos con descuentos que superan el 50%. Este es el cuarto crédito que la usuaria tramita con la Fundación y su primer Credikiva. Planea invertirlo en la compra de colonias, perfumes, cosméticos, ropa deportiva y accesorios para damas. Siempre se ha distinguido por su puntualidad en los pagos y su disposición a participar de manera entusiasta en todos los eventos a los que se les invita. La señora Sara, además de comerciante, es estilista de belleza y suele aprovechar las visitas a sus clientas para ofrecerle sus servicios. Con la proximidad de la temporada de fin de año las ventas y los pedidos se han incrementado considerablemente. La usuaria sueña con abrir al público un pequeño almacén en el cual pueda ofrecer todos sus productos, confía en que el próximo año pueda lograr hacer realidad ese proyecto.
texts.en:
Mrs Sara González V. is an enterprising woman who has been selling merchandise through catalogs in Barranquilla for 12 years.  She lives in a small apartment in the north of the city with her only son who is grown up and about to get married.  Sara has managed to establish a good client base which has been growing over the years.  She recently reached the category of 'leader' because of her sales volume and the number of new salespeople that she has introduced to the business.  She gets a discount for the sales that the people she has recommended make.

Sara's average monthly sales total 1,200,000 pesos.  Her average profit margin is 35% although it sometimes increases when she takes advantage of monthly promotions and buys larger quantities of articles with discounts that exceed 50%.

This is Sara's fourth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her first Kiva loan.  She plans to invest the money in buying aftershave, perfume, cosmetics, sports clothes and ladies' accessories.  She has always stood out for her punctuality in making her repayments and her willingness to participate enthusiastically in all the events to which she is invited.  As well as being a saleswoman, Sara is also a beauty stylist and she usually takes advantage of her customers' visits to offer them these services.  With the end-of-year season approaching, her sales and orders have increased considerably.  She dreams of opening a small store in which she can offer her products.  She believes that next year she will be able to carry out this project.

loans.use: To buy aftershave, perfume, cosmetics, sports clothes and ladies' accessories

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Yamadibougou, sous-préfecture de Konobougou; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce des articles de boutique, ustensiles en plastique et du savon.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.
AWA M. s’approvisionne en articles de boutique presque hebdomadairement au marché de Konobougou. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place dans le village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekafo group are all married, 35 years old with three children each; they all live in large extended families in the village of Yamadibougou, the district of Konobougou, in the Ségou region (the fourth largest region of the Republic of Mali). 
They met through family links and sell plastic utensils and soap for a living.  
The women are on their ninth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 
Awa M. sources her goods almost weekly from the Konobougou market. She sells her wares in the village for cash and credit sales to a customer base made up of men and women. 
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to pay for healthcare, food and school expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Purchasing various items for her shop

loans.name: Shukhratjon

texts.ru: Мамадиев Шухратжон проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Уже два года как занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота. На полученную прибыль он хочет устроить свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Shukhratjon M. lives in the Shahritus region. He is 36 years old, married and has three children. He completed secondary education. 

For two years, he has been engaged in raising livestock. He raises livestock for a period of time in order to sell them. The loan will be used to purchase young animals. 

He wants to use the the profits received to make a wedding for his son.

loans.use: To purchase young animals

loans.name: Jhonny Richard

texts.es:
Jhony trabaja en una empresa privada como guarda de seguridad, casado, con dos hermosos hijos.
El objetivo de sus financiamientos en Afodenic, ha sido para mejorar su vivienda el cual espera lograr una vivienda segura para su familia. Ya que aun es parte de zinc y que solo por medio de préstamo espera lograrlo.
Con este nuevo préstamo seguirá con las mejora en las paredes de concreto de la casa. Lo que comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, para seguir avanzando la obra.
texts.en:
Jhonny works for a private business as a security guard.  He is married and has two beautiful children.  

His goal for his loans from Afodenic has been to improve his house because he hopes to have a safe home for his family.  Part of the house is still made of corrugated tin, and he will only be able to achieve his goal with these loans.

With this new loan, he would like to continue improving the concrete walls of the house.  He plans to purchase stones, sand, and cement to continue his work.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to continue improvements on his house

loans.name: Urania Del Carmen

texts.es:
Urania es una joven de 30 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida quien es albañil y le ayuda con los gastos del hogas, habitantes de colonia  La union en nueva Guinea, ella  labora como docente de educacion primaria desde hace 13 años, la profesora Urania se ha destacado por ser una docente dedicada a su trabajo el cual desempeña con dedicacion y esmero.
Espera ser beneficiada de nuevo con Kiva en su 3er credito que esta solicitando para invertirlo en construir una habitacion con mejores condiciones como todo  cuidadano lo desea.  
Su mayor sueño en la vida es culminar sus estudios universitarios y que su familia permanezca bien unida y con salud
texts.en:
Urania, 30, lives with her life partner who’s a Bricklayer and helps her with household expenses.  They live in Nueva Guinea’s La Unión neighborhood.   She has worked as an Elementary School Teacher for 13 years.  Teacher Urania has stood out for being a teacher who is devoted to her work which she does with dedication and commitment.

She hopes to be benefitted with another Kiva loan, her third, which she’s asking for to build a room with better conditions as every citizen wishes.

Her greatest dream is to complete her university studies and that her family stays together and healthy.

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El Sr. Alejandro de  44 años,  de estado civil viudo, con 2 hijas  que se encuentran estudiando, tiene ya varios años dedicándose a la construcción como maestro albañil. El Sr.  Alejandro ha estado trabajando con algunas herramientas propias y las demás alquiladas. Por este motivo se  vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la demanda que se le  presenta. El  no posee ninguna deuda con ninguna institución, es cliente nuevo de Emprender,  cuenta con domicilio conocido ubicado al  Sur de nuestra ciudad, razón por la cual no se le negó dicho crédito, con el dinero del crédito comprara una mezcladora, compra de cortadora de azulejos,  incremento de herramientas de trabajo, es una persona trabajadora que esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 44, is a widower with two daughters who are in school.  He’s been working for several years in construction as a Master Bricklayer.  He has been working with some tools of his own and some leased ones.  Because of this, he found himself in the need of asking our institution for a loan due to the demand he’s facing.  He does not have any debts with any other institution; he’s a new Emprender client.  He has a known place of residence in the south of our city so the loan was not denied him.

He will use the loan to buy a cement mixer, a tile cutter and to add to his work tools.  He is a hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy a cement mixer, a tile cutter and to add to his work tools.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is 48 years old and married with seven children. Fedelina works very hard to provide for her family. Fedelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a loan of PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell in her general store.

Fedelina has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, soft drinks and liquor. Fedelina also earns income with her rice retail business. In the future, Fedelisa would like to expand her business and help her husband with family needs.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell in her general store

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.en:
Alba Elizabeth is 30 years old and married. She works at a stall making tortillas by hand and has three years experience in the business. Her husband works as a bricklayer and helps support the two of them. Alba is requesting a loan as a part of the group ¨Prosperidad¨ (Prosperity). She would like to purchase more corn in order to make more flour for her tortilla stall. She would like to one day own her own equipment and open another stall in town. 

This is the ¨Prosperidad¨ group´s second loan through ASDIR. The first loan was paid back in full. The other members of the group are involved in the following business activities: fruit and vegetable sales, cosmetics sales, animal raising and food services.

loans.use: to purchase corn for her tortilla stand.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 45 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado dedicada a la agricultura y hoy es una de las fuentes de ingreso muy importantes para su familia, por esta razón es que todos trabajan de manera conjunta desde muy temprano para cuidar sus terrenos. Asimismo se dedica a la crianza de animales como vacas que tiene en su establo, actividad que le ayuda a mejorar su economía, ya que puede vender la leche que extrae y de ella elaborar quesos. Sus  hijos y su esposo siempre la apoyan en el trabajo, sabe que esta actividad requiere darle tiempo y esfuerzo, es muy sacrificado y más cuando la temperatura baja que en ocasiones perjudica sus cosechas. Pese a ello continuará esforzándose en su trabajo. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida de contar con este apoyo por lo que será muy beneficioso, además considera de mucha responsabilidad el pertenecer a un grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para mejorar su próxima producción.
texts.en:
Reyna is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her two children. She has worked in agriculture for her entire life, and today it is one of the most important sources of income for her family. For this reason, they all start working together very early in the morning in order to care for their land. Reyna also raises animals like cattle, which she keeps in a stable. This activity helps improve her economic situation because she can sell the milk and make cheeses from it. Her children and husband are always supportive of her work, as they know that it requires time and effort. It is work that requires sacrifice, especially when the temperatures drop and they sometimes lose crops. Despite this, Reyna will continue striving in her work.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is grateful to be able to count on this support, which will be very beneficial to her. She also thinks it is an important responsibility to belong to the communal bank. She will use the requested loan to invest in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer, in order to improve her next harvest.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Sinforosa

texts.es:
Sinforosa T. O., es soltera, tiene 28 años de edad, curso el tercer años de estudio de primaria, se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un tienda donde vende artículo de consumo diario, lleva 7 años con este negocio, inicio en su local con un molino de mixtamal pero ahora cuenta con una tienda.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para invertir en su negocio para comprar mas mercadería: cajas de jugos, cajas de huevos, pastas, gaseosa, golosinas, etc. Quiere ver su negocio mas grande y mas rentable.
texts.en:
Sinforosa T. O. is 28 years old, single, and has a third grade education. She is a merchant and has a store where she sells everyday consumer products. Sinforosa has been in this business for seven years. Her business started out as a grain mill that process hominy, but now it has been converted into a store.

She is requesting a loan to invest in more merchandise for her business such as juice boxes, cartons of eggs, pasta, sodas, candy, and other items. Sinforosa wants to see her business expand and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 28 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro, para sobresalir en la vida. El negocio de Ana es la fabricación de adornos, como perlitas de fantasía, lentejuelas, brazaletes, collares, etc. Ella vende sus adornos a muchas personas, a los cuales les da un muy buen precio por su trabajo, gusta de vender sus adornos y más aun si acaba toda su mercadería, lo cual pasa con frecuencia. Actualmente vive con sus 3 hermanos, pero la casa que tiene es de adobe y madera, por lo que le hace sentir insegura por su seguridad y la de los suyos. Es por eso que quiere mejorar sus instalaciones con material noble, con el único fin de brindarles una vivienda más cómoda a sus hermanos. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es trasladar sus adornos hasta los lugares donde los tiene que vender, ya que le es muy cansado y el transporte le sale muy caro. Tiene 2 años en este negocio y espera incrementar la cantidad de adornitos que fabrica, porque es conciente que solo así podrá incrementar su economía. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagarlo por completo, para acceder a uno nuevo en el futuro. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Ana is 28 years old and is a simple happy woman.  She lives in a home of her own and is very willing to work hard to get ahead in life.  She makes jewelry, like pearl necklaces, sequin, bracelets, necklaces, etc.   She sells her jewelry to many people, who give her a good price for her work.  She enjoys selling, especially when she sells out, which happens often.

At the moment she lives with three brothers, but her house is wood and adobe, which makes her feel insecure.  For this reason she would like to make improvements so that she can provide a more comfortable place to live for her brothers.

The most challenging part about her work is transporting her jewelry to the points of sale because it’s tiring and transportation is very expensive.  She’s been doing this for two years and homes to increase the amount of jewelry she makes, because she knows that this is the only way that she can improve her finances.

This will be her first loan through MFP and she is prepared to repay the loan.  She will use the 1,500 PEN to buy building materials to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc, tiene 50 años, es madre soltera con un hijo de 25 años. Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de plásticos y prendas de vestir. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra mercaderías para surtir. Está en FINCA Perú hace 6 años ingresó por la invitación de su hermana, le gusta FINCA porque le ayudo en el momento mas importante, pudo educar a su hijo le pago todos los gastos de la escuela policial. Su sueño es que su negocio siga prosperando y construir su casa.
texts.en: Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank "Imasumacc."  She is 50 years old, and a single mother with a 25-year-old son. Elizabeth sells plastics and clothing. The loan she is requesting is to buy goods to stock her inventory.  She joined FINCA Peru 6 years ago at the invitation of her sister. She likes FINCA because they helped her at a very important time in her life.  She was able to educate her son and pay all expenses of the police school.  Her dream is that her business continues to thrive and that she can build a home.

loans.use: to purchase various articles of clothing

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel es un joven que vive en la municipio de Colcapirhua de la provincia de Cochabamba,  él vive aun con sus padres, el curso sus estudios  hasta el nivel de bachillerato y no pudo estudiar una carrera ya que el tenía que empezar a trabajar para poder mantenerse, ya que  sus padres tienen muchos compromisos y necesidades, él tiene 2 hermanitas que dependen de sus papas él trabaja como carpintero en la carpintería de su tío, está empezando a  hacer un curso a nivel técnico en mecánica automotriz para poder abrir su propio negocio,  como el no gana mucho y tiene que pagar sus mensualidades en el instituto, los pasajes le son un gasto muy elevado así que el necesita el crédito para poder comprar  una motocicleta para economizar y también poder llegar a tiempo a sus clases después de su trabajo.
texts.en: Abel is a young man who lives in the town of Colcapirhua in the province of Cochabamba. He still lives with his parents. He went to high school and was unable to continue studying since he had to begin working to support himself. His parents have a lot of commitments and needs. He has 2 little sisters who depend on his parents. He works as a carpenter in his uncle's carpentry shop. He is starting a technical course in auto mechanics to be able to open his own business. He doesn't make very much and he has to pay for his tuition. Bus fare is very expensive so he needs the loan to be able to buy a motorcycle to save money and also to get to his classes on time after work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
 
Rosanna has a retail shop that sells breads, snacks, biscuits and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy snacks, beverages and breads. Rosanna is a new member of HSPFI. 

In the future, Rosanna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages and breads

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.ru: Рухшона проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Рухшона имеет среднее образование. Она более 6 лет занимается животноводством. В основном она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Rukhshona lives in J.Rumy. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children. Rukhshona has a secondary education. She has been working in animal husbandry for more than six years.  Basically she breeds cattle for sale. She is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Asunción”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.  Tiene educación primaria incompleta.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de maná (cereal dulce) y fideos, trabaja con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 31 ciclos, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio anterior negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio y comprará azúcar, gas, maíz y veinte bolsas de fideos.  Nos cuenta que sus productos los vende en la ciudad de Cusco  al por mayor.  Trabaja junto con su esposo en el negocio.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando con éste negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son los meses de gracia y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Community Bank "Virgen de la Asunción", which is located in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the Department of Puno.  She is 35 years old and married with four children.  She has an incomplete primary education.

Sabina currently sells maná (sweet cereal) and noodles.  She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 31 lending cycles.  Her first loan was for 300 New Soles, the money from which she used in her previous business selling groceries.

With this new loan of 500 New Soles, she will increase the capital of her business and buy sugar, gas, corn and twenty bags of noodles.  She tells us that her products are sold at wholesale in the city of Cusco. She works together with her husband in the business.

Her dream is to continue working with this business and for her children to become professionals.

What she likes about the Community Bank are the grace periods and making savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar, gas, corn and twenty bags of noodles.

loans.name: Support Kisiita Group

texts.en:
James is 48 years old, married, with five children ages 8 years old to 2 months. He has no any other dependents and he lives in his own permanent house in Hoima, Uganda.

For 5 years, James has been a farmer and also slaughters goats to sell. From this business he has been able to educate his children despite the challenge of high costs in transporting his animals. His dream is to buy a truck to transport them. James wants a loan to buy goats to sell.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Dennelle Mheygan

texts.en:
Dennelle Mheygan is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Dennelle Mheygan has a retail shop that sells cashew apples and pineapples. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Phillipines peso (PHP) to buy cashew apples to sell.

Dennelle Mheygan is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Dennelle Mheygan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cashew apples to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 53 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, es casada. Ella y su esposo viven en su casa propia junto a su cuñada y sus cuatro hijos que ya son mayores e independientes.El trabajo de Carmen consiste en la venta de abarrotes en su casa. Durante nueve años ha realizado esta actividad, y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es independiente, tiene tiempo disponible para realizar otras actividades. Siempre tiene clientes, además como mantuvo un buen record de compras de una distribuidoras de gaseosas, le van a dar exhibidoras para sus productos, ella tiene grandes planes con su negocio, si bien por ahora el negocio esta bajo, ella cree que mas adelante podrá ampliar ya que uno de sus proyectos primordiales es el de agrandar su bodega y poner una fuente de soda.Este es el préstamo numero 17 entre Carmen y la institución, se siente bien en el grupo que esta y le agrada mucho poder trabajar con la institución MFP, y espera poder trabajando así ya que ella es socia fundadora de este banco comunal.Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles ella comprará más abarrotes y productos para su bodega, pues necesita invertir para poder percibir ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen, 53 years old, is a happy, hard-working, married woman. She and her husband live in her own house with her brother-in-law and their 4 children who are now adult and independent. Carmen's work consists of selling groceries from her house. For 9 years now she has done this, and can count on her husband's help.

What Carmen likes about her work is that it is independent; she has time available to do other activities.  She always has customers, and because she has a good sales record with a soft drink distributor, she is going to receive display cases for her products. Carmen has big plans for her business, although at the moment the store is small. She believes that further along, she will be able to expand. One of her most important projects is to enlarge her store and install a soda fountain.

This is Carmen's 17th loan with this institution. She feels good about her group and is very grateful to be able to work with MFP.  And Carmen, who is a founding member of her communal bank, wants to continue the relationship. 

With the 1,200 new sols requested she will buy more groceries and products for her general store, because she needs to invest to be able to receive earnings.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and products for her general store, because she needs to invest to be able to receive earnings.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor de 53 años de edad vive en Arjona, cerca a la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, tiene 6 hijos en las edades de 22 a 30 años y desde allí se dedica a la actividad comercial desde hace 2 años, cuando inició su negocio de producir calzado, con una antigua máquina sencilla que le regalaron, con la cual fabricó sandalias; cuando esta máquina se le dañó la mandó a reparar  y el técnico se quedó con ella sin explicación alguna y nunca la devolvió. Aun así Flor insistió en buscar ingresos para su hogar y con mucho esfuerzo, compró a crédito una maquina industrial y con ella incentivó su producción, produce muy buen calzado y está entusiasmada en el crecimiento de su negocio, su meta es lograr fabricar bolsos de gran tamaño y ubicar sus productos en un local comercial, con lo cual mejoraría sus ingresos por la concentración de su mercado y el posicionamiento que tendría. Su mayor desafío es lograr capital de trabajo para invertir y aumentar su producción y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará: materiales para fabricar calzado, como cueros suelas, goma forros, miñones, accesorios hormas y una vitrina para ordenar su producción. Mientras trabaja para conseguir alcanzar sus metas, produce una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 42,4%, desde la cual auguramos su éxito en la inversión.
texts.en:
Flor, 53, lives in Arjona near the city of Cartagena de Indias.  She has six children ranging in age from 22 to 33 years.  She’s been engaged in commerce there for the last two years when she started her shoe making business making sandals on an antique, simple sewing machine someone gave her.  When this machine broke down and she sent it to be repaired the technician, with no explanation whatsoever, kept it and never returned it to her.  Even so, Flor insisted in finding ways to earn household income and with much effort she bought an industrial sewing machine and used it to accomplish her production.  She makes very good footwear and she’s excited about the growth of her business.  Her goal is to manufacture large purses and to position her products in a commercial locale which will improve her income by concentrating her market and because of the positioning she’ll have.  

Her greatest challenge is attaining sufficient working capital to invest and increase production and this is why she’s calling upon a Kiva loan, first financing she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy shoe making supplies like: leather, soles, glue, lining, straps, accessories, shoe trees and a display case to arrange her products.  While she works toward reaching these goals, she produces a profit margin over sales of no less than 42.4% from which we can predict success in the investment.

loans.use: to buy shoe making supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children.
 
Susan has a shop that sells beverages, canned goods, snacks and bananas. She has had this business for 3 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and bananas for sale.

Susan has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Michi

texts.en:
Michi is 38 years old. He is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Michi provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged to his business for more than two years and earns approximately 300 PHP daily.

Michi joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase equipment to improve his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve his business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a live fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for a year.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more feed for her fish. Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more feed for her fish.

loans.name: Ana Argelia
