texts.es: Doña  Ana , una mujer trabajadora de  28  años de edad, vive en un Barrio marginal de San Pedro Sula junto a su pareja y su hija de 4 años y medio y se ayudan mutuamente,  el   trabaja de jornalero en una empresa de baterías y con sus ahorros le apoyo  para que iniciara un negocio, al ver  la oportunidad de que enfrente de su casa hay un plantel donde sacan grava y los empleados no encuentran donde comer, es allí donde ella inicia ofreciéndoles  desayunos y almuerzos,  ahora con ODEF  a solicitado un préstamo para ampliar sus servicios y vender también refrescos, churros, dulces etc. Además invertir en arroz, papas, carne todos los insumos para la venta de comida  y de esta manera hacer rendir mas el negocio, surtir de otros productos para su clientela y que le generen mas ingresos para el sostenimiento económico del hogar.
texts.en:
Ana is a hard-working 28 year old woman.  She lives in a marginal neighborhood of San Pedro Sula with her life partner and her four and a half year old daughter.  They help each other.  He works as a day laborer for a battery company.  He supported her with his savings so that she could start a business. 

She saw the opportunity in front of her house.  There is an establishment there that works with gravel, and there is no place for the employees to eat.  That is where she started selling breakfasts and lunches.

Now she has requested a loan from ODEF to expand her services.  She will also sell soft drinks, churros, and sweets, etc.  Additionally she will buy rice, potatoes, meat, and all of the ingredients for selling food.  This way she will make her business more productive.  She will stock other products for her customers.  This will generate more income for the financial support of her household.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food and to expand her sweets sales.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 26-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and two children who are still attending school. Zeinab and her husband find it really hard to cover their expenses, especially with the heavy costs of life they are facing. Her husband has owned a cattle farm since 1995 and she has owned a small shop since 2009 where she sells artisan products, gifts and gadgets. Today, she’s asking for a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more merchandise to add to her shop. She states that these purchases will increase her sales and consequently her income.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to add to her shop.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria, 54, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Bienvinido, 55, a security guard, and is the mother of an only child. She enjoys being a mother and a businesswoman. She dreams of sending her child through college. 

Candelaria operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy products from wholesalers, selling them per piece for a little profit. Her products are food items. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantity and variety of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Candelaria dreams of being successful in her business and seeing her child finish her education. She never fails to attend the weekly fellowship* wherein she is inspired to share her weekly life experiences with her co-fellowship members and she learns more about the importance of having quality time with God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of food items

loans.name: Gloria Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GLORIA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. C'est la première  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Blanche est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Blanche est âgée de 28 ans et vit au Bénin. Blanche est mariée à un comptable du nom de Michel. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et  à leur charge. Blanche vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille,  Blanche vend depuis quatre ans de l’huile à moteur à une place publique du Bénin. Blanche s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu,  Blanche sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GLORIA, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group GLORIA is comprised of three persons who live in the same area. This is the first time the group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, named Blanche, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. 

Blanche is 28 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to an accountant named Michel. They have three children, all in school and in their care. Blanche lives with her husband and children. The couple jointly cover the family expenses. 

To help with the diverse expenses of the family, Blanche has been selling motor oil for four years at a public square in Benin. Her supplies come from a city in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Blanche and the other members of the group GLORIA are requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy containers of motor oil

loans.name: Maria Mariana

texts.es: Maria Mariana,es una señora conocida como una persona muy luchadora en el campo del negocio,ella tiene 41 años de edad se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos,y a la vez vende productos comestibles,ella nos cuenta que desde hace tiempos se dedico a este negocio ya que en la comunidad donde ella vive no hay mucha competencia,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos,ya que en esta epoca de fin de año es cuando se vende mas.
texts.en: Maria Mariana is known as a real go-getter when it comes to business. She is 41 years old and sells cosmetics, as well as some groceries. She has told us that she has been involved in this business for a long time as there is not much competition in the community where she lives. She is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics, as this is the time of the year when they sell the most.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Her husband is a merchant. 
Huong runs a general store that sells a variety of basic goods, many kinds of rice and beverages to people in the local community. She started this business in 2004. 

She has requested a loan to purchase rice, beverages, and a range of other products to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beverages, and a range of products to stock her general store.

loans.name: Fany Monica

texts.es:
La socia ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de trajes tipicos como faldas,blusas y panatlaones,ella alquila los trajes para diferentes danzas tipicas de la ciudad del Cusco,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante.El sueño de la socia es tener un local mas amplio para que pueda alquilar los trajes tipicos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar una lavadora para implementar su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is now selling traditional costumes, such as skirts, blouses, and pants.  She rents out the costumes for different traditional dances in the city of Cusco.  This business has allowed her to get ahead.  Her dream is to have a bigger store to rent out her traditional costumes.  She is asking for this loan to buy a washing machine to install in her home.

She is glad to have received this loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to install in her home

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old and married to Vendenle; they have children. He has been raising pigs for the last 21 years, supplying pork to major pork dealers. He also operates a retail shop.

He is requesting a second loan with KADET of 50,000 KES. He plans to use the loan to buy more pigs and add stocks of wheat flour to his retail shop. With the anticipated profits he will educate his children.

His hopes are to expand his pig business and become a commercial pig and pork distributor.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and add stocks of wheat flour to his retail shop.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
La señora  Fidelina   vive en una localidad pequeña  en donde siempre hay  una temperatura calorosa, ella en viudo hace tres meses en la que ya no tiene hijos a su responsabilidad.
 
    Ella solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  mercancía para surtir su  negocio  de abarrotes,  en donde lleva trabajando  dos años seis meses en la que comenta que le va bien.

    Ella inicio esta actividad ya que también quiere  apoyar   con los ingresos de la casa y mejorar cada día  sus ingresos para su hogar.
 
     Lo que ella desea es que con esta actividad pueda seguir adelante   a hora que ya está sola  solo con el apoyo de sus   hijos.
texts.en:
Fidelina lives in a small town where the temperature is always hot. She became a widow three months ago. She no longer has any children in her charge.

She requested the loan to buy merchandise to stock her small grocery store. She has been working in this business for 2.5 years and she says it is going well.

She started this business because she wanted to help with the household income and improve the family income.

Her wish is that with this business she will be able to continue working now that she is alone, though with the support of her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her small grocery store

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Alpha S.  He is married, and has 4 children aged 12, 9, 6 and 3 years, all are school going children. He has 1 additional dependent, who live with him to help take care of his children.  In 1994, Alpha S. established his vehicle tyres with different sizes business. He began his business because he was forced to drop out of school in class 6 because of poverty. He became a truck apprentice learning maintenance and driving. He learnt tire patching also and was later employed in a company doing this. He worked for some years and the salary he accumulated was used to start his own tire business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 950,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,600,000. Alpha S. has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy different sizes of vehicle tyres.  During the last loan, he was expecting to buy a vehicle, machines and build a house which he did not accomplished but with the small profit he raised was able to buy a plot of land and start his building project.  In the future, Alpha S. plans to complete his building project and provide quality education for his children. Increase in prices of commodities and transportation cost are his challenges.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different sized used tires for his tire store.

loans.name: Tureto

texts.en: Tureto is a member of Inkiramat women group which is located in Empuyiankat, Kajiado District. She is 53 years old and a mother of four. She is an inquisitive person, eager to learn and tries out new ideas as she gets them. Tureto’s main challenge is raising school fees for her three children who are in secondary school. She sells steers and has been in this business for the last twenty years. Out of her hard work, she has built seven semi-permanent rental rooms in Olturoto town. She gets USD 50 per month from the 7 rooms and this helps her to pay school fees and other household needs. Tureto would like to add 6 more rooms because the trading centre is growing so is the rent. The additional rooms will almost double her income and this will mark the beginning of the end of her financial problems.

loans.use: Tureto wants to build two rental rooms in Olturoto trading centre.

loans.name: Alofisa

texts.en: Alofisa is a 45-year old lady from the village of Nuusuatia. She joined a solidarity group through SPBD four years ago and started a donut business. Every Sunday she would bake donuts which augmented her family income. After successfully paying off her first loan, she ventured into growing vegetables. Her second loan from SPBD enabled her to start a vegetable patch near her house. She was able to deliver vegetables twice a week and earn an additional US $100 per week. Her proposed loan will further enlarge her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers, pesticides, and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Asomaliu

texts.en:
Mrs S. is married with 3 children. She and her husband are unemployed. They decided to grow a vegetable garden which she is making into a business to help out with family needs, especially their children's.

She was facing a lot of problems such as too many weeds and lack of chemicals to kill insects that damaged the vegetables due to financial constraints. She needed financial assistance to improve her vegetable garden's condition in order to maintain her customer orders and therefore joined the SPBD program which she found out about through other village members.

She would like to apply for another loan through SPBD so that she can pay her children's school fees and if there is enough, she would like to make repairs to the back of their house.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for her home improvement and pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn R. is 39 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and their 3 children.  They work as farmers and grocers, earning a combined income of $6/day.  Two of their children are students and the third works on the family farm with his father.  Morn R. will use this loan to purchase more groceR. items for her store in order to meet the increased demand from her clients.  In the future, Morn R. would like to make her shop bigger by buying a variety of new products.  She also hopes to be successful enough to send her children to university and to repair their home for the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her inventory in order to meet clients' needs.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen has 4 children, 3 of whom are now pretty much grown up ladies, but she still has to care for her 17-year-old son (the one in the picture). He is blind and has a drain for the fluids that accumulate around a tumor in his brain (apparently the cause for his blindness). They have long since given up on any possibilities to improve this young man's unfortunate condition. However, Carmen realizes she can't give up in searching for ways to maintain herself and this sick child.

For over 18 years now, Carmen has been sellling bedding to earn a livelihood. She now plans to have a better future by using the requested loan to buy more products for resale. She says bedding can be sold at a good profit, there being an ample market for it.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets and spreads

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
ELVIRA is 52 years old. She has six children and her husband works by farming the land. So as to help out with the family expenses, Elvira opened a convenience store out of their house where she sells essential food items that are used by the people of her community. These items include rice, sugar, salt, drinks, cooking oil, etc. She belongs to a solidarity group called Bajucu 3 together with Ms. Tomasa Vázquez Méndez (handicraft artist) and Ms. Julia Hernández Méndez (handicraft artist). With their loans, they will invest in the purchase of more cloth and thread in order to increase the production of their handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

ELVIRA tiene 52 años, seis hijos, su esposo trabaja labrando la tierra. Ella para contribuir al gasto familiar tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, en donde vende lo más indispensable que consume la gente de su localidad (arroz, azúcar, sal, bebidas, aceite, etc.). Pertenece al grupo solidario llamado Bajucu 3 junto con doña Tomasa Vázquez Méndez (artesana) y doña Julia Hernández Méndez (artesana). Con sus prestamos invertirán en la compra de tela e hilos al por mayor y así aumentar la producción de sus artesanías.

loans.use: Convenience Store

loans.name: Dodzi Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Dodzi Kokou A. is 29 years old and still single. After completing a training in cooking and baked goods, he opened his own restaurant and cafeteria. A master of his work he has a good number of customers but his restaurant is becoming too small and he is running the risk of loosing his customers. Feeling worried about this problem, he is requesting a loan of $500 to rent a bigger space and fit it out. This will allow him to develop customer loyalty and increase the number of his customers. This will increase his income in order to be fully responsible for himself.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 29 ans, Monsieur Dodzi Kokou A. reste toujours célibataire. Après une formation en cuisine et pâtisserie, il a ouvert son propre restaurant cafétéria. Maîtrisant bien son métier, il a bon nombre de clientèle mais son restaurant devient de plus en plus restreint et il risque de perdre sa clientèle. Très soucieux de ce problème, il sollicite un crédit de $500 pour louer un local plus spacieux et bien l’aménager. Ceci lui permettra de fidéliser sa clientèle et d’en avoir d’autres. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus en vue de bien se prendre en charge.

loans.use: Opening of a restaurant and cafeteria

loans.name: Zahir

texts.en: Zahir has been in the cattle-breeding business for five years. He was born in 1975. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Armenian-occupied Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and is settled in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has two children. Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy a calf.

loans.use: To buy one calf

loans.name: Pastora's Group

texts.en:
Susana, Pastora, and Angelica are members of the community bank “Dignidad”. Susana has been a member for two years, while Pastora and Angelica have been part of the bank for 10 and 13 years respectively. In that time they have learned about responsibility, punctuality, and women’s health.

Susana is 42 years old. She has five children between the ages of two and twenty-five. Susana has been selling fruit in the Nery Garcia market of Ayacucho for several years.

Pastora is 37 years old, and has two children. She has a carpentry business, which she was able to start ten years ago with her first loan from the community bank. With this loan she is planning to expand into furniture making.

Angelica is 38 years old. She has three children aged 15, 11, and 9. Angelica raises pigs, to sell as pork. Previously she owned a small grocery store, but with this business she had to travel to different towns to buy products. When she had children she decided to buy pigs so that she could raise both at the same time. Now that her children are older, she is planning on opening a restaurant where she would sell her pork.

Susana, Pastora, and Angelica need loans of 400, 1200, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying, bananas, papayas, oranges, wood, paints, pig feed, and necessary restaurant items. Susana, Pastora, and Angelica have simple dreams. They hope that they can pay for their children’s education and help them to have a better life.

loans.use: Susana, Pastora, and Angelica need loans of 400, 1200, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying, bananas, papayas, oranges, wood, paints, pig feed, and necessary restaurant items.

loans.name: Magda Violeta

texts.es:
Magda Violeta Iba I. Ríos is 44 years old. She studied through the fifth grade of primary school. She has three dependent children. She lives in Agallpampa district, Otuzco province, La Libertad department, Peru.

Her business consists of buying cattle, guinea pigs, and chickens, which she slaughters to sell the meat to different restaurants in the city of Trujillo. She is happy with her business because she has helped to cover the basic necessities of her family, which previously had fewer financial resources since she was only working as a farmer and raising a few livestock animals, almost all for domestic consumption.

She is a member of the “Jesús Nazareno” community bank, which is where she obtained her first loan of S./ 300.00. With that money she bought three sheep. With this loan of S/. 500.00, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy 5 sheep. Magda’s dream is that her children will be educated and have good professions.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Magda Violeta I. Ríos tiene 44 años de edad, estudió hasta el quinto grado de primaria. Tiene tres hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Agallpampa en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad - Perú Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de animales como huachos, reses, cuyes y gallinas, los cuales sacrifica para ofrecer y vender la carne por diferentes restaurantes de la ciudad de Trujillo. Se siente satisfecha con su negocio porque le ha ayudado a cubrir las necesidades de su familia la cual anteriormente tenía muchas más carencias ya que solo se dedicaba a la chacra y al acrianza de pocos animales sobre todo para el consumo. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Jesús Nazareno” en el que obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró tres carneros. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 5 carneros La señora Magda sueña con ver a sus hijos realizados.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy 5 sheep

loans.name: Abdusammad.

texts.ru:
Abdusammad N. is a resident of the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 53 years old, is a widower and has 4 children. He has a high school education. Because he lives alone, he carries all of the household responsibilities on his shoulders. He needs to work a lot in order to support his family. Abdusammad sells fruits and vegetables and has been in this business for 6 years. He earns a small income because he has a small amount of working capital. He is applying for a loan to increase his working capital and his income. This will allow him to increase his income, which is so necessary for his family. Abdusammad will pay back his loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Норбоев Абдусамад житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 53 года , вдовец и имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Так как он живет один , все хозяйство лежит на его плечах . Клиенту приходится много работать ,чтобы прокормить семью.Клиет занимается торговлей фруктов и овощей. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 6 лет.Получает небольшой доход , потому что у него маленькая оборотная сумма. Для того чтобы увеличить доход он хочет получить кредит , тем самым увеличив оборотную сумму.Это принесет ему доход . который так необходим его семье. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace buys large quantities of charcoal and sells the charcoal in bulk to people living in the bigger towns and cities. Charcoal still remains the topmost source of fire for cooking in Ghana. The price of gas has gone up and therefore the demand for charcoal is overwhelming. Grace wants to buy more bags of charcoal to enable her serve her loyal customers. She is fifty-one years old and has three children.

Grace is a member of the group called “Eye Nyame” (meaning it is God). Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Grace's photo was taken at a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Huseyn.

texts.ru:
Huseyn K. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 44 years old, is married and has 5 children. He has a secondary-technical education and is a driver by profession. In his free time Huseyn raises livestock and has 5 years of experience in this area. He purchases young calves from locals, fattens them and resells them at the market at a higher price. This business allows him to support his family. At this point, Huseyn would like to purchase a new calf, fatten it and then resell it. This is why he needs money. He has decided to take out a loan for a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Кодиров Хусейн Назирович житель района Рудаки . Возраст 44 года , женат , имеет 5 детей . Образование среднее- техническое. По специальности водитель. Хусейн в свободное от работы время занимается животноводством.Имеет овыт более 5 лет. Он скупает у местного населения молотых бычков , откармливает их и продает на рынке по более выгодной ему цене. Эта деятельность позволяет ему содержать свою семью. В данный момент Хусейн хочет купить очередного бычка ,откормить и продать .Для чего ему и нужны деньги. Клиент решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata Kanouté is a married woman who lives in Thies’s Randoulène neighborhood. She has 28 years' experience in her main business of selling seasonal fruit. With this loan she would like to increase her revenue by buying large quantities of mangoes to retail at the local market.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

aminata kanouté est une femme mariée qui habite au quartier randoulène de THIES.elle bénéficie d'une expérience de 28 ans dans son activité principale de vente de fruits de saison.avec ce pret elle veut améliorer son chiffre d'affaire en achetant des mangues en quantité pour les revendre au détail sur le marché local.

loans.use: To buy and sell seasonal fruit

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr:
Aïssatou D. is married and the mother of 4 children. With this first loan, she wishes to help with the daily expenses, so as to improve the living conditions and the health status of her family. Her business consists in going to the market to buy palm oil, lemon juice, and salt, that she then resells door-to-door in several neighborhoods. She intends to repay the loan after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Aïssatou D. est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce premier prêt participer quotidiennement aux dépenses familiale afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Elle va ainsi acheter au marché lde l'huile de palme, du jus de citron et du sel afin de le revendre de porte à porte dans plusieurs quartiers. Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, lemon juice and salt for door-to-door resale

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 23 years old. She is married with one child aged 1 year old. She has been a clothes seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 80 from her sales.

Halima now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Thuwaiba's Allah Karim Group

texts.en:
Thuwaiba, 28 and the married mother of two children aged four and one, has run her own retail shop since 2004. She works daily from 8:30 a.m. to 11 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Thuwaiba now hopes for a loan to buy more commodities for the improvement of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mashavu, who also has a business dealing with food sales.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for the improvement of her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Khat Sophet Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khat S., 42, is a group leader of four who all live in Krang Prosvay Village in the Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at the better price. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice for her business. Her husband, Mr. Tith Sophy, is a farmer. The couple has four children; one is employed in a garment factory; two are attending the local school; one is too young to work or study.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

Mrs. Men R.'s husband represents her in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in inventory to resell later at better price.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señorita María del Carmen tiene 23 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Buen Pastor y vive en la calle Titu Cusi Yupanqui 1166, distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
María del Carmen es Bachiller en Contabilidad, trabaja como cajera en Totus y como es una mujer emprendedora, también tiene su propio negocio que consiste en comprar zapatos, especialmente medias de niña y los vende en una tienda de sus padres que se localiza en El Mercado Modelo de Piura.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará medias y también incrementará el negocio con carteritas.
María del Carmen sueña con tener su negocio independiente.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen is 23 years old, she belongs to the group “Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Buen Pastor,” and she lives on 1166 Titu Cusi Yupanqui Street, in the district El Porvenir, a province of Trujillo, in the state of La Libertad, Peru. Maria del Carmen has a high school degree in accounting. She works as a cashier in Totus. Since she is an enterprising woman, she also has her own business in which she buys shoes, especially girl's stockings, and sells them in her parent’s store that is located in El Mercado Modelo of Piura. With the credit of 300 soles ($100) that will be paid in four installments, she will buy stockings and also, will increase business by purchasing purses. Maria del Carmen dreams to own a business independently.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy stockings and purses

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo lives in a typical village in San Isidro in the province of Quirino, Isabela. He is married to Ronalyn, who is a housewife who takes good care of their two children, the eldest three years old and the youngest one year old.

For five years, Alfredo is engaged in the farming business as the major source of income that supports the daily needs of his family.

Alfredo would like to improve his farming techniques in order to generate a higher income for the next harvest season. In line with this, he is requesting a loan of PHP15,000.00 (USD$325) that he will use as additional capital for his farming needs.

Alfredo believes that entrusting everything to God is the best solution to every problem. Thus he prays for the success of his farming business for the benefit of his family.

loans.use: Additional working capital for his farm.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo Hugo de 28 años, quien es carpintero y con su hija Jennifer de 2 años de edad. Ella es una joven y dedicada madre que para hacer que su familia salga adelante abrió una carpintería, donde trabaja su esposo fabricando muebles para que luego ella los venda, aunque también ayuda en el trabajo de elaborar los muebles. Lo que le gusta a Marleny de su trabajo es que puede realizarlo al lado de su esposo y así ser una sola fuerza en común para sacar adelante a su pequeña Jennifer. Marleny quiere que su pequeña hija tenga buenas armas, como una buena educación, para afrontar el futuro, es por eso que necesita mejor estabilidad económica para ofrecerle a ella lo mejor. Este es sétimo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de madera para elaborar más muebles, así aumentar la producción y por ende, sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marleny is 25 years old. She lives with her husband Hugo, who is 28 years old and is a carpenter, and with her daughter Jennifer, who is 2 years old. She is a young and dedicated mother who, since she wanted her family to improve their lives, has opened a carpentry shop. She works there with her husband making furniture that she later sells, and she also helps in the work of making the furniture. What Marleny likes about this work is that she is able to be at the side of her husband and so be a single, common force improving the life of little Jennifer. Marleny wants her small daughter to be well armed for the future with a good education. This is why they need better economic stability to offer Jennifer the best. This is her seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been very punctual with her repayments. With the money she is asking for, she would by a better quantity of wood in order to make more furniture, and so augment production and through this, her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Gregoria Rosa

texts.es: Doña Gregoria Menchú cuenta con 22 años de edad, es casada de oficios, Artesana “Elaboración de calzado para caballeros” tiene  un pequeño taller de  Talabartería habita junto a su esposo y su hijo; cuenta con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 4 años de realizar dicha actividad en su residencia que se encuentra ubicada en el Paraje Xecaxonabaj, Cantón Pasajoc, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela ha crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su hijo para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Gregoria Menchu is 22 years old, married, and works in the art of "making shoes for men". She has a small workshop in Talabarteria and lives with her husband and son. She has two employees that work with her. She brings 4 years of experience doing this activity out of her house, which is located in the Paraje Xecaxonabaj, Canton Pasajoc, Totonicapan district, Guatemala. Recently, the customer demand has increased, but she has found the economic conditions not sufficient to increase her production. For this reason, she came to ASDIR to request a loan with the intention to buy basic materials. Then she can increase her sales and she hopes that she can move forward with her son in order to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic materials for shoe making

loans.name: Jain

texts.en:
Jain S. is currently in the business of selling beans at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Jain is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a secondary school teacher. She has three children, and her children go to school.  

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her bean business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa de sus suegros. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace un año. Emprendió este negocio gracias a la motivación de unas amigas, y en la actualidad le está yendo muy bien. Gladys reparte su mercadería de casa en casa, la deja al crédito, luego cobra paulatinamente hasta que terminen de pagar. Con las ganancias que obtiene puede seguir apoyando en la economía de su hogar, además vende en los tiempos libres que dispone, cuando sus hijos están estudiando, y sin descuidar su cuidado. El trabajo que realiza Gladys es de todos los días, excepto fines de semana, y su gran anhelo es tener su propio puesto de venta para tener en exhibición los diferentes modelos de zapatos que vende. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por su parte se compromete a ser una integrante puntual en sus pagos y que aporte en el desarrollo de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para comprar zapatos escolares de diversas tallas, para que en esta campaña pueda tener mayores ganancias, calcula que con este montó podrá adquirir aproximadamente 3 docenas.
texts.en:
Gladys is 29 years old, and lives with her husband and 3 children in her inlaws' house. She has sold shoes for a year now. She started this businesses thanks to the motivation of some friends, and now she is doing very well. Gladys distributes her merchandise house by house. Her clients pay on credit, receiving the merchandise and then gradually paying her back until the amount has been covered. With the earnings that she obtains, she can continue supporting her home economically. It also allows for her to work during free time when her children are studying, so she doesn't have to neglect them. Gladys works every day, except on weekends. Her greatest yearning is to have her own kiosk so that she may have the different shoe models she offers on display. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to being punctual with her payments and to supporting the development of her communal bank. The money that she is asking for is to be used for school shoes of various sizes, so that in this direction she may maximize earnings. She calculates that with this amount she will be able to acquire approximately 3 dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Ion

texts.en: Ion, a farmer in Gordinesti Village, Edinet District, has worked in agriculture since childhood, having learned the profession from his father, who was also a farmer. Ion has two children, both students who want to attain higher educations. To achieve this goal, Ion is ready to do anything, and has thus decided to start up a business in agriculture that will enable him to sell vegetables and fruit year around. For this he needs to build two greenhouses at home and is thus requesting a loan to launch the business.

loans.use: To purchase wood and film for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es:
Este banco se encuentra compuesto por 11 integrantes, el banco D. emprendimiento se encuentra en quinto ciclo. Cuenta con una mesa directiva el mismo que se encuentra D. la siguiente manera.
VICTORIA B. C..- es la presidenta del banco, la cual fue elegida toda la asociación, tiene 21 años D. edad, vive en el barrio Virgen D. Fátima, vive en alquiler, con su esposo el Sr. Henrry Balcázar y sus dos hijos los cuales aun se encuentran en la escuela. La sra. Victoria cuanta con dos actividades, una trabaja D. coopera en el restaurante Sagardi,  y la segunda actividad es la venta D. cosméticos siendo `promotora D. la línea D. yanbal. Su objetivo es colocar un negocio fijo es decir colocar su propia pensión.
GLADYZ M. LIMACHI D. T..- es la tesorera del banco D. emprendimiento, es nacida en la Paz Murillo, pero actualmente aquí en Santa Cruz desD. hace 8 años. Vive en alquiler en el barrio Bibosi D. la Guardia con su esposo el Sr. Rolando y sus tres hijos. El negocio que tiene es la venta D. comida el cual lo realiza en su mismo domicilio. Su esposo el sr. Rolando T. trabaja como albañil. Su sueño es llegar a comprarse su propia casita.
LUIS FERNANDO IRIGYEN Q..-  es el secretario D. la asociación, es un joven con muchas ganas D. trabajar, tiene 19 años D. edad, es nacido en la Provincia Andrés Ibáñez vive en casa familiar.
El se dedica a la actividad D. promotor D. venta D. cereales, quiere seguir trabajando para D. esa manera terminar  la carrera que esta estudiando ya que por falta D. recursos sus padres no lo pueden ayudar económicamente.
texts.en:
This community bank consists of 11 members and it is on its fifth loan cycle. The directive board is as follows: Victoria B. C. is the president of the bank, elected unanimously by the group. She is 21 years old and lives in the Virgen D. Fátima neighborhood in a rented home with her husband Henry Balcázar and their two children, both of whom are still in school. Victoria works two jobs: one at the Sagardi restaurant and the other selling cosmetics, promoting the Yanbal line of products. Her goal is to invest in a fixed business. In other words to have her own salary. Gladyz M. Limachi D. T. is the treasurer of the bank. She was born in Paz Murillo but has lived in Santa Cruz for the past eight years. She lives in a rented home in the Bibosi D. la Guardia neighborhood with her husband Rolando and their three children. She has a business selling food, which she does from her home. Rolando works as a construction worker. Their dream is to buy their own home. Luis Frenando Irigyen Q. is the group's secretary. He is a young man of 19 with a strong desire to work. He was born in Andrés Ibáñez province and lives in his family's home. He makes a living selling cereals, and he wants to continue working until he completes his degree because his parents don't have the resources to support him economically.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda Remolan has a sari-sari store for generating her daily income. She is 56 and a widow living in Buenavista, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur. All of her children are already married. She has applied for a loan of 14,000 PHP. The money will be used as additional capital for her store. She hopes to replace her sari-sari store with a concrete one and she also plans to save for her retirement.

loans.use: To restock a sari-sari store

loans.name: Nueva Maranatha Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Nueva Maranatha”, esta formada por doce socias que trabajan en el centro focal Juan Pablo II ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto. Con la ayuda de su asesor de creditos realizan sus actividades de manera responsable y puntual.
Ellas tienen negocios individuales podemos mencionar algunas actividades, tienda de repuestos; tienda de abarrotes, taller radiotécnico, venta de muebles, elaboración y venta de refrescos, venta de papa, venta de carne de pollo, tiendas de barrio.
Afirman que las ventas bajaron y sus ganancias no son suficientes para mantener económicamente a sus familias, por lo que necesitan de mayor capital para reforzar sus negocios, adquiriendo mercadería, están seguros que generaran mejores ingresos para el bien de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Maranatha" association is made up of 12 members who work at the Juan Pablo II center located in the city of El Alto. With the help of their loan advisor they undertake their activities responsibly and punctually. Each woman has her own business, some of the activities are: parts store, general store, radio repair shop, furniture sales, preparation and sale of refreshments, potato sales, meat and chicken sales, neighborhood stores. They state that sales have declined and their profits are not sufficient to support their families, so they need more capital to strengthen their businesses by acquiring more merchandise. They are confident they will generate better income for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni M. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables and is requesting a loan to start up a vegetable garden near the river bank. Poni is 31 years old and is widowed. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: starup a vegetable garden on the river bank of the Nile

loans.name: Francisco Anselmo

texts.es: Don Francisco T. una persona muy conocida en su comunidad su principal fuente de ingreso de prestar los servicos de bus de la ciudad de Totonicapan a la Ciudad de Quetzaltengo dicha actividad lo viene realizando hace mas de diez años, principalmente el traslado de las persona jovenes Señoritas,  a los establecimientos publicos, privados como las universidad ya que en Totonicapan no se tiene esa posibilidad de superacion de estudios a no contar con varias carreras y la poblacion se ve obligado ha viajar a la ciudad de quetzaltenango.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco T. is very well-known in his community. His main source of income is offering bus transportation services from the city of Totonicapan to the city of Quetzaltengo. He has been doing this for over 10 years. His passengers are mainly young men and women that are headed to public and private places, such as the university. Since one cannot get a higher education in Totonicapan and not many degree courses are offered there, people often have to travel to the city of Quetzaltenango.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou D. mere de huits enfants  est vendeuse de charbon de bois a la cite asecna aouakam.elle evolue dans cette novelle activite et demnde un pret de tris cent mille(300 000)frs pour accroitre son stock afin de pouvoir gerer les aleas de l'hivernage.ses revenus lui permettent de prendre une tres bonne partie des depenses de son foyer en charge.
texts.en:
Fatou D., the mother of eight children, is a seller of charcoal in Cite Asecna Aouakam. She is advancing in this new business and is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs to increase her inventory in order to manage the vagaries of the off-season. Her revenues enable her to cover a very large part of the expenses in the household she supports.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Pablo David

texts.es:
Pablo es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo con su esposa y el último de sus hijos de 20 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando una carrera técnica.

Desde 1997 Pablo posee un pequeño taller en el lugar donde brinda servicios de reparación de  electrodomésticos y aunque su negocio esté lejos de la zona en donde se agrupan otros establecimientos que mantienen la misma actividad, el se las ingenia para seguir brindando este servicio a sus clientes habituales.

El está solicitando por primera vez un crédito de 500 nuevos soles el cual piensa utilizar en la compra de repuestos para la reparación de electrodomésticos, como transistores y circuitos integrados que le ayuden a desarrollar su trabajo de manera eficaz y así ampliar la cobertura de su negocio. Su trabajo es la única fuente de ingreso familiar y con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio el sigue manteniendo a su familia y brindando educación a su hijo.

Pablo tiene muy buenas referencias laborales y personales de sus clientes y vecinos, y lo que más anhela es poder solventar los gastos económicos de su hijo hasta que termine su carrera.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 57 year-old father who lives in the city of Chiclayo with his wife and his youngest child, who is 20 years old and who is studying a technical career. Since 1997, Pablo has had a workshop where he provides repair services for household appliances. Even though his business is far from the area where other such businesses are concentrated, he finds ways to keep providing this service to his regular clients. He is requesting his first loan of 500 PEN, which he plans to use for the purchase of parts for repairing electronics, such as transistors and integrated circuits, which will help him to be efficient in his work and expand his business. His work is the only source of family income; it is with much effort and sacrifice that he continues to provide for his family and educate his son. Pablo has very good work and personal references from his clients and neighbors. What he most hopes for is to be able to provide for his son until he has finished his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for repairing electronics

loans.name: Hadijah's Group

texts.en:
N. Hadijah is the leader of her lending group in Kayunga. She is a 47-year-old widow taking care of her 11 children plus four other dependents. She's had a business of selling food, mostly matooke (medium size green fruit like a plantain), at the Kayunga Central market for two years and is able to make weekly profits amounting to 30,000. She buys the matooke mostly from villages far and near and she ensures that she has quality produce in her stall for sale. 

She has a dream of starting up a poultry business whereby she will be selling the chicken herself from the market hence maximizing profits. At the moment, Hadijah needs a loan to be able to stock more matooke for enlarging her business. This will enable her to save enough for her children’s education and welfare.

loans.use: Buying more matooke for increased stock hence more sales and profitability

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer in order to cultivate more crops.

loans.name: Fatima Beatriz Blanca

texts.es:
La señora  Fátima Beatriz Blanca S. Z. es socia del Banco Comunal  Dapreydi  en el cantón Tosagua en la provincia de Manabí  desde hace un ciclo.

Fátima  es  madre soltera tiene una hija de 30 años que  vive en España desde hace seis años y a partir de entonces vive sola en Tosagua.  Ella  se dedica al comercio hace 20 años  y lo realiza  desde su  casa, vende  bebidas gaseosas, cervezas, algo de ropa para niños y productos de belleza Yambal que los adquiere a los mayoristas en Portoviejo a una hora de su lugar de residencia. 

Cuenta doña Fátima que sus clientes la visitan  en su casa por lo que  no se ha visto en la necesidad de salir a la calle a vender sus productos y no ha descuidado su negocio de bebidas gaseosas obteniendo bastantes clientes desde su domicilio.

Con el préstamo solicitado a  la Fundación Espoir  va a invertir en su negocio  comprando bebidas gaseosas surtidas, ropa y productos Yambal para su exigente clientela, y espera a corto plazo montar  un bazar, comprar vitrinas y ropa para damas caballeros y niños como  pantalones, blusas, y camisas, zapatos y artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Fátima Beatriz Blanca S. Z. is a member of the Dapreydi Communal Bank in Tosagua County in the Manabí Province. She has been a member for one cycle. Fátima is a single mother. Her 30 year old daughter has lived in Spain for six years. Since then Fátima has lived alone in Tosagua. For 20 years she has been selling soft drinks, beer, some children’s clothing, and Yambal beauty products from her house. She gets them from the wholesalers in Portoviejo, which is one hour from where she lives. Fátima says that her customers come to her house, so she does not see the need to leave and sell her products on the street. She has not neglected her business of selling soft drinks. She has plenty of customers from her home. With the loan she is asking Fundación Espoir for she will invest in her business and buy soft drinks to keep in stock, clothes, and Yambal products for her discerning customers. She plans to soon start a bazaar, buy display cases, and buy clothes for women, men, and children. She will buy pants, blouses, shirts, shoes, and articles for the home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, clothes, and Yambal beauty products to better stock her business

loans.name: El Eden 1 And 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is a 35 year old entrepreneur who lives in Hato Mayor, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) El Eden. Her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients. 

This is Ana's third loan with Esperanza. She successfully repaid two prior loans. She likes working with Esperanza because it helps improve the lives of women in her community. She plans to use the money from this loan to buy more used clothes and shoes to sell to the people in her community. She hopes to continue to buy more items so that her business can grow.

Ana is a single mother with two children (ages 13 and 1.5 years). She lives in a community that has unreliable access to running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. She hopes that her business will continue to grow so that she can improve the living conditions of her family and proviD. for her children.

loans.use: To buy used clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick K. is 37 years old and married to Nancy Njoki. They have 3 school-going children. For the last 5 years Patrick has used his bicycle to transport clients from one place to another around Naivasha town.

Now Patrick wants to upgrade to a motorcycle. He will use his loan to buy a new motorcycle.

Patrick was introduced to KADET by his friend. This is his first loan with KADET. In the future he plans to expand into the transport business and buy a lorry. He will use this lorry to transport goods to and from the market.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his taxi business (upgrade from bicycle).

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 30 and married with two children, 3 and 12 years old. Both of her children go to school. She rents a one-roomed house where she is staying with four people. Aisha takes care of additional family members.The family has access to electricity but no piped water, and gets three meals a day. She incurs transport costs for buying clothing materials and foodstuffs from Nakawa market. She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

She owns a stall in Naguru market selling bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes. Aisha works seven days a week. She receives an average of 25 customers a day. Her major business challenges include ever-increasing prices of foodstuffs and the rainy season, which disturbs her work because she works from a muddy place. Her monthly expenses include rent, monthly market dues, feeding the family and medication. She has been in this business for over three years and with MCDT for five years, servicing her tenth loan working with the same group-mates. Aisha joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because of working in groups. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, sacks of cassava, and sweet potatoes. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and start buying directly from farmers.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas,sweet potatoes cassavaand Irish potatoes

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta E. runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling food and daily use products in her community. She is 30 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Lagunde, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. Mareta has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Mareta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mareta is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Las Afortunadas Ii Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  “Las Afortunadas II” se creó en el Asentamiento Humano las Poncianas, este Banco está en su segundo ciclo, lo conforman doce socias, mujeres emprendedoras y muy  entusiastas, ellas se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: costura, perfumería, abarrotes, frutas, venta de carbón, etc. Teresa es la presidenta de este Banco Comunal, ella tiene 18 años, es soltera y se dedica a la confección de collares, pulseras y aretes.  El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que lo utilizó en la compra de piedras, hilos, para bisutería, ahora ella necesita 600 soles, que será utilizado para comprar telas y confeccionar bolsos y carteras con pedrería. 
La meta de Teresa es tener un taller bien implementado de Bisutería. 
El Banco Comunal  “Las Afortunadas II” requiere un crédito de 6500 soles, que las socias utilizarán para invertir en las diferentes actividades que desarrollan: costura, venta de perfumería, venta de abarrotes, venta de frutas, venta carbón, entre otros. El sueño de todas las socias es seguir adelante en este mundo competitivo y poder aportat económicamente en sus hogares.
texts.en:
“Las Afortunadas II” communal bank began in the Asentamiento Humano las Poncianas. This communal bank is in its second cycle and consists of twelve, enterprising and enthusiastic women. They each work in different areas such as: sewing, selling perfume, grocery, fruits, coal, etc. Teresa is the president of this communal bank. She is 18 years old, single, and makes necklaces, bracelets, and earrings. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which she used to purchase stones and thread for costume jewelry. Now she needs 600 PEN, which she will use to purchase fabric and make handbags and purses with precious stones. Teresa’s goal is to have a well-run costume jewelry workshop. The “Las Afortunadas II” communal bank needs a loan of 6500 PEN, which the members will use to invest in their different businesses: sewing, perfume sales, grocery sales, fruit sales, coal sales, etc. Each member’s dream is to succeed in this competitive world and to be able economically support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in their businesses (e.g. sewing, perfume sales, grocery sales, fruit sales, coal sales, among others)

loans.name: Sergio Guadalupe

texts.es: El señor Sergio Guadalupe Díaz es casado con la señora Gabriela son una familia joven y padres de familia de un pequeñito el labora para el gobierno como inspector, y su esposa esta al cuidado de la casa y de su bebe. Ellos están tramitando el crédito para la terminar la construcción de un cuarto, para acondicionárselo a su pequeñito y así tener mas espacio en su hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Sergio Guadalupe Díaz is married to Gabriela. They are a young family and parents of a little baby boy. He works for the government as an inspector, and his wife cares for the home and their baby. They are asking for a loan to finish constructing a bedroom for their little baby and then have more space in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish constructing a room

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Mr. Chann P. is a villager in Preaek Ta Nob village in Takeo province.  He is a laborer in a rice mill factory. His wife, Mrs. Oret Ve, is a laborer in a rice field. Although they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mr. Chann P. decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets to start a new breeding business. He is the father of four children who are enrolled in local public school. His wife is shown with him on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: 21 De Junio Group

texts.es:
9 mujeres y 1 varon son los integrantes de la Asociación Comunal 21 de Junio. Sus negocios son diversos: venta de chinelas, tienda de mantas, macramé, elaboración de artesanìas, tienda de mantas, venta de comida y comerciante en ropa. 

Una de ellas, Claudia Gutierres tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos, sandalias y pantuflas para niños;  cuando inicio su negocio ella era soltera y su objetivo era lograr un ingreso propio para estudiar, al princio le ayudó su mamá.  Su puesto es fijo en la Zona 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto.  

Ella considera que con el dinero que está solicitando podrá comprar aproximadamente 8 docenas en  mercadería, comenta que es necesario surtir el negocio con diferentes tipos de zapatos, sandalias y pantuflas y en diferentes tamaños.

Actualmente la señora Claudia Gutierres se encuentra casada y tiene un niño pequeño.  Piensa que a sus veintidos años es mejor por el momento no tener mas hijos y espera consultar con la médico de Pro Mujer para ser orientada en el mejor método anticonceptivo.
texts.en:
The June 21st Communal Bank consists of nine women and one man. They have different retail businesses selling slippers, blankets, macramé, handicrafts, rugs, food, and clothing.

One of the members is Claudia G.. She operates a home business selling shoes, sandals, and slippers for children. When she started her business, Claudia was single and earning money in order to pay for her own education. Her mother helped with the business at the very beginning. Her vending location is established in the July 16th District of the City of El Alto.

She plans to use the money she requested to buy 8 dozen units of merchandise. Claudia says it is necessary to restock her business with various types of shoes, sandals, and slippers in different sizes.

Sra. Claudia is currently married and has a young child. She believes being in her twenties is a good time to have more children, so she is waiting to consult with one of the doctors at Pro Mujer to determine the best method of contraception.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Candido

texts.en: Candido is 44 years old and is married to Nancy Ferreira.  They have three young children together.  Candido runs a food stall that sells rice, noodles, yerba mate, oil and milk among other products.  Previously, Candido worked as a mechanic and saved his money so that he could open this food ll.  With the help of his is wife who works at the food stall, and thanks to the low prices he is able to offer his customers, Candido's business has been a success.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar, rice, noodles, yerba mate, oil, and gasoline among other products.  Candido's dream is to expand his business to offer his customers even more products.

loans.use: To purchase rice, noodles, yerba mate, oil

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan is 35 years old and lives with his wife and their two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a rented 'ger', the Mongolian nomadic tent. His older daughter goes to a local secondary school. They have been living in their current home for three years.

In 2007, Batsaihan started his livestock trading business with his wife. Since they started their business, their quality of life has been improving. Batsaihan purchases young livestock at cheap prices, and when they are grown up he sells them for a profit. He began with a working capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~140  USD), but with a lot of hard work he was able to grow his working capital to the level of 500,000 tugrugs (~ 351 USD). He has been planning to expand his business in the future. 

Batsaihan is a very hard-working person and has great communication skills. He says, “I would like to  provide my children with a good education and good morals. ” He is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~ 422 USD) loan to purchase livestock and resell the animals for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en: Bahaa is a 28-year-old married man from Nablus who lives with his wife and four children, one of whom has recently entered school. Formerly working with his brother in cosmetics, Bahaa eventually decided that he would like to work on his own. After he took leadership training which taught him how to be independent and responsible, he opened his own barbershop in 2002.  Bahaa hopes through this loan to buy a skin-cleaning machine which will bring him more customers, and he aspires to open a barbershop near AlNajah Academy in the future.

loans.use: To buy a skin-cleaning machine which will bring him more customers

loans.name: Jesús René

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es la esposa.

Jesús René A. es un padre que desea ofrecerles lo mejor a sus hijos, es por ello que trabaja en una maquiladora de Lunes a Viernes y si hay tiempo extra también los fines de semana.  El tiene cuatro hijos y uno de ellos ya esta creciendo; es por ello que desea construirle una recamara en la pare de atrás de su vivienda para que tenga su propio espacio. La casa de René es pequeña esta es de interés social los cuales por dentro están muy reducidas. Es por ello que el pide el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Jesús René A. is a father who wants to give the best to his children. This is why he works in a plant from Monday to Friday, and weekends as well if there is time. He has four children, and one of them is already growing up; this is why he wants to build a bedroom in the back of his home so his child can have his own space. René's house is small, the interior space is very limited. This is why he is requesting the loan, so he can complete his project. The person in the photograph is his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a bedroom for his eldest son

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Mrs. Tim V., 55, owns a small handicraft business producing incense to sell. By doing this, she has been able to feed all her children since they were small. She now has two children who are living with her while another is married and lives away from home. Tim V.'s husband is also a financial earner as he raises a few pigs from home.
Tim V. has a goal to make additional income by investing in a new business line. She hopes to own a machine to provide a rice-milling service but she doesn’t have cash yet to buy one. Therefore, she is applying for assistance through Kiva partner, HKL, to the amount of $500 USD.

loans.use: To buy a machine to provide a rice-milling service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a leather embroidery machine & materials for making sandals

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen C. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 25 years old, married and has 3 infant-age children. To make a living, Gretchen owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gretchen has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gretchen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gretchen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used  to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Gretchen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gretchen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel, de 25 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijo alguno. Reside en la selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, donde tiene su propia casa. Desde su adolescencia empezó como ayudante, trabajando en la chacra de su vecino y todo lo que ganaba se lo guardaba. Luego de un tiempo adquirió una parcela considerable, en donde producía y comercializaba cacao y café, desde entonces sus ventas fueron incrementándose. Actualmente comercializa su producción a los grandes mayoristas y a los centros de acopio de su comunidad a un precio competitivo, eso le da mucha ventaja en las ganancias. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en temporada de sembrío y cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones para que lo pueda facilitar la extracción de su producto final. Sus planes a futuro es terminar de construir su casa a base de material noble, con la finalidad de mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además augura un porvenir en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de insumos y abono para mejorar la producción de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Fidel, 25, is single and has no children. He lives in his own house in the town of Manitea Alta in the Peruvian jungle. As a boy, he worked as a field hand, laboring on a local farm and saving everything he earned. He eventually managed to buy his own farm where he grows cocoa and coffee. His output has steadily increased and he now sells his crop to the large wholesaleers and warehouses in his town, an advantage because he can get a better price. He normally works on his own but he hires laborers to help him during the planting and harvesting seasons. Fidel would like to finish building his house, something that will improve his quality of life. This is his second MFP loan and he is committed to repaying it on time. He hopes to work with the community group in the future, as well. He will use this loan to buy supplies and manure to improve his production of cacao and coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business

loans.name: Terencia

texts.en: Terencia V. is a 58-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a food-vending business and in tailoring. She lives in Brgy. Banhigan, Dalaguete, Cebu City with her husband Lamberto and their four children, who are 21 to 37 years old. Three of their children have their own families, while one is working. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food-vending and tailoring businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 Philippine pesos (Php). Terencia is now borrowing Php 18,000 so that she can continue her food-vending business and have additional working capital. This will be her 11th loan cycle from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Terencia aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for food vending

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a young dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for the last two years and has employed one farm-hand. His main product is milk which he sells to the Kenya Cooperative Creameries in Sotik town.

Benard is 24 years old and single. Apart from farming, he also operates a retail shop and a hotel in the same area. His biggest challenge in farming has been lack of enough funds to expand his farming activities and the poor pricing of milk.

He recently completed his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.30,000 and has requested this loan of KES.70,000 to purchase a dairy cow. He says that this dairy cow will produce enough milk for sale and family use. He will be able to service the loan and meet the family's needs.

Benard would like to improve his dairy farming in the future by building a modern dairy unit and improving the dairy breed to higher yielding cows. He is grateful to Juhudi for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel B. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old. Richel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Richel owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice like "masipag" for sale. (Masipag rice is grown using green methods.) Richel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Richel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Richel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Richel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa resiD. en barrio las delicias Corinto Departamento D. Morazán, vive con su esposo y un hijo D. la edad D. 21 años el cual le ayuda en la panadería.
Aprendió hacer pan gracias a su mama que elaboraba artesanalmente el pan, ella residía en santa rosa Departamento D. Morazán y decidió mudarse a Corinto para mejorar su negocio ya que en el lugar donD. ella residía no era mucho la demanda al contrario en Corinto tiene mejores oportunidades para que su negocio pueda crecer.
El crédito lo invertirá en compra D. harina azúcar levadura y también comprara una bicicleta para salir a vender el pan por la residencia.
D. esta forma ella comercializara mejor el producto y los ingresos serán una buena oportunidad para mejorar su condición D. vida ya que la demanda es buena en la zona.
sus aspiraciones es ampliar su negocio y poder ser una vendedora D. mayoreo a las tiendas y los negocios más grandes y D. esta forma mejorar las condiciones D. vida en la educación y la salud D. su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa lives in Corinto’s Delicias neighborhood, Morazán department, with her husband and a 21-year-old son who helps out in the bakery. She learned how to bake bread from her mother who was an artisanal bread maker. She lived in Santa Rosa, Morazán department but decided to move to Corinto to improve her business because where she used to live there was little demand for her products whereas in Corinto she has more opportunities for her business to grow. She will use the funds to buy flour, sugar and yeast and also to buy a bicycle to use to go out and sell the bread throughout the neighborhood. This way she will be able to sell her product better and income will be a good opportunity for her to improve her standard of living because demand is good in this area.
