Her dreams are to expand her business and be able to become a wholesaler in stores and large firms so that her living conditions will improve especially with respect to her family’s education and health.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, yeast.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old and is a married man with two children. He has been a salesman for fourteen years.

In 2009 he opened his own shop for women’s and babies’ clothes plus women's accessories. He has a good reputation in his local area.

He is requesting a loan of $2,500 from Kiva partner, CHF-ACSI which he wants to invest in buying a big generator for electricity and increasing his inventory. His goal is to improve the quality of life for his family through growing bigger in his business and increasing his profits.

loans.use: To buy a big generator and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en:
Jenie B. is from the village of Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 19 years old. Jenie is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Jenie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Jenie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jenie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jenie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Irembo Group

texts.fr:
Dorothée M. est une femme commerçante âgée de 58 ans qui habite au Quartier Kamenge en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce des habits pour toutes catégories depuis 25 ans. Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est une veuve. Elle arrive au 8e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 2enfants qui sont adultes et qu’elle ne prend plus en charge.
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital afin d’importer les habits de l’Ouganda et ainsi augmenter la quantité des habits  à vendre dans l’espoir d’avoir un grand bénéfice. Elle espère avoir un grand capital dans l’avenir qui lui permettra de faire un grand business. Elle espère en plus, qu’avec des économies générées de ce business, elle parviendra à parachever la construction de  sa propre maison  qu’elle a commencer a bâtir.
 
 Elle  est une des membres du groupe  Communautaire« Irembo»
texts.en:
Dorothée M. is a 58-year-old retailer who lives in the Kamenge district of Bujumbura. She is a widow and the mother of two independent, adult children. 

Dorothée did not attend school. She has been selling all kinds of clothes for 25 years. She is currently in the 8th cycle of community credit with the Turame MFI.
  
Dorothée is seeking credit through Kiva to bolster her capital in order to import clothes from Uganda, thereby increasing her stocks, and hopefully, boosting her profits. She hopes to have more capital in the future, which would enable her to run a large business. She also hopes that the savings from her business will help to finish construction on her house.

Dorothée is a member of the Irembo community group.

loans.use: To increase her capital in order to import clothes from Uganda, increase her stocks, and make substantial profits

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia B. is from the village of Ilaya, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ofelia owns and operates a food sector business making and selling food. While not her only means of generating revenue, Ofelia’s main source of income comes primarily from making and selling a variety of food products, especially food delicacies, or viands. Ofelia also sells rice by the kilogram in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Ofelia joined Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) in 2010 to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be Ofelia’s second loan from HSPFI. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP that she used to expand her business. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products to sell and also to use as working capital. Ofelia plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products to sell and also to use as working capital

location.town: Ilaya, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hendriah

texts.en:
Hendriah has been farming for the last five years in Kitale town, western Kenya. Her farm produces vegetables and maize, which she sells to the local market. Her biggest challenge in farming has been lack of storage facilities for her milk. Hendriah is 23 years old. She is married with one child, age 2.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will help her purchase a quality dairy cow that will increase her milk production and enable her to provide enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. In five year's time, she plans to acquire at least three dairy cows and be the main milk supplier to the local market. She comments that dairy farming has got challenges but with commitment, one overcomes them and enjoys the profits.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more red oil to sell.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yem C., 29 years old, is married (Her husband is pictured.) and the mother of a young child who is enrolled in school. To earn a living, Mrs. Yem C. is an internal staff member working in the garment industry. Her husband has a small business where he sells cooking supplies in and around the provinces of Cambodia.  

Mrs. Yem C. thinks that her husband's trade is a very profitable one, and it also provides the family with a good standard of living. Recently, her husband has lacked funds to buy additional products to better meet the needs of his customers. Mrs. Yem C. would like to borrow some money for her husband to purchase more products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Nubia Del Socorro

texts.es: Nubia F. mujer  casada y con 3 hijos en las edades de 3,5 y 10 años inició su negocio una vez su esposo quedó desempleado por un accidente laboral; ella inició con su propio equipo de cómputos haciendo transcripciones y aprovechando los colegios cercanos. Gradualmente empezó a generar muchos clientes que también requerían el servicio de fotocopiaje y compró su maquina para dar respuesta a esta demanda. Como le ha ido bien por su buen manejo empresarial,  cada día piensa en que cosas adicionar como valor agregado para extenderlo y lograr que algún día no solo ofrezca estos servicios sino también que se convierta en una papelería bien cotizada, porque mucho es el potencial de clientes en este sentido debido a que se encuentra en una zona escolar y esto ayuda a la demanda de estos productos. En la actualidad solicita su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, quiere agregar una fotocopiadora mas  con su credikiva y en un futuro no muy lejano fortalecer su negocio diversificando su oferta con papelería. Su sueño es sacar adelante a su familia y que esta,  su microempresa,  se convierta en una fuente de ingreso y empleo principal y cada día con más tecnología donde los estudiantes puedan acceder y aprender.
texts.en:
Nubia F. is a married woman with three children (ages 3, 5, and 10). She started her business after her husband lost his job because of an accident at work. Nubia started with her own computer equipment to perform transcriptions and take advantage of the schools nearby. Gradually she began building a large clientele in need of photocopy services, so she bought a copying machine in order to meet that demand. Nubia has done well at managing her business. Each day she looks for things to add that are of value so that her business can become a stationery shop along with providing services. She has the potential of gaining more customers since she is located near a school where there is a demand for paper products.

Nubia is currently requesting her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy another photocopier. In the not too distant future, she hopes to diversify her business by offering stationery. Her dreams include seeing her family get ahead, converting her microenterprise in to a strong source of both income and employment, and acquiring more technology each day that students can access and learn.

loans.use: Purchase a photocopying machine

loans.name: Maria Rosalina

texts.es:
María, resiD. en San Simón departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad, tiene 32 años D. edad, está casada pero aun no tiene hijos, este negocio tiene más D. seis años D. existir con un horario D. 6:00am a 7:00pm lo atienD., actualmente necesita compra mercadería para asistir al inventario y dotarlo D. mercadería para uso domestico.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, papel higiénico, con esta ayuda el negocio será fortalecido para atender la demanda  D. los clientes brindando un buen servicio. El objetivo D. María es realizar una buena inversión, surtir el negocio con todo lo necesario para satisfacer la necesidad del cliente, desarrollar la familia con hijos y velar por el bienestar D. ellos.
texts.en:
María lives in the San Simón department of Morazán.  She sells basic, essential items.  She is 32, married, but does not yet have children.  Her business is more than six years old, and she works from 6am to 7pm.  She now needs to purchase merchandise for inventory.
She requests this loan to invest in merchandise such as rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, and bathroom tissue.  With this loan, the business will be well-equipped and able to meet the needs of customers.  The goals of María are to make a good investment, supply her business with everything necessary to satisfy her customers, and to have children and care for them.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, and bathroom tissue

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally M. (pictured with her loom), 43, is a widow with two sons and two daughters. She lives her sister, brother and parents on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her sister is a weaver and her brother is a security guard.  

Phally is a weaver. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her brother to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her brother to get work

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La señora Erika G. P. tiene la edad de 27 años, estudio solo secundaria y esta casada con el señor Armando Reyes con el cual tiene 2 hijos de los cules uno es hombre al cual llamam Wilian de siete años de edad y una mujer de nombre Monserrat de 6 años ellos asisten a la primaria. La señora Erika y su familia viven en la comunidad de Vista Hermosa que pertenece al municipio de Tierra Blanca en el estado de Veracruz, para llegar a la comunidad de Vista Hermosa se debe tomar un autobus en Tierra Blanca que solo sale 2 veces al dia por la mañana y al medio dia la mayiria de las veces las personas toman un autobus que los deja en la carretera y tienen que caminar 20 minutos para llegar a sus hogares.

Doña Erika nos platica que hace un poco mas de 5 meses decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de ropa interior para dama, ella vende por catalogo casa por casa en su comunidad, primero lleva el catalogo con sus cliente, levanta pedido lo encarga con su proveedor y cuando llega lo entrega y resibe su pago por su productos,tambien nos comenta que los fines de semana (Sabado o Domingo) hace chiles rellenos los cuales  los ofrece con sus clientes y despues cuando termina de prepararlos los entrega, ella tambien hace donas de manjar y gelatinas. Doña Erika nos platica que decidio iniciar con su propio negocio porque queria ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de hogar y los estudios de sus pequeños. Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de catalogos, ropa interior,arina, chiles, carne, huevos, col y tortillas. Ella espera seguir trabajanto muy duroo de la mano de su esposo ya que  desea contruir su casa y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia,
 ella esta muy agradecida con la fundacion por la oportunidad que le esta brindando al otorgarle este prestamo de que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Sra. Erika is 27 years old, only went to high school and is married to Sr. Armando Reyes. Together they have two children: a seven-year-old boy named Wilian and a six-year-old girl named Monserrat. They attend primary school together.  Erika and her family live in a community called Vista Hermosa ("Beautiful View") that belongs to the municipality of Tierra Blanca in the state of Veracruz. In order to arrive at the Vista Hermosa community, one must take a bus from Tierra Blanca that only leaves twice per day: once in the morning and once at noon. The majority of times, people take a bus that drops them off on a road that is another 20 minute walk from their homes. 

Doña Erika tells us that a little more than five months ago, she decided to begin her own business selling undergarments for women. She goes door to door in her community, bringing catalogs with her. She brings the order to her suppliers and when it arrives, she delivers it to her customers and receives a payment for her products. She also says that on the weekends (Saturdays and Sundays), she makes chiles rellenos (stuffed chili peppers) and donuts filled with dulce de leche (a caramel sauce) and gelatine treats. She offers these products to her clients and delivers them upon request.  Doña Erika tells us that she decided to begin her own business because she wanted to help her husband with the living expenses as well as the expenses of her little children's studies. She needs this loan in order to invest in the sale of catalogs, undergarments, flour, chili peppers, meat, eggs, coal and tortillas. She is hoping to continue working hard alongside her spouse, who still hopes to build a home and to provide for her family the best quality of life. She is very grateful for the foundation for the confidence it has in her by offering this loan and for the opportunity for her business to prosper.

loans.use: To sell undergarments and food.

loans.name: Darlin Suyen

texts.es:
DESCRIPCION: Esta joven tiene 24 años de edad, labora como tecnica del ministerio de educaciòn desde hace 4 años donde se ha desempeñado con gran responsabilidad y esmero, tiene dos hijos  , el mayor de 6 añitos de edad cursa su primer grado de educaciòn primaria y el segundo un niño de 3 añitos de edad, ella para poder salir a su centro de trabajo deja a sus niños al cuido de una hermana. 

Solicita su primer crédito con el apoyo de Kiva para invertir en mejora de su vivienda y de esta manera darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. 

Su mayor Sueño en la vida es que sus hijos se desarrollen en el ambito social para que sean personas de bien y contar con un soporte economico en su madurez.
texts.en:
DESCRIPTION:  This young, 24-year-old, has worked as a Technician for the Ministry of Education for the last 4 years.  She has worked with responsibility and commitment.  She has two children.  The oldest, who is 6 years old, is in first grade and the second is 3 years old.  In order for her to go to work, she leaves her children in the care of her sister.

She is asking for her first loan with Kiva’s help to invest in home improvements in order to provide better living conditions for her family.

Her greatest dream in life is that her children develop in a social milieu that will lead to their becoming upstanding citizens with economic support when they grow up.

loans.use: For home improvement.

loans.name: Asociación Sin Frontera Group

texts.es:
El grupo Asociación sin frontera lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Felipa José E. quien vende verduras desde hace 20 años en Tipitapa municipio de Managua. Ella invertirá el crédito en naranjas, limones, papas y en especial repollo.

Las otras integrantes de grupo como Socorro Rodríguez quien vende papel a las comiderias el cual utilizan para servir la comida y Lidia P. Solano vende ropa, zapatos…etc. desde hace 20 años.
texts.en:
The “Sin Frontera” (Without Borders) group is composed of three, hard working, enterprising women.  One of them is Felipa José E. who has been selling vegetables in Tipitapa, Managua, for the last 20 years.  She will use the money to buy oranges, lemons, potatoes and especially, cabbage.

The other group members are Socorro Rodríguez who sells paper used to serve meals to eateries and Lidia P. Solano who has sold clothes, shoes, etc. for the past 20 years.

loans.use: For vegetables like oranges, lemons, potatoes and especially cabbage.

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean P. is 30 and is the mother of two school-aged children. She has been working at a local rubber plantation in Kompong Tom province for a year. Her husband also works at the same plantation. Together they earn about $5.50 a day to meet the needs of the family. 

With this loan, Mean P. will purchase a plot of farmland from a villager in order to cultivate rice crops. This will enable her family to accrue extra profit to meet their daily expenses. 

Note: Mean P. and her two small children are in the picture.

loans.use: purchase a plot of farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: John

texts.es: John, de 21 años es un joven trabajador. Vive en compañía de su papá Dionisio, su mamá Telma y su 2 menores hermanos, a los que apoya económicamente, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Muruhuay. Cuando era niño ayudó a sus padres en la limpieza de la maleza que crecía constantemente en sus cultivos, desde entonces aprendió todo lo necesario con el oficio de su familia. Hace algún tiempo comenzó a sembrar en su propio terreno agrícola; arveja, habas, papa y hortalizas, productos que intercala de acuerdo a la temporada de sembrío. Vendiendo sus cosechas a unos intermediarios mayoristas del caserío de Yanama. Asimismo le falta muy poco para terminar sus estudios de mantenimiento de maquinarias, donde invierte dinero mensualmente. Culminando sus estudios piensa dedicarse al trabajo paralelo, comprando más terrenos agrícolas para sembrar en mayores cantidades con la ayuda de su familia. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por el apoyo que recibe constantemente. John, empezará a sembrar semillas de arvejas, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar 3 bolsas de semilla de arveja para comenzar a esparcirlos entre sus terrenos.
texts.en:
John, 21, is a young man who helps his family economically.  He lives with his father, Dionisio, and his mother, Telma, and two younger brothers, in their home in the rural area of Bellavista Muruhuay.  As a child he used to help his parents remove the weeds from their cropland where he learned everything he needed to know about crop farming.  

A few years ago he began planting his own fields of peas, lima beans, potatoes and vegetables, depending on the season.  He sells his produce to the wholesale dealers in Yanama.  He is also about to finish a machine maintenance course, which he pays for on a monthly basis, and plans to work at both activities in the future.  He wants to buy more land to increase crop production with his family's help.  

He is a member of the "Señor de Muruhuay" communal bank and this is his second loan through MFP.  He is very grateful for the support he receives.  John will use the loan to buy three bags of pea seeds which he will begin sewing soon.

loans.use: To buy three bags of pea seeds

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann G. is from the village of Tagpako, Gingoog City. She is 42 years old. Mary Ann is widowed and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mary Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods and junk food. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Ann from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods and junk food for sale

loans.name: Francisco Wilberto

texts.es: El señor Francisco L. Hernández, tiene la edad de 47 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual labora como afanadora para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen 3 hijos , todos estudian  el mayor   le apoya con las actividades del hogar y luego va a clases , los planes futuros es poder levantar un muro en su casa de habitación ya que el agua de la calle afecta por el mal olor y cuando esta es demasiado entra al terreno ,  don Francisco desde hace tres años labor como guarda de seguridad , la mayor afectación es que su salario no le ajusta para poder comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción  . El crédito lo quiere para comprar zinc , cemento , arena , piedrín etc. .
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco L. Hernández, age 47, resides in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife who works as a housekeeper in order to help with the household expenses. They have three children. All of them are in school and help with the household activities before they leave for class. Francisco’s future plans include putting up a retaining wall for his house because the runoff water from the street has a bad odor and the smell comes into his house when it seeps into his property.

Don Francisco has been working as a security guard for three years. His major challenge is that he does not earn enough from his salary to make this one-time purchase of construction materials. This loan will be used to buy zinc, cement, sand, gravel, and other supplies.

loans.use: to purchase zinc, cement, sand, gravel, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés  tiene  36 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo con el cual vive en casa de sus padres, personas muy bondadosas que nunca le negaron el apoyo a su hija. Esta familia vive en el caserío El Porvenir, caserío que aún no cuenta con los servicios de luz y agua y se encuentra a 6 km. del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.

Desde hace 8 años Inés es enfermera técnica y trabaja en la posta médica de su caserío, percibiendo ingresos mensuales que le permiten mantener a su menor hijo y contribuir con los gastos de su casa. 

Además de ello, Inés conduce con sus papás una parcela de 1.20 hectáreas en la cual tiene plantaciones de mango y limón, que cosechan quincenalmente. La plantación cuenta con buen vigor y desarrollo. 

Inés solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2500 nuevos soles cuyo destino será la compra de fertilizantes y limpieza del terreno para mejorar la producción de sus mangos y limones. Esto le permitirá a Inés y a sus padres tener mayores ingresos para mejorar las comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Inés is 36 years old.  She is a single mother and has one child with whom she lives in her parents' home.  Her parents are very kind people who have never withheld support from their daughter.  The family lives in the small village of El Porvenir.  Their village still does not have access to electricity or running water.  It is located 6km from Piura, Tambogrande district.

Inés has been working as a nurse for eight years.  She works in the medical center in her village.  She makes a monthly wage which enables her to support her son and contribute to her household's expenses.

In addition, Inés runs a 1.2 hectare plot of land together with her parents, on which they have mango and lemon plantations which they harvest every two weeks.  The plantations grow vigorously and are well developed.

Inés is requesting a loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use this money to buy fertilizers and to weed her land in order to improve the production of her mango and lemon trees.  This will enable Inés and her parents to make more money so that they can improve the comfort of their home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to weed her land

loans.name: Aurelio Martin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Aurelio Martin; el tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de transporte, el tiene un carro que realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio quiere ahorrar para estudiar alguna profesión, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi que realiza.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y para comprar algunos repuestos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Aurelio Martin, age 24, is single and works as a taxi driver.  He uses his own vehicle to provide services throughout the city of Cusco from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  With the income from this business he plans to save to study for a professional career.  He wants to improve the taxi service and is requesting a loan to buy repair parts and pay for maintenance.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy auto repair parts and pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Nara

texts.es:
La señora Nara es socia del  banco comunal El Arenal del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y tuvo 10 hijos en total.
Lleva 6 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de comida en el patio de su casa por las tardes, en estos días está con descanso medico.
Con su nuevo préstamo de s/.1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 nueva parrilla porque la que tiene esta muy deteriorada y necesita un cambio.
Su esposo es un pequeño agricultor que trabaja pero lo que gana es muy poco, es por eso que Nara le ayuda vendiendo comida.  Gracias a Manuela Ramos tiene el capital necesario para seguir trabajando y poder ayudar a su esposo.
texts.en:
Sra. Nara is a member of the Communal Bank “El Arenal” which is in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 60 years old, married, and has a total of 10 children.

Nara has been working with Manuela Ramos for six years. She sells food in the afternoons from the patio of her house. In recent days, she has had to take medical leave.

With this new loan of 1500 PEN, Nara will buy a new grill because the one she currently owns has deteriorated and needs to be replaced.

Her husband is a small working farmer, but he earns very little. It is for this reason that Nara helps out by selling food. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she has the necessary capital to continue working and assisting her husband.

loans.use: to purchase a grill.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. She is providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy tools, etc. needed for the service.

Christine has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Christine  hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy tools, etc. needed for the service.

loans.name: Mahtumbi

texts.ru: Махтумби проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 57 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Она занимается торговлей на рынке. Арендует торговую точку, где продает детскую одежду. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Mahtumbi lives in the town of Kulob. 57 years of age. Married, with two children. She works as a vendor at the local market. She rents out  a stand, where she sells children’s clothing. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is taking out a loan in order to buy goods for the new season.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for the new season

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es: Evelyn es una joven madre de 27 años, vive con su esposo y sus pequeños hijos en casa que heredó de sus padres. Hace más de 8 años Evelyn se gana la vida trabando a lado de su esposo en el servicio de transporte, siendo su esposo quien conduce el vehículo que alquilan. Es de esta manera que ofrecen éste servicio recorriendo las calles de su ciudad. Mientras Evelyn se encarga de la administración de los ingresos y egresos de sus ganancias. Por otro lado, se dedica también en la crianza de vacas y toros, que los alimenta y cuida hasta que tengan un peso considerado para luego ser vendidos, cuyas ganancias son derivadas también para cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Evelyn disfruta de su trabajo porque se siente más independiente y toma también las decisiones en el hogar. Es su doceavo crédito que tiene con MFP, recuerda aquellos momentos en que decidió ser parte del banco comunal y que hasta el momento le ha permitido progresar. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el pago del mantenimiento mecánico para su carro y también en  la compra de más animales.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 27, is a young mother living with her husband and small children in the house she inherited from her parents.  For over 8 years Evelyn has been making a living working along side her husband providing transportation services.  Her husband drives the vehicle they lease.  This is how they offer this service traversing the city streets.  Evelyn takes care of administering income and outgo of their profits.  On the other hand, she also raises cows and bulls that she feeds and cares for until they reach considerable weight and can be sold.  Profits are also produced here to cover family needs.

Evelyn enjoys her work because she feels more independent and she also makes the decisions in the home.  This is the 12th loan she has with MFP.  She remembers the moment when she decided to first be part of the communal bank which to date has made her progress possible.  

She will use the requested loan to pay for her car’s mechanical maintenance and also to buy more animals.

loans.use: to have the car serviced and to buy an additional dairy cow.

loans.name: Soyolmaa

texts.en:
Soyolmaa is 48 and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2005, she has managed a food sales business. Soyolmaa’s husband supports her business everyday. Their daughter is going to enter university this year, but there is a financial problem with the university payment.
 
Soyolmaa has been thinking about how to increase her income to pay for her daughter’s education and has decided to raise her assets quickly. Currently, her business assets are MNT 1,480,000. Therefore Soyolmaa is requesting a loan to purchase the inventory of food products from abroad to increase her business assets.

loans.use: To purchase the inventory of food products from abroad to increase her business assets.

loans.name: Marites Group

texts.en:
Marites is married with two children. Marites is 33 years old and lives in Clarin. She has a general store in order to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 4000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional stock for her general store.

Marites just joined PMPC this year. 

Marites is the leader of a 4-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. Dolores es socia del banco comunal Las Cuencanitas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una hermosa arquitectura colonia y esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía es muy variada, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Dolores tiene 44 años, es separada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 26, 17 y 15 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Dolores se dedica a vender choclomote (delicioso plato típico de Cuenca), vende su producto ambulantemente en una carreta, trabaja de lunes a sábados.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 10 años  y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra mote, choclo, queso y huevos para su negocio.
 
Su meta es darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Dolores is a member of the communal bank "Las Cuencanitas".  She lives in the city of Cuenca; this city has beautiful colonial architecture, and is surrounded by 4 rivers.  It's cuisine is very varied, its people are kind and friendly, and they keep up their culture and the traditions of their ancestors.

Doña Dolores is 44 years old.  She is separated, and has 3 children from her marriage aged 26, 17, and 15.  Her eldest child works and helps her out financially; her two younger children are attending school.  She doesn't own her own home, so she lives in a rental.

Señora Dolores works selling choclomote (a delicious dish that is typically Cuencan).  She sells her product as a street vendor, and works from Monday through Saturday.

She has been part of the communal bank for ten years, and she will be investing her loan in purchasing hominy, corn, cheese and eggs for her business.  Her goal is to provide her children with the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy hominy, corn, cheese and eggs.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando de 48 años de edad tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 10 a 22 años; él vive en San Jacinto, municipio del departamento de Bolívar y tierra que produce artesanías en tejido vertical, como hamacas, bolsos sandalias etc. Allí tiene un negocio donde vende ranchos víveres, enlatados, lácteos, embutidos etc. tienda que inició desde hace 1 año y que ésta empeñado en hacer crecer, inyectando capital de crédito, porque su mayor desafío es lograr un  buen surtido, mediante compras en mayor volumen y de contado para ganar descuentos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará víveres y especialmente productos de mayor rotación como refrescos y bebidas. Su negocio lo inició a base de esfuerzos cuando no encontraba trabajo y decidió generar ingresos independientes, aprovechando la oportunidad de comprar una tienda, con sus ahorros y prestamos que hicieron en ese momento familiares muy cercanos. Con su tienda le ha ido muy bien y se siente orgulloso de haber superado múltiples desafíos, como los créditos con los que empezó.  Su meta es incrementar sus ingresos mediante su trabajo en la tienda y por eso se esmera día a día, manejando una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de 11% desde la cual auguramos un potencial de crecimiento y éxitos sobre la inversión que aplicará mediante su credikiva.
texts.en:
Fernando, 48, has five children aged between 10 and 25 years.  He lives in San Jacinto, a town in Bolívar Department, known for vertical loom crafts like hammocks, bags, sandals, etc.   He has a store there where he sells snacks, foodstuffs, canned goods, dairy products, cured meats, etc.  He started the store a year ago and he’s determined to make it grow injecting working capital into it because his greatest challenge is having a wide selection acquired through large volume purchases that he pays cash for to qualify for discounts.

This is the reason for his Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he will use to buy foodstuffs, especially items that sell quickly, like soft-drinks and beverages.  

He started the business based on his own efforts when he was unable to find employment and decided to generate income independently when he got the opportunity to buy a store.  He used his savings and some loans close relatives made him.  He’s done very well with the store and he feels proud to have overcome multiple challenges, like the initial loans he started out with.  His goal is to increase income through his work in the store and this is why he strives daily managing a profit margin of 11% over sales which we can use to predict growth potential and success on the investment he’ll make applying his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Corazon has a pigpen and sells matured, grown pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Corazon hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs.

loans.name: Victoria John

texts.en:
Victoria is a lady who has four grown up children. Her business is located at Digo Road, in Mombasa. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

Victoria runs a hotel business where she sells food and provides accommodation services. She has been in this business for six years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is competition. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy food and drinks to sell to her customers. She hopes to grow her business and, in the future, venture into the real estate business. She describes herself as God fearing.

loans.use: to buy food items and drinks.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 41 years old and is married with two children.

Leonida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like sugar and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Leonida has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Leonida aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Eldith

texts.es: Eldith, de 51 años, es una mujer buena y muy responsable, ella crió y educo a sus hijos siendo madre soltera, ahora tiene a sus hijos mayores e independientes. Tiene una casa propia el cual comparte a lado de sus dos hijos y la familia de uno de ellos. El trabajo de Eldith consiste en la venta de ropa y cosméticos por catálogo, su especialidad son las colonias y perfumes. Ella sale a la calle en busca de amigos, vecinos y familiares para vender alguna prenda, además aprovecha para vender cosméticos y perfume en general. Tiene 10 años realizando esta actividad, y lo hace sola,  ya que ella ahora solo vee por sus gastos, puesto que sus hijos le ayudan con los gastos del hogar. Por ahroa le esta yendo bien, ya que no genera muchos gastos y lo que vende le alcanza para pagar sus cosas personales. mas adelante desearía montar un negocio que es la venta de zapatos para la siguiente campaña escolar. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, le esta yendo bien con su grupo y se siente cómoda de poder trabajar juntos ya que le es de mucha ayuda los prestamos recibidos para poder aumentar su capital y trabajar mejor. Con el monto solicitado comprará más productos para tener en stock, entre ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
51-year-old Eldith is a good woman and a very responsible woman.  She raised and educated her children as a single mother.  Her children are now grown up and independent.  Eldish has her own home which she shares with her two children and the family of one of them. 

Eldith's work consists of selling clothes and cosmetics through a catalog.  Her specialty is cologne and perfume.  She goes out into the street in search of friends, neighbors and family members to sell her clothes to.  She also makes the most of the opportunity and sells cosmetics and perfume as well.  She has been in this business for 10 years and works alone because now she only has to take care of her own expenses as her children help her with the household expenses.  Right now her business is doing well as she doesn't have many expenses and what she sells serves to cover her personal needs.  In the future, she would like to set up a business selling shoes for the next school year.

This will be Eldith's third loan from MFP.  She is doing well within her group and she feels comfortable working together.  The loans she receives are very helpful to her as they allow her to increase her capital and work better.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy more products to have in stock (clothes and cosmetics).

loans.use: to buy more clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter used his previous loan to buy scrap metals, files and flax.  He was able to make more metallic doors and window frames from the raw materials (scrap metals) that he bought with the loan.  Since then, his business has improved, and hence also his living standards.

Peter hopes to become more financially stable in the future. He has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: buy a welding machine

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, four of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (her father). She lives in a rented house and her family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. Agnes has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the increasing prices of green bananas due to high transportation costs. Her aspirations and goals are to become a wholesaler of bananas at the market and also to start going to the villages of Masaka for bananas.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El socio Juan continua con su trabajo de constructor en obras; el socio realiza trabajos como albañil, el socio también trabja la tierra el socio tiene sus terrenos de cultivo de papa, en esta ocasión el socio desea abonar sus terrenos y comprar fertilizantes para la tierra, el socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes para abonar los terrenos de cultivo de papa.
texts.en: Juanis still working as a builder. He works as a bricklayer and also farms. He has lands where he grows potatoes. He now wants to buy fertilizer to fertilize his land. He is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizers for his potato crops.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fertilizers for his potato crops.

loans.name: Veronica Guadalupe

texts.es:
Verónica, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 15, 8 y 17 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de merienda y frutas, desde hace un año desempeña esta actividad, atiende sola el negocio todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, aceite, condimentos y más frutas frescas, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar el inventario y la variedad en el negocio.
La aspiración de Verónica es que su negocio prospere y junto a él sus ganancias, para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Verónica lives with her husband and three children who are 15, 8, and 17 years old.  She sells snacks and fruit for a living.  She has been doing this for a year now and she runs her business all alone every day of the week.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy corn, oil, condiments, and more fresh fruits.  These purchases will help her improve her inventory and the variety she offers in her business.

Verónica's aspiration is for her business to prosper, and her earnings along with it, so that she can help her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, condiments, and more fresh fruits

loans.name: Pamela Sharon Rose

texts.en:
Pamela Sharon Rose is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Pamela Sharon Rose has a computer shop that provides computer encoding and the photocopying of documents. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy the materials needed for the computer shop.

Pamela Sharon Rose has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed for the computer shop

loans.name: El Hadji Ousmane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune qui a arrêté ses études en classe de troisième au collège car étant le seul soutien de  ses deux parents. Il s'est lancé alors dans le transport de marchandises par charrette. Avec la saturation de ce secteur, il ne parvenait plus à assurer le versement quotidien à son employeur et à avoir un bénéfice.Il s'est alors tourné du côté du transport par motocyclette, principale moyen de déplacement dans sa ville.Après un an, il arrive à acheter sa propre moto et à épargner dans son compte ouvert à l'UIMCEC.Il parvient aussi à assurer régulièrement a dépense quotidienne pour l'entretien de sa famille. Aujourd'hui, pour améliorer ses revenus, il veut acheter une nouvelle motocyclette et  sollicite ainsi  auprès de l'UIMCEC un prêt de 400 000f.Son ambition est de constituer un parc de motocyclette de transport dans sa localité.
texts.en:
The borrower is a youth who stopped his studies in the third year of college because he was the only one supporting his two parents. So he began transporting merchandise by cart. With the saturation of this sector, he was no longer able to make the daily payments to his employer and make a profit. 

So he turned to motorcycle transport, which is the main mode of transportation in his town. After one year, he was able to buy his own motorcycle and to save in his account opened at the UIMCEC. He also manages to regularly take care of the daily expenses for the care of his family. 

Today, to improve his income, he wants to buy a new motorcycle and is thus requesting a loan of 400,000f from the UIMCEC. His goal is to set up a motorcycle transport park in his town.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 38 years old and married to Nganga with children. She has been running a retail business for the last three years earning a monthly income of 6,000 KES.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET of 15,000 KES. She will use the loan to buy hardware stock (i.e. paint and cement). She will use the profits to educate her children and expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to expand the business into a wholesale hardware shop.

loans.use: To buy hardware stock (i.e. paint and cement).

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is from Lusot, Baliangao in Misamis Occidental Province. She is 67 years old, married and has six children. She plants, harvests, and sells rice for a living, earning 3,500 PHP a month from her farming.

In 2010 Florida became a member of GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Aleyda Mariela

texts.es:
Aleyda es una mujer valiente y luchadora, tiene 37 años de edad, vive al lado de su pareja y juntos tienen 3 hijos de 15,10 y 1 añito, a quienes Aleyda quiere muchísimo y por quienes trabaja y lucha cada día para poder salir adelante y sobre todo poder brindarles una vida digna y sean personas de bien. Aleyda se dedica  a la venta de cerveza y bebidas gaseosas, viene trabajando en este negocio aproximadamente hace 2 años, ella se esfuerza tanto para que su negocio le vaya bien,  por  lo fines de semana trabaja hasta las 5 de la mañana ya que a esta hora puede vender mucho mas y tiene más pedidos de sus productos, ella se animo a tener esta clase de negocios ya que veía que se podría tener muy buenos ingresos que la ayudaran con lo que necesitaba para su hogar.

Aleyda está muy agradecida con el apoyo brindado por los prestamistas Kiva ya que con esta ayuda ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio ya que no solo quiere vender cervezas y gaseosas sino que también desea comprar dulces para vender, ya que se acerca la fiesta patronal de su ciudad y con ello podrá ver crecer aun mas su negocio para bien de su familia, lo que lo ayudará a cumplir su más anhelado  sueño: “Tener una Bodega para no tener que atender a los clientes hasta muy altas horas de la noche”.
texts.en:
Aleyda, 37, is a brave and hard-working woman. She lives with her partner and their three children aged 15, 10 and 1, whom Aleyda loves very much and for whom she works hard everyday to be successful and offer them a decent life as well-off people.

Aleyda sells beer and fizzy drinks, and has been working in this business for approximately 2 years. She works very hard and her business is going well. At weekends she works until 5 in the morning as this is the time when she can make the best sales. She has many orders for her products. She is excited to work in this type of business as she sees that she can make a good income for herself and will be able to help where needed with her home.

Aleyda is very grateful for the support offered by the Kiva lenders, as with this help she can buy more merchandise for business. She will be able to sell sweets as well as beer and fizzy drinks as they are coming close to the time of year when they celebrate her city's patron saint. This will allow her to grow her business to benefit her family and achieve her greatest dream: "To have a Bodego so she does not have to serve customers until the early hours of the morning."

loans.use: to buy beer, fizzy drinks and snacks

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Maria P. was born in Chimborazo, Ecuador. She is married and has four children, all of whom she helps support by running her small business in the Municipal de Bastión Popular – a local market for entrepreneurs in Guayaquil. She begins work at 6am and finishes by 5pm. Maria wants potential lenders to know that she has been working in this same business since she was very young when her parents first began teaching her how to run it. Her husband helps run the shop as well, but he focuses more on the purchasing and inventory side. With a $950 loan, Maria hopes to invest in marketing as well as more diverse products. The additional benefit of buying in bulk is that Maria can receive discounts from her suppliers and offer he goods at a lower price to her buyers. Ms. P. is part of a lending group formed by Mifex that includes her brother and sister, who have been successful borrowers in the past.


Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Purchase more items for the youth market like candy, toothpaste, cookies, and toys

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar is local and lives in Beylagan town. In 2002 he started the business of selling home and kitchen items. Later he built a small store. He has borrowed several loans from Normicro Beylagan branch. The last loan was in amount of $900. Now Vugar is in need of $1200 to expand the business and to increase working capital.

loans.use: To increase the capital

loans.name: Hashim

texts.en: Hashim was born in 1970 and lives with his household of 4 children in District 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a butcher shop that sales cow, sheep, and goat meat. To enlarge his shop and buy animals and equipment, he is taking a loan from AFSG. This will make his life better than it is now. In the past he faced lots of difficulties and now he is very happy with his family and feels he can improve his life in a good way.

loans.use: Buy animals and equipment

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en: N. Yasin is one of the youngest businessmen in Varkhanend village in Saatli. He started his business in 2006 when he borrowed money from his friends and opened his small food store. He wants to expand his store and purchase refrigerators with a loan of 1200 USD.

loans.use: To expand his store and purchase refrigerators

loans.name: Sutikah

texts.id:
Sutikah has realized that she has the talent to make cookies since she was a little girl playing with her friends. Now she can use that talent to help her family's economic situation. Sutikah is a master in making donuts, and from her business, Sutikah makes about $5 profit daily from $10 starting capital. She supplies the donut she makes to the vendors in nearby markets. She says that demand increases sharply during Ramadhan and Muslim fasting month. So she needs extra labor help, that she usually gets from her neighbors.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

kemampuannya untuk meracik bahan untuk membuat kue sudah dirasakan Sutikah sejak kecil ketika bermain bersama teman-temannya, bahkan bakat itu sekarang bisa menunjang perekonomian keluargannya. Sutikah ahli dalam membuat kue donat dan dari usahanya tersebut Sutikah mampu meraup keuntungan 50.000 dari modal 100.000 rupiah/hari. kue donat tersebut dmasukan ke penjual-penjual kue yang ada di pasar-pasar terdekat, menurutnya biasanya kalau mendekati bulan puasa dan ramadhan pesanan bisa meningkat tajam dan kalau sudah demikian maka Sutika membutuhkan tenaga extra yang dapat membantunya yaitu tetangganya.

loans.use: purchase cake ingredient

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva is a single mother and has had to work very to keep her family moving forward. She has two children, ages 15 and 18. Eva is a very hard-working woman, but the salary she was earning couldn't make ends meet. So, along with her sister, she decided to open a beauty salon 17 years ago. Little by little, they were able to better supply and set up the business, and now they have a large list of customers.

Eva wants to provide a high-quality service to her clients, and for this reason she is requesting a loan of $650, which she will use to purchase necessary equipment. She plans to repay the loan within six months. Eva and her family are sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Eva es madre soltera y ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a su familia ella sola, tiene dos hijos de 15 y 18 años de edad. Eva es una mujer muy trabajadora y con el salario que obtenía no podía solventar sus gastos, así que junto con su hermana decidieron abrir una estética hace 17 años, poco a poco fueron surtiendo y acondicionando mejor su negocio, ahora ya cuentan con un amplia clientela.

Eva desea ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y por esto solicita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos y equipo que necesita en su negocio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar, decídete a apoyarla, Eva y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for beauty salon

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Mr. Yawo Y. is 24 years old and sells T-shirts, jeans, and other men's wear. He is very happy with this business and with his people skills, he could well attract additional clientele. Unfortunately, his present financial means do not allow him to meet all his customers' needs. If he does not remedy this situation, he risks losing that clientele. With this situation in mind, Mr. Yawo Y. is requesting a loan of US$ 300 so that he can expand his inventory, buying new styles and thus attracting and keeping a broader range of customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Agé de 24 ans, Monsieur Yawo Y. est revendeur de T-shirt, et Jean pantalon et autre habits d’homme. Il aime bien son commerce et avec son accueil il pu avoir plus de clientèle. Avec ses moyens de bord, il n’arrive pas à satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle. Si rien n’est fait il risque de les perdre. Très soucieux de sa situation, Monsieur Y. Yawo sollicite un crédit de $300 pour s’approvisionner en quantité et en nouveaux afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et de les fidéliser.

loans.use:
Expand his inventory of men's wear
S'approvisionner en marchandises

loans.name: Tasneem

texts.en: I request a loan of $175 for my husband’s grocery store. He needs this loan to buy necessary items for his store that are out of stock. I am a mother of an only girl who studies in grade five. We are both very hopeful to give our daughter a bright future.

loans.use: Buy items for the store

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Mrs. Milagros del Carmen is a great clothing vendor. She sells from a stall at the Micaela market and her good customer service and respect for her customers make this jovial and active woman the best vendor at the market. She is the mother of four children who are studying for technical careers at a prestigious training center in the city. She hopes that they finish their studies that they have begun. She would like to keep progressing with her business and in order to increase her sales she would appreciate some capital which will help her achieve her goal. With your support Mrs. Milagros del Carmen will succeed in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Milagros del Carmen, es una gran vendedora de ropas, ella vende en un puesto del mercado Micaela, su buena atención y el respeto a sus clientes hacen de esta mujer activa y jovial, la mejor vendedora del mercado. Es madre de cuatro hijos, los mismos que estudian carreras técnicas en un prestigioso centro de formación de su ciudad y su deseo es que culminen satisfactoriamente lo que se han propuesto. Desea seguir progresando con su negocio y para incrementar sus ventas estima de un capital de trabajo, el cual la ayudará a cumplir su meta. Con tu apoyo doña Milagros del Carmen logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Increase capital to increase sales

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Nat and his wife (both seen in this picture) have been married since 1996. They have two children -- one son and one daughter. Their daughter is studying at the local school and the son is still young and stays at home.

Nat has run Motor Remoque taxi for many years. He carries goods and people from his village to Phnom Penh.

He also fishes at the lake near his house for fish to sell and has been growing rice since 1987. His wife is a garment factory worker.

Nat and his family live along national road number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

He is requesting his third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $500. He will use this money for repairing his house and growing rice.

loans.use: For growing rice and repairing his house

loans.name: Haša

texts.en: Haša is a housewife with three children who lives in the town of Tešanj. Her husband has a full-time job, but his salary is not enough to support five people.  Haša is seeking a loan of $975 to buy additional clothing to sell in the local market.  By expanding her business in this way, she hopes to earn additional income for her family.

loans.use: Buying additional clothes to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Zineta

texts.en:
Zineta was born in 1957 and is married with two children, one of which goes to primary school. She is from a small village, Čajno, near the town Visoko. Neither she nor her husband have a job. Together they do agricultural work, and this is their only source of income. They can earn about 700 KM monthly.

This is Zineta's first loan, in the amount of 1450 KM, and she will use this loan to buy food for the livestock.

loans.use: To buy food for livestock.

loans.name: Jeannine

texts.fr:
Born around 1944 in Djakotome, in the Mono department in southwest Benin, Mrs. Jeannine E. currently lives in Cotonou with her two children, Mica and Gérard, who are a junior and sophomore, respectively, at Vedoko Collège d’Enseignement Général high school. Mrs. Jeannine E. buys bags of cashew nuts, grills them, peels them, fries them in butter and then sells them wholesale and retail. Recently, the price of a bag of cashew nuts has gone from 25,000 to 38,000 CFA francs, so she is having serious trouble buying enough cashew nuts to satisfy her customers. She is thus requesting this loan to face this increase in the price of cashew nuts and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1944 à DJAKOTOME dans le département de MONO au Sud-ouest du BENIN, dame E. Jeannine vit actuellement à COTONOU avec 2 enfants Mica et Gérard respectivement en classe de Seconde et de Troisième au Collège d’Enseignement Général VEDOKO. Dame E. Jeannine achète des sacs de noix d’anacarde, les grille, les épluche, les frit au beurre et les revend en gros et en détail. Actuellement le sac de noix d’anacarde est passé de 25000 à 38 francs. Ainsi, elle éprouve de sérieuses difficultés pour acheter les noix d’anacarde pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle sollicite donc ce crédit pour faire face à cette hausse de prix du sac d’acajou afin de satisfaire au mieux ses clients.

loans.use: Purchase of three bags of cashew nuts

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married to a wonderful lady, Lesya, and he has two beautiful kids, Bogdan and Natalya. The family of four lives in Drogobych, a picturesque resort area of Western Ukraine. Oleg understands that, as the head of the family, the burden is on him to work hard in order to provide for his family and their basic needs. He sells sports inventory, which is always in high demand in this famous mountain and ski resort area. Oleg’s business is characterized by certified quality products, reasonable prices, and a whole network of small vending locations in the region.

Oleg remembers how miserable the situation in the sports inventory market was after the collapse of the Soviet Union. Fortunately, a new wave of interest in sports came about in 2000. Around that time, Oleg opened his first sporting goods store, which he named “Planeta Sportu” (“Sport Planet”). Currently, he has about $6,000 in inventory, and his gross income is over $1,500. Oleg has two profitable vending locations in two different towns: Drogobych and Truskavets. Moreover, he is planning to open a third vending location in the town of Stryi. Therefore, Oleg is seeking a loan to purchase quality stands for his new store so that he can have a nice arrangement of merchandise, which he believes would be another boon to his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise stands to be used at a new vending location
